column10: Dushmanta and Susan are the team you want on your safari
column12:
We recently had an amazing stay at Uga Chena Huts; the room, bed and food were just gorgeous but what really made our trip was the extraordinary attentiveness and kindness of the staff and getting to see the animals in their habitat.  While there are many great people there who went above and beyond, I have to make mention of our safari guide and driver whose knowledge and love of animals will stay with us forever.
Dushmantha was our guide and Supan was our driver for 3 days, twice a day, we were SO lucky to have them.  
While some of the tour guides just want to see an elephant in order to make their clients happy and get a better tip, Dushmantha clearly had a deep respect and love for the animals. With Supan pointing out the tinniest exotic bird that only a trained eye could see, and Dushmanta‚Äôs knowledge of the animals and the terrain, we were in awe from start to finish.  Yes, we saw a leopard [very rare], and elephants, which was so exciting but it was almost as exciting to see the buffalo neck deep in water and hear Dushmanta tell us why they do this [they have a certain oil that insects are attracted to so need the water to get the bugs off them].  We learned so much on this trip of a lifetime and when we go back there will be no other guide for us than Dushmanta.
Just one other note, one day there was a big family of Grey Langur monkeys on the beach in front of Uga Chena; they ran up to the interior pond of the resort and we were able to just hang out next to them for almost two hours [people do not feed them so they do not have the bad behaviors that you see in places that tourists do]. What a glorious trip.
column13: Best safari tour guide and fabulous accommodations

column12: Unique property with beach and wilderness feels. Spacious well lit , clean and well furbished rooms. Would have given 5 stars had the food been slightly better. The chef did his best to accommodate our food requests but for a property charging as much as they do our food expectations were more and i think they can improve on that. Apart from that cannot fault the service , the location , the naturalists who accompanied us for the safaris. Would recommend this property and if you are a vegetarian give your food preferences before visiting to have a better overall experience.
column13: Great place with room for improvement for vegetarian food.

column12:
The service and the food is amazing. We enjoyed our one night at Uga Chena Huts

We were treated to lunch as soon as we arrived and then went on to check in and then on a safari

When we got back they served us drinks on the beach and then we got ready for dinner

The food is beautifully decorated and very tasty. The service is fantastic!

column108:
Always the breeze ‚Äì the sun is warm ‚Äì the sea and the sky are blue ‚Äì the vegetation‚Ä¶ lush - elephants are roaming - people are smiling. Sounds heavenly to me!

The spirit of Uga Chena Huts keeps us being drawn back.  For us, undoubtedly, the finest boutique hotel in the country. It has got everything ‚Äì wildlife, stunning isolated beach, fengshui architecture giving one a sense of  expanse and lightness, exquisite cuisine, and last but not least ever smiling and passionate staff, most of whom have been there since the inception.

column12: This is one of the most lovely resorts I've ever visited.  Any description of it cannot do it justice as it's just so wonderful.  The "huts" are amazing, spacious, beautiful and wonderfully comfortable.  Everything one could want is there.  The food at the restaurant is simply outstanding.  The staff is warm and friendly.  The location is amazing for visiting Yala National Park.  Everything was perfect and it was a joy and privilege to visit this amazing property.  Great job and thank you!!!

column12:
If I could give Uga Chena 1000 stars, I absolutely would! My husband and I initially booked just one night, but within 10 minutes of our arrival, we knew we had to extend our stay.

Everything about our visit was wonderful. Our room was beautiful, the food was delicious, and we loved the complimentary game drive. The staff went above and beyond, always kind and attentive, and we particularly enjoyed the cocktails at the Chena Bar.

Staying so close to the wilderness was an incredible experience. One evening, right after sunset, we witnessed a wild elephant crossing the resort‚Äîa truly unforgettable moment! The rangers ensured our safety, allowing us to enjoy the experience without worry.

If we return to Sri Lanka, Uga Chena will be our first choice. Highly recommend!

column12: Stayed at Uga Chena Huts (this is the 4th Uga in 6 days) - knew it would be good  as all Uga hotels are but we‚Äôve been blown away, special thanks to Nissanka for a very warm welcome and reception- the whole experience was truly exceptional, this is an all inclusive hotel and normally that rings alarms bells because the food and drink is of a lower quality, suffice to say that I‚Äôve never had all inclusive hotel food as good in my life, it was pretty much- Fine Dining !  Can‚Äôt quite get my head around how good it was, I know Sri Lankan food is good but this was off the scale!

column10: The hotel is steps away from the beach/ocean but not to be used for swimming, etc because it is within the buffer zone of the park.
column12: Our family of 4 had a wonderful experience at Uga Chena. The rooms were amazing and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Indhi made sure we had everything we needed and Gayan, our Ranger, provided two wonderful safari tours. We saw just about everything.....elephants, a python, leopard, crocodiles, deer, a sloth bear, monkeys, and more!  We would highly recommend Uga Chena to anyone looking for a wonderful safari experience and accomodations to match.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
This place was paradise!

I didn‚Äôt want to leave! There was an elephant on the beach when we arrived for drinks the late afternoon which was so cool!

Food & Drinks 10/10 ‚Äì this was a la carte, absolutely delicious‚Ä¶ it was like dining at a top tier restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

Hotel 10/10 ‚Äì you are wowed everywhere you turned

Room/ plunge pool 9.5/10 ‚Äì The pool had leaves and some dirt in it but it was clean enough and refreshing ‚Äì big enough to do a few laps. The veranda area was comfortable, we spent a lot of time here. The bed‚Ä¶ I didn‚Äôt want to get out, it was so comfortable! The entire space was clean, smelt like you are in a spa and we were able to hook up our phones to play some music. The mini bar option were exceptional.

Safari 10/10 ‚Äì The safari was fantastic, with certified rangers who were very knowledgeable. They brought food and refreshments, and I think the other cars around us were jealous of our morning feast!

The Team 10/10 ‚Äì I have no words, they were exceptional! To customise your stay I think they ensure they have a member of the team that speaks the guest language, they do take a picture of you with your country flag (just for staff information), as far as I am aware it‚Äôs not share externally, but I thought this was a cute touch. They were so accommodating, and made you feel safe at all times ‚Äì the resort was in the reserve and its open to all animals, so you can see what Yala National Park has install for you! I will definitely go back.

Negative
Nothing‚Ä¶ nothing at all and I am a fussy person!
column13: Heaven - I didn't want to leave!!

column12: We had a great stay at the Uga Chena huts Yala. The Ranger Sandun is a one of a kind. He was great with our 5 years old son who asked loads of questions. The hut (room) was very big and had an excellent taste of interior. The staff extensively friendly and professional.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12: My travel agent promised me that the experience justified the price and she wasn‚Äôt wrong. Uga Chena is simply unique. The rooms are jaw-dropping, the situation (part jungle/part beach) extraordinary, the food remarkable given the remote location and, best of all, the  staff were just superb. Every single one of them. But special mentions must go to the delightful Chinthaka in the restaurant for whom nothing was too much trouble and our safari guide Janith who conjured up the highlight of our trip in spotting, not one, but two separate leopards on a single game drive. We feel so privileged to have seen them and so lucky to have had the opportunity to stay at Uga Chena Huts.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
This hotel is amazing, don't think about it, just go!

- The staff are the kindest and most attentive we've met. They anticipate, adapt, are proactive and are exceptionally kind. Whether it's the waiters (special thanks to the king of kings Chinthaka but also to Nuwan & Chamara), the Rangers and their detailed explanations, the cleaning staff or the reception staff, they make the experience truly unique.
- The food is delicious and varied. You'll find great Western and local dishes on the menu at every meal. Special thanks to the chef for his special creations.
- the individual huts are magnificent, clean and very pleasant.
- the safaris are very interesting and you can see dozens of animals (elephants, crocodiles, leopards etc) in sumptuous landscapes.
- finally, thank you again to the staff for all the little personal touches and activities they offered us.

In short, everything was perfect, you don't have to think about anything and just enjoy this timeless

We stayed here for two nights . It was such an excellent safari luxury hotel. üòç

The staff went above and beyond to make all guests feel at home. üòòüòò Thank you Indie & your team üòçyou made me cry üò¢ how beautiful this place really is! It‚Äôs a must try for luxury specials! Anniversaries, Birthdays üéâ & even honeymoons! üòâ

We booked it as all-inclusive - and the food ü•ò was just something special üòçüòò- especially the breakfasts & Dinners were exceptionally good.üëçüèΩ 

The hotel is so near the national park that wild animals wander into the hotel . üè® 

We saw elephants üêò several times - & loads of other animals! We were delighted ü§© to have a two day tour of the jungle!ü•∞

We were really hoping to see the leopard üêÜ but thought this is in once of a life time ! & probably requires more than two days stay!  We were delighted ü§© to see Lucas the leopard üêÜ üòçüòòwe were amazed truly!

We also saw a little family of wild boars, Deers, ü¶ö peacocks, Crocodiles üêä, a king fishers , Buffaloes ü¶¨ & Storks. But it‚Äôs 100% safe with lots of staff on the hotel taking care that there is no danger. ‚ö†Ô∏è ‚ÄºÔ∏è 

The room was extremely luxurious . It was well worth the high price !

column12:
Exactly what it‚Äôs advertised as. Uga chena huts is the epitome of luxury, the beautiful rooms and breathtaking views across the resort knows no bounds.

We had the most memorable experience here, from the safari, private pool deck and not to mention the most outstanding food and drink. Sri Lankan hospitality is second to none and we were made to feel so welcome throughout our stay.

We can‚Äôt wait to return!

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
An escape into the wilderness, taking our imaginations far beyond and sending us into a tranquil space full of beautiful landscapes, wildlife and soul nourishment. 
The staff is excellent in their hospitality and intuitive approach to service. They made us feel so much at home and took care of us very well. 
The villa was stunning, surrounded by magnificent view of the forest and every moment spent in the villa was so relaxing with energising. I loved the soothing nature sounds. 
The food vegetarian and non vegetarian was one of the best we ever had. Organic, palatable and vibrant flavours left us mesmerised with the offerings. While we ate its often we had elephants, monkeys, squirrels at a safe distance for us to see and marvel at the beauty of the place. 
The safari experience was on of a kind in Yala national park with elephants, leopard, crocodiles, birds and other exotic wildlife.
The sundowner with the fire ritual was an amazing experience in itself. 
Coming from a busy life Uga chena huts provides the perfect reset and energising space. 
Highly recommend and would come back.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
We spent 3 nights at Chena Huts, by far the best hotel we've stayed in! Food, cocktails and service were simply amazing. Nuwan our safari guide was so knowledgeable and patient, our boys were in awe. 

A special thank you to all of the restaurant staff particularly Nuwan and Chinthaka, and we can't forget to mention Salman who magically appeared with his buggy to transport us all to and from our safari truck, always with a funny story and a smile.

Can't wait to come again, and to explore all of the other Uga resorts! This hotel has created wonderful memories for our family.

A place we have visited twice and hope to do so again ‚ù§

My wife, my daughter and myself visited this amazing hotel in July 2024. Hotel Chena Huts in Palatupana is an excellent hotel in every aspects, which I have ever visited. 
The hotel is extremely stunning, combining with aesthetic beauty with ultimate comfort.

The staff in the hotel are exceptionally professional and very courteous and always ready to help with a smile. Every one is warm, welcoming and went above and beyond to ensure our comfort.
Thank you for providing such a wonderful stay and I will highly recommend this incredibly beautiful hotel.

Dr.Janappriya and family.

column12:
Absolutely outstanding hotel. Probably the best we have ever stayed in. The service from staff was discreet and attentive. The food was to die for. And the rooms are absolutely beautiful and private. Sundowners on the beach are great fun with some unique house cocktails. 

We had such fun on 2 safaris with our knowledgeable and engaging guide who was able to find so many animals inckuding the highly elusive leopards. We cannot thank the staff enough for their wonderful care and attention to detail. Will definitely return.

column12: The staff were very attentive, the location is stupendous and  the huts achieve a combination of luxury and safari vibe. Smooth organisation of two safari trips with a very knowledgeable guide who spoke great English. Cocktails at sundown are a must.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
The property is beautiful and nestled in the buffer zone of the Yala National park, giving it a sense of seclusion. The entire experience is flawless from the welcome to the point of departure. The resident Manager Nissanka and his staff make you feel so at home. It is always the people that make the difference when it comes to a great experience and that is certainly what the Chena Huts did. 

The food is simply delicious and as a traveler with multiple allergies they were able to accommodate all my requirements without compromising on quality.

The game drive with ranger Gayan was very exciting and educational. His knowledge and passion for wildlife made it very enjoyable.

A big thank you to the restaurant staff Nimantha, Gayan and Chinthaka who were always smiling and extremely accommodating.

The front office executive Saleem was there on a daily basis to ensure that all our requirements were taken care of.

A must do if you are visiting the Yala National Park.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
Amazing stay at Uga Chena Huts.
Everything was perfect here. The staff, hospitality, food and the comforts of the hut was phenomenal. 
Game drives to the Yala national park was a treat. We could see lot of elephants, a leopard and a sloth bear among all the other creatures and birds. Thanks Sadhun and Nuwan.
It was a great experience when an elephant tried to come in when we were having dinner outside in the open. But he did not hurt anybody and went along his way.
The food here is probably one of the best places of traditional food.Hats off to chef Nuwan. The service was excellent and we felt we were treated very special. Thanks to Salman, Nimantha and all the rest of the staff. 
Highly recommend this place. We will go back again.
column13: Amazing stay close to Yala National park.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
We took a quick R&R trip to Sri Lanka and spent 3 nights at a tea estate in Nuwara Eliya before heading to Uga Chena for another 3 nights. While the 5-star tea estate was lovely, we found ourselves wishing we had spent all 6 days at Uga Chena‚Äîit was that fantastic!

Location: 10/10
Best of both worlds! You're on a beach but also next to a wildlife sanctuary! What more could you ask for? 

Accommodation: 10/10
The hotel is very beautiful, big well appointed rooms, the bed linens used are of high quality. With your full package, the rooms are always well stocked and have everything you'll need to have a comfortable stay. Every time we came back from breakfast, lunch and dinner - our rooms would have been made up! 

We never had to tell the reception even once that we need house-keeping! As soon as we stepped out of our rooms, it seems that magically, little elves would go and tidy up your rooms! So that when you got back, you'd have cool, clean and refreshed rooms! 

Management: 10/10 
Not just the rooms though, be it the bar area, dining areas, beach and sundowner areas or even be it the walkaways to your room - all are cleaned and raked and well maintained - but never that you feel you're in an artificially manicured place. It's all natural and beautiful! 

Kudos to the management! This is an extremely well managed and maintained property! 

Food: 10/10
Chef Nuwan was so good - not only was our dining experience fantastic but Chef was so gracious and accommodating! You could ask for something that's off the menu and he'd whip it out for you! Everything from breakfast, to lunch, sundowners and dinners - all were fantastic! Thanks chef for the excellent Crab Curry! 

Staff: 11/10!
Everyone was so good! Polite, friendly and efficient! No matter your ask, they catered to it, and that too always with a smile! Special thanks to Nimantha, Chamra**, Gayal, Kaushika and Indi and so many others! All were fantastic and made our stay super special! 

** I hope I got the spellings right!

Wildlife: 10/10
Yala National Park is beautiful, with lakes, lagoons, and diverse wildlife. Our ranger, Jayaba, was excellent, helping us spot leopards, elephants, and many other animals. The landscape is dense, making wildlife spotting more challenging, but Jayaba made it an enjoyable experience.

We travel frequently and have stayed at fantastic properties, but Uga Chena was a delightful surprise. My enthusiastic review reflects how much we loved our stay. If you're considering Uga Chena, don't hesitate. We will definitely be back!

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12:
We stayed at Uga Chena Huts as part of a 17-day trip to Sri Lanka for our 30th Wedding Anniversary. Not only was this hotel the highlight of our holiday, it's simply the best hotel we have ever stayed in.
We were due to stay for 3 nights but within a few hours of arriving we changed our plans and added an extra night on to our stay here.
Everything about the hotel is perfect. The location and the safari's were excellent, the staff were so friendly and helpful, the food is outstanding, the room and pool were superb and the whole feel of the place is so relaxing.
The restaurant staff set up a lovely table on the beach for our anniversary, only interrupted for a few minutes as an elephant came within a few yards of the table while we were eating!
We can't speak highly enough of all of the staff, who made it so special, including Reception, everyone in the restaurant and the bar, the housekeeping staff and the rangers and drivers on the safari's.
We will definitely be coming back again.

All the waters were great especially Chinthaka who took time to explain some of the history of the area. The safaris with Jabaya were amazing he‚Äôs the most knowledgeable safari guide we‚Äôve had and made each outing memorable. The rooms were superb. It was expensive but certainly provides great value for money. Many thanks also to Indi who was always welcoming and helpful. A perfect resort for families, honey mooners or couples.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column10: While on safari we were told to avoid white and told to wear neutral colours like beige, black, green, blue.
column12:
Hands down the best hotel experience we have had. We travelled from Australia as a family of 2 adults and 2 kids and stayed for 2 nights. 
As soon as our van pulled up in front of the car park everything was taken care of.
Our bags were ‚Äúmagically‚Äù transported to the room straight from the van while we were checking in and having welcome drinks.
We were assigned a dedicated ranger  and a driver for our safaris. Our ranger, Gayan, was extremely knowledgeable and his tracking skills combined with our driver Vimuthi‚Äôs driving skills meant that we saw a leopard on our very first game drive.
The food was scrumptious with options to suit adults and my less adventurous kids. The chef was also kind enough to whip up some off the menu items at request.
All the staff were professional and kind with special mentions to Lahili and Kasun.
A fabulous all around experience!

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}

We also moved to Cinnamon Yala and there is nothing to compare‚Ä¶ Cinnamon is also a good hotel, but this one is luxury and individual approach.

column12:
The hotel is an all inclusive paradise. They truly care for you and pamper you. The hotel staff was very courteous.

Meals - excellent food. the only improvement is for the breakfast the Sri Lankan range should not mix everything together as a platter and the accompaniments for each food item is different.

Sundown moment - this was a wonderful experience.

All inclusive - the selection of wines and liquor was really good.

Room and Amenities - Excellent. 

Safari and guide - this was also really well organized. the Ranger also was knowledgeable. an improvement here - the morning pastry and snack was not that fresh - and the vegetable filling was not tasty.

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12: Uga Chena Huts is an incredible blend of luxury and nature. Nestled within Yala National Park, each hut offers modern comforts and a private plunge pool, creating a perfect retreat after thrilling safaris. The service is top-notch, with staff going above and beyond to ensure an unforgettable stay. The dining experience is exceptional, featuring a delicious mix of Sri Lankan and international cuisine, often enjoyed under the stars. The safaris are a highlight, with knowledgeable guides who enhance the experience of seeing leopards, elephants, and a variety of birds. The location, with its private beach and proximity to the park, makes you feel truly immersed in the wild. For those seeking both adventure and relaxation, Uga Chena Huts is a must-visit.
column13: A Hidden Gem in Sri Lanka's Wilderness

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column12: Everything about this hotel was amazing! We stayed here for our honeymoon and couldn't fault a single thing! Beds were comfortable, rooms were cleaned at least twice a day whilst you were out and about/eating at the restaurant, the staff couldn't do enough for you and were extremely helpful with any queries you had. The food for lunch and dinner changed every day so there was a wide variety, every single meal was incredible. The chef even come and saw you after eating to see if everything was up to standard. As for our ranger/driver for the safaris.. they were both incredible at their jobs and made us feel super safe on each ride. The knowledge they had and passed onto us was incredible and really made the trip even more amazing for us. They also took us to some amazing views for our snacks each day, it's the little things! We would definitely recommend to anyone who asks to stay here. Thank you to the Chena Huts team!

column10: Enjoy everything - take as many safaris as possible!
column12: This is an exceptional resort. The site is quiet and remote with amazing accommodation. Staff friendly and efficient. Rooms quiet and secluded. Meals on a terrace overlooking the ocean. Excellent quality and choice. Ideal location for safaris - morning and evening. Our ranger was amazing - the reserve is close by and an exceptional resource. The ranger tailored the trips to our requirements looking for birds, leopard, sloth bear, elephant etc. All successful. An ideal resort.
column13: Excellent resort, with perfect staff and facilities. Cannot recommend more highly!

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column10: Arrive immediately when you can check in and check out as late as possible. It's amazing!
column12: What an amazing property!  We travel- ALOT!  And this is probably the best resort we have ever stayed at.  Customer service is amazing, property and grounds are breathtaking, the hut was top-notch, the food was exquisite!  We also did 2 safaris- and both were led by well-informed rangers.  We were lucky enough to see quite a few animals and birds on both of our safaris.  We also used the spa for messages, and my husband will tell you it was the best message he's ever had.  I cannot say enough about the friendliness of the staff, the hut itself, and our fabulous experience.  Well worth the money and we would definitely stay here again- if we ever have the opportunity to return to Sri Lanka!

column12:
Our stay at the Uga Chena Resort was simply unforgettable and easily the highlight of our entire trip! The warm hospitality extended by Salman and the entire team made our stay incredibly enjoyable. We are eagerly looking forward to our next visit and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this resort to our friends.

Special shoutout to the resort's ranger, Dushmantha. His knowledge and expertise during our safari made the experience truly remarkable. His evident passion and love for the animals added an extra layer of enjoyment to our adventure. Uga Chena is indeed fortunate to have him on their team.

We are more than happy to award a five-star rating to Uga Chena Resort. A fantastic experience that we will not forget!
column13: Unforgettable Stay at Uga Chena Resort

column6: {'id': '8871806', 'name': 'Uga Chena Huts', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1093, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.264492, 'longitude': 81.41136, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d8871806-Reviews-Uga_Chena_Huts-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.ugaescapes.com/chenahuts/', 'address': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wildlife Tourism Zone', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 39, 'count5': 1042}}
column10: You cant order food to be brought to your room. But that is understandable as you are staying almost inside the Forest.
column12:
It was an amazing experience staying at Uga Chena Huts.
Firstly the location: Uga Chena Huts has around 18 Huts/Cabins which are all locatedin the Buffer Zone of Yala National Park. So it is not uncommon for an Elephant or other wildlife like Boars or Monkeys to be found in or around the Resort. The Cabins were modern and extremely well designed. Modern world comfort in the Forest, while maintaining eco-friendly practice. We were very comfortable and relaxed during our entire stay there.
The Food: They have one Restaurant and a Bar. The food, simply put, was delicious and refreshing. We had a chance to eat various local dishes, but made with a nice twist to it. The Chef and his Team was very accomodative and would ensure the dishes are made to your liking and requirements. Hats off to Chef Nuwan for the food. While the staff in the Restaurant were all great, our waiter Chamara was brilliant. They made going to the Restaurant something to eagerly look forward to.
Safari: While we were there my family went on Safari's organised by the Management itself. Our Ranger/Guide during these safari's was Mr. Nuwan who was walking encyclopedia made the entire experience highly informative and interesting. He had the eyes of a hawk. Spotting animals, even the smallest ones, perfectly. He ensured that we were able to spot a Leopard, on two separate occasions.
Apart from the above I also have to give credit to the Staff in the Front Desk, which includes Indhi, Salman, Dinuka and Kaushik. They were friendly, helpful and took sincere efforts to ensure our stay was most comfortable. I truly believe as much as the location and the infrastructure of the Resort was excellent, a bigger plus was the staff who took care of us.
Thank you
I would highly recommend staying at Uga Chena Huts.
Hope to go back there in the future.

column12: Great hospitality by this fantastic team, was greeted and welcomed by the hotel manager himself, Mr. Tharindu (Restaurant and bar manager) Executive chef Mr. Nandana and many more names i unfortunately missed. was a fantastic experience in the wild and if you ever wish to witness sri lankan hospitality at its finest i advise you to visit this wonderful property rich with great service and mostly the staff making every minute comfortable and they went above and beyond exceeding expectations. thank you again to the cinnamon wild team for making my stay really unforgettable. will keep coming back for more.

column5:
{'id': '974823991', 'text': "Dear Anuki,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

It's fantastic to hear that your stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was such a rejuvenating experience! Our resort's natural beauty and peaceful ambiance are ideal for escaping the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

I'm delighted to know that you were welcomed so warmly by our team. Sandu and Thilina's friendly demeanor and the exceptional service provided by our nature trail guides, Kasun, Sampath, Sudath, and Gayan, are just a few examples of the personalized attention we strive to offer our guests.

The nature walk to the sand dune and the wildlife sightings during your safari must have been unforgettable. Our team's passion for nature and wildlife is evident in their dedication to providing unique and immersive experiences.

We're also pleased to hear that you enjoyed our dining options. Sahan and his team's excellent service, combined with Chef Manjula's culinary expertise, ensure that our guests have a memorable dining experience.

Your mention of our security measures is appreciated. We prioritize the safety and well-being of our guests, and we're glad that you felt secure during your stay.

Thank you for choosing Cinnamon Wild Yala for your getaway. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future and continuing to provide unforgettable experiences.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-21', 'responder': 'Lashanthan Gopalan', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column12:
My stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was the perfect escape from work to relax and recharge. The resort‚Äôs location and stunning scenery added to the experience, making it a truly memorable getaway.
I‚Äôd like to express my gratitude to the Resort Manager Lashanthan for being so welcoming. The staff at the reception were very efficient. Thank you to Sandu and Thilina who were so friendly and always interacted with the guests with a smile.
The team from Cinnamon Nature Trails‚ÄîKasun, Sampath, Sudath, Gayan‚Äîwas outstanding. They were so kind and their love towards nature and wildlife was evident. We went on a nature walk to a breathtaking sand dune with Sudath, where we saw elephant footprints on the beach, a first for me! The walk and safari they organised became the highlight of the trip, with sightings of wildlife and magical views of the evening sky.
Dining was also a delight, thanks to Sahan and his team, who provided excellent service. Chef Manjula and his team served up exceptional meals, with the Sri Lankan buffet deserving special recognition. Ananda‚Äôs creative cocktails added to the overall experience.
Additionally, I appreciated how seriously the resort takes the security of its guests, which made us feel safe throughout.
Overall, my stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was both relaxing and unforgettable, and I eagerly look forward to visiting again!

column12:
This was our family‚Äôs first visit to Cinnamon Wild Yala, and it was everything we could have hoped for. The location was perfect, with breathtaking views that made it feel like we were in the heart of nature.

A big thank you to Resort Manager Lashanthan for making us feel so welcome. Sandu and Thilina at the Front Office were very pleasant and professional, they made our check-in and check-out smooth.

The team from Cinnamon Nature Trails‚ÄîKasun, Sudath, Gayan, and Sampath‚Äîmade our outdoor adventures unforgettable. Sudath took us on a fun nature walk to the sand dunes. The safari they arranged was the highlight of our trip.

Dining was another great experiece. Sahan and the F&B team made sure we were well taken care of, and Chef Manjula‚Äôs delicious meals were a hit with all of us. Ananda‚Äôs unique cocktails were also one of the highlights of our trip. The Crested Hawk Eagle and the Jungle Fowl are must try cocktaiks at the resort.

We also want to thank Chanaka from housekeeping, who added such a lovely touch by decorating the beds with flowers.

Our stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala gave us the perfect mix of relaxation, adventure, and quality family time. We felt safe and right at home. We can‚Äôt wait to come back for more unforgettable experiences.
column13: One of the best stays ever.

column12:
This was my first visit to Cinnamon Wild Yala, and I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better experience. The location is great and the scenery is absolutely beautiful.

A special thanks to Resort Manager Lashanthan for his warm hospitality. Sandu and Thilina from the Front Office also deserve a shout out for making us feel right at home from the moment we stepped in. They facilitated a smooth check-in and check-out.

I‚Äôd like to thank Chanaka from housekeeping. His thoughtful touch of decorating the beds with flowers was truly appreciated and added a nice personal flair to our stay.

The team from Cinnamon Nature Trails‚ÄîKasun, Sudath, Gayan, and Sampath‚Äîwere fantastic. Sudath led us on a memorable nature walk to the sand dune and the beach was stunning. They also organised our safari, which turned out to be the most memorable part of our trip.

column12:
This was my second stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala, and it was just as enjoyable as the first. A big thank you to Lashanthan, the resort manager, for his warm hospitality throughout our time there.

I‚Äôd also like to mention Sandu and Thilina from the Front Office team, who made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived. They ensured everything went smoothly with our check-in and check-out, which made the process hassle free for my family and me.

I would also like to thank Chanaka from the housekeeping team, who did a fantastic job keeping our rooms spotless. He even decorated the beds beautifully with flowers, which was a lovely touch that we really appreciated.

The team from Cinnamon Nature Trails‚ÄîKasun, Sudath, Gayan, and Sampath‚Äîare an interesting bunch and are truly passionate about what they do. Sudath made our nature walk to the sand dune really enjoyable, and the ocean view was stunning. They also did a great job organising our safari, which was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

Sahan and the F&B team ensured we were well taken care of during meals, with friendly and attentive service throughout the day. Chef Manjula and his team treated us to some delicious dishes. The Sri Lankan dishes really were delicious‚Äîfresh, flavourful, and comforting, like a good homemade meal.

I must also mention Ananda and his creative cocktails, packed with unique local flavours. They were unlike anything I‚Äôve tried before‚Äîdefinitely worth experiencing if you visit.

Overall, our stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was relaxing and memorable. The thoughtful service, good food, and beautiful surroundings made it a trip to remember. We‚Äôre already looking forward to coming back!
column13: One of the best vacations ever

column5:
{'id': '974824817', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback about your recent stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala. We appreciate your honest assessment.

We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed the peaceful and secluded atmosphere of our resort, as well as the cleanliness of your room and the friendly service provided by our staff. We're also glad that you appreciated our bar, rooftop bar, and the quality of our cocktails and breakfast.

Regarding your feedback on the amenities in the Jungle Chalet room, we apologize for any inconvenience caused. We're continually working to enhance our guest experience and will take your comments into consideration for future improvements.

We understand your concerns about the swimming pool and stray dogs. While we strive to maintain a clean and safe environment, we acknowledge that there may be challenges in a remote location. We'll investigate this matter further to ensure the well-being of our guests.

We appreciate your willingness to try other hotels in the area. While we're disappointed that you won't be returning to Cinnamon Wild Yala, we hope that your future experiences in Sri Lanka are enjoyable. Thank you again for your feedback

Your sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan

column6: {'id': '638092', 'name': 'Cinnamon Wild Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3758, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.259364, 'longitude': 81.40433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d638092-Reviews-Cinnamon_Wild_Yala-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/cinnamonwildyala', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': '', 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82614'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 48, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 219, 'count4': 827, 'count5': 2605}}
column12:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October 2024.

1.	Good Points
a.	This hotel is isolated, in the middle of the jungle. There is no bars or restaurant outside of this hotel. It‚Äôs peaceful and quiet.
b.	The room and toilet were clean.
c.	The staffs were friendly and very accommodating to our requests.
d.	The hotel has a bar near the restaurant, and roof top bar. The cocktails served was good. This was my personal favorite.
e.	The buffet breakfast had decent amount of food variety, mostly Indian food of course, and it was all tasty.
f.	The pillow and bed was just OK, not the greatest, but will do.
g.	The check-in and check-out process was fast.
h.	All the staffs spoke decent to good, English.

2.	Bad Points
a.	I paid USD250 Per Night (including taxes) for the Jungle Chalet room. The amenities in the room were somewhat limited.
b.	The hotel does have a swimming pool but you wouldn‚Äôt want to swim in it. They are plenty of stray dogs in the hotel compound. God know if they have used it as well, when there‚Äôs no crowd. 

3.	Will I return again to this hotel?
No. I will try Hilton, which is nearby.
column13: Nice Hotel But Can Be Better

column6: {'id': '638092', 'name': 'Cinnamon Wild Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3758, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.259364, 'longitude': 81.40433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d638092-Reviews-Cinnamon_Wild_Yala-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/cinnamonwildyala', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': '', 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82614'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 48, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 219, 'count4': 827, 'count5': 2605}}
column12:
The location in proximity to the gate to the national park and the property ammenities itself are amazing! It truly feels like you're "on safari" with the rooms in huts, the pathways to get there and also the wildlife visiting the property itself! There was also general maintenance such as painting and cleaning constantly going on, which was great to see! The staff are beyond wonderful and there for any requests, always have a smile and make sure you have a great experience. The pool being open till 9pm also was incredibly relaxing after a long day spent in the heat on safari.

The food quality could be possible improved for both breakfast and dinner service, (general issues with buffets) but the variety was appreciated, specially the fresh cooking stations. There might be a possibly to reduce the options to improve quality possibly. The selection of alcohol at the bar was also quite limited for certain categories, and a fair amount of the menu was sold out / not available.
column13: Spectacular stay, truly lets you embrace the wild!

column12:
My stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was nothing short of exceptional. Nestled on the edge of Yala National Park, the resort beautifully blends luxury with nature, providing a unique safari experience.

The rooms are spacious and well-appointed, featuring rustic decor that complements the surrounding landscape. The private balconies offer stunning views of the wildlife, perfect for morning coffee or evening relaxation.

The staff were incredibly welcoming and attentive, always eager to ensure a comfortable stay. Their knowledge of the local wildlife added an extra layer to the experience, making the safari outings even more enjoyable. Especially thanks to reception team: Sandu, Achala, Akash, Pradeep, Jayani, Shalini, Thilina, Dewin, Roshani, Divya and Yugan.

Thanks for Kasun let me experience the safaris were a highlight. He was passionate and knowledgeable, leading us to some fantastic wildlife sightings, including elephants and leopards. 

Cinnamon Wild Yala is a perfect getaway for nature lovers and those seeking adventure. The combination of luxury, exceptional service, and proximity to one of Sri Lanka's best national parks makes it a must-visit. I can't wait to return!

column5:
{'id': '974826146', 'text': "Dear Limbobski,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala.

It's wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala and participated in our stargazing and nature walk activities.

We're delighted that you had a memorable experience during the stargazing with Kasun. Observing the moon and Saturn in the clear night sky is a truly magical experience, and we're glad that you enjoyed the discussion with Kasun.

Your nature walk with Gayan Gamage on October 16th sounds like a fantastic adventure. We're proud to have such knowledgeable and engaging nature trail guides who can share their passion for the local flora and fauna with our guests.

We're particularly pleased to hear that Gayan was able to connect with your family, especially your daughter. It's heartwarming to know that our team can create lasting memories for our guests.

Thank you for choosing Cinnamon Wild Yala for your adventure. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future and continuing to provide unforgettable experiences.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager

column12:
We enjoyed our stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala. We did the stargazing with Kasun. We saw the moon and Saturn and enjoyed the view and the discussion with Kasun. Glad we did this activity!

We also went on a nature walk with Gayan Gamage on the 16th of october 2024, and it was absolutely amazing. He was super friendly and knew a lot about the nature and the tracking of the animals. It was very interesting, and we saw a lot of the local animals. We hightly recommend this to anyone who likes the nature and animals.

Gayan was friendly and easy to talk to and we had a great time! He was also very good at involving the children and our daughter loved him and wanted a picture taken with him after the tour :)

We are delighted to hear that Cinnamon Wild Yala met your expectations and that you would rate it 4 stars by international standards. Our unique location, nestled amidst the lush jungle and overlooking the serene lake, offers a truly unforgettable experience.

It's fantastic to know that you were impressed with the quality and variety of our dining options, both a-la-carte and buffet. Our culinary team takes great pride in providing our guests with a memorable dining experience, and I'm thrilled to learn that their efforts were appreciated.

column12: Cinnamon seems to be a chain in Sri Lanka, and this one did not disappoint. I would see 4 stars in international standards, very nice rooms in the middle of nowhere, basically in the jungle. There is a large lake with buffalos and elephants right in front of the hotel. The hotel offers a-la-carte food round the clock and a superb buffet restaurant for breakfast and dinner: truly amazing food, many choices, huge dessert buffet, all overlooking the jungle. The rooms are super modern and clean, high standard. I would definitely recommend this hotel and go here again
column13: Very nice hotel in the middle of wildlife

column5:
{'id': '974107714', 'text': 'Dear Maryann,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you so much for taking the time to share this wonderful review of your stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala! It brings me, Lashanthan Gopalan, the Resort Manager, immense joy to hear that your experience with us was nothing short of exceptional.

We strive to create a welcoming and luxurious environment for our guests, and I'm thrilled to learn that the staff's efficiency and friendliness resonated with you. It's fantastic to know that you were immersed in the beauty of our unique location, nestled between the vibrant jungle and the wild ocean beach.

Your compliments on the food and drinks are greatly appreciated, and I'll be sure to pass them on to our culinary team. It's especially rewarding to hear that Danushka and Sameera's outstanding service skills and welcoming demeanor made you feel happy and comfortable. We take pride in our team, and recognizing their efforts is truly motivating.

column12: Such a beautiful place- gorgeous lodge houses that were so pretty. Everything you could want in the room. The staff were so lovely (as they were in all the Cinnamon hotels we stayed in) - friendly, helpful and always smiling! column5:
{'id': '972163713', 'text': "Dear Samarawickrama,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

We were thrilled to hear that your recent stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala was so enjoyable! It's always gratifying to know that our efforts to provide exceptional hospitality and wildlife experiences resonate with our guests.

We're delighted that you enjoyed our delicious cuisine and the expert insights shared by Sampath and Gayan regarding leopard sightings. Their passion and knowledge are invaluable assets to our team.

We're excited to share that our leopard feature wall project is progressing well. The model will undoubtedly be a valuable tool for identifying individual leopards of Yala National Park, further enhancing our guests' understanding of these magnificent creatures.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Cinnamon Wild Yala in the near future.

Warm regards,

Lashanthan Gopalan

column5:
{'id': '971924823', 'text': "Dear Gilla,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

We're absolutely thrilled to hear about your magical experience at Cinnamon Wild Yala! Your review is a testament to the unique and unforgettable moments our guests enjoy here.

We're delighted to know that you found our jungle cabins comfortable and enjoyed the delicious food and friendly staff. It's wonderful that you were able to relax by the pool and witness the fascinating wildlife in the nearby waterhole.

We're also thrilled that you took a safari trip and had the opportunity to embark on an early morning bush walk with Saman. It sounds like you had an incredible adventure, from spotting birds and plants to having a close encounter with a crocodile!

Thank you for sharing your wonderful experience with us. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Cinnamon Wild Yala for another magical adventure.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager

column10: Take the early morning bush walk!
column12: Magical place! Terrific comfort in jungle cabins in the Yala reserve. Delicious food, friendly staff and a swimming pool from which you can watch crocs and water buffalo at the nearby waterhole. Make sure to take a safari trip, and find out about an early morning bush walk at the hotel. We went out with Saman, who showed us birds, plants, wild bees, birds, signs of elephants and porcupines - and a close encounter with a very large crocodile! What a thrill!!

column12:
Restaurant service at Cinnamon Wild in Yala National Park Sri Lanka was superb. The food served at breakfast and dinner were the best since our last 3 hotels and resorts.

Amazed at how proud the servers are at their job. When chatted with Malintha, one said how he loved his job. He served with so much dedication and enthusiasm.

Particularly Danushka who served our table at breakfast this morning. Brightened his face when he cracked a joke which made my wife laughed so heartily. What amazed me was his sincere remark that he was happy to see his guests happy and enjoying themselves.

Chef Odaya has also left a lasting impression on us. Gladly explained how to make brinjal moju, my wife‚Äôs favourite dish in Sri Lanka. Even offered a live cooking demonstration. Much to the delight of my wife!

Who says only safari rides create lasting impressions!
column13: Best Service in Cinnamon Wild Yala

column5:
{'id': '971175350', 'text': "Dear Sandra,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you for your kind words about Cinnamon Wild Yala. We're thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful time during your stay.

It's fantastic to know that you enjoyed our hotel, location, and staff. We take great pride in creating a welcoming and enjoyable environment for all our guests, and it's rewarding to know that we've succeeded in doing so.

I'm glad that you had a chance to experience the beauty of Yala's wildlife and nature. Our resort is situated in a prime location for spotting elephants, leopards, and other fascinating creatures. We're also surrounded by lush greenery and diverse ecosystems, offering a unique opportunity to connect with nature.

I'm happy to hear that Nandana and Danushka provided you with excellent service. They're dedicated to ensuring that all our guests have a comfortable and enjoyable stay. We're fortunate to have such talented and caring staff members.

We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back to Cinnamon Wild Yala in the future for a longer stay. In the meantime, please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or require further assistance.

column5:
{'id': '970635361', 'text': 'Dear Thushari,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

We were absolutely delighted to hear about your wonderful stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala. Your kind words about our property, team, and hospitality have filled us with immense joy.

It is truly gratifying to know that our efforts to create a memorable experience for our guests have resonated with you. From the moment you arrived, our team has been dedicated to ensuring your comfort and satisfaction.

We're thrilled that you enjoyed our clean and inviting rooms, the serene natural surroundings, and the refreshing pool. Our team takes great pride in maintaining the highest standards of cleanliness and creating a peaceful atmosphere for our guests.

We're also delighted to hear that you appreciated our culinary offerings and the "Jungle Fowl" cocktail. Our talented chef, Nandana, and our dedicated F&B team work tirelessly to provide a diverse and delicious dining experience.

I would also like to express my sincere gratitude for your kind words about me. It is an honor to be part of such a wonderful team and to have the opportunity to contribute to the success of Cinnamon Wild Yala. Your positive feedback motivates us to continue striving for excellence in everything we do.

Thank you once again for choosing Cinnamon Wild Yala for your stay. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the future.

Yours Sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan

column5:
{'id': '970635608', 'text': "Dear Culture,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala.

We were absolutely delighted to hear about your wonderful experience at Cinnamon Wild Yala. Your kind words about our property, team, and wildlife encounters are truly heartwarming.

It is our utmost pleasure to provide a memorable experience for our guests, immersing them in the beauty and wonder of Yala National Park. We're thrilled that you enjoyed the serene surroundings, comfortable accommodations, and the opportunity to witness the diverse wildlife.

We are especially grateful to Gayan for his exceptional safari tours. His expertise and passion for wildlife undoubtedly contributed to your unforgettable experiences.

Thank you once again for choosing Cinnamon Wild Yala for your stay. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back in the future.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-21', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12:
Amazing experience in the midst of Yala national park. 
We spent 3 nights here immersed in nature and wildlife. Room and facilities were great. A wonderful pool where we could lookout at the lake which had buffalo, elephants and a croc bathing. You are guided to and from your room at night which is great because on our first night we encountered a wild boar. Our guard handled it calmly and it was one of the highlights. 
Special shout out to Gayan who took us on two awesome safaris where we saw crocodiles, birdlife, deer, buffalos, elephants (including babies) a bear and a leopard. What an experience!

column5:
{'id': '970438468', 'text': 'Dear Frankie,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at Cinnamon Wild Yala. We appreciate your candid comments as they help us identify areas where we can improve.

We are delighted to hear that your safari experience exceeded your expectations. Our team strives to provide unforgettable encounters with wildlife, and it is rewarding to know that we achieved that goal.

Regarding your feedback about the hotel, we apologize for any shortcomings in your room and the food service. We take pride in maintaining high standards of cleanliness and quality, and it seems we fell short in these areas. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this caused.

We have taken note of your comments regarding the bar service and will be addressing this matter with our staff to ensure that our guests receive the highest level of service.

Thank you again for your feedback.

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager
Cinnamon Wild Yala', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-19', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '638092', 'name': 'Cinnamon Wild Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 3758, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.259364, 'longitude': 81.40433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d638092-Reviews-Cinnamon_Wild_Yala-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/cinnamonwildyala', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82614 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': '', 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82614'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 48, 'count2': 59, 'count3': 219, 'count4': 827, 'count5': 2605}}
column12:
The welcome we received was very good. Unfortunately, for the money paid the rest was distinctly average. Our aim was to see fabulous animals and so in that regard it was a five star experience. 

The hotel was not.  Our room was acceptable but the toilet and shower space need a deep clean. The bed was fabulous especially after a whole day safari. 

The food was not good. Bar food was poor. Breakfast was average and expensive. 
The service from the bar really wasn't good. I am glad that we only had 2 nights because any longer would have been far too long. 

I try hard to give a balanced review when I take the time to post. I think,  regrettably, that the cost exceeded the experience of the hotel.

column5:
{'id': '970976231', 'text': 'Dear Steve, 

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala. 

Thank you for choosing to stay in Cinnamon Wild Yala and following up with a review taking up your time and effort. Your feedback is invaluable for us to understand our positives and areas of improvements. We are disappointed to note that our service standards and food quality did not match your expectations. 

Our award winning culinary team rarely disappoints the guests. It is further intriguing to hear the cleanliness standards were not up to your expectations either. After an internal review, we do understand that we could have created opportunities to understand the expectations further as there were only two recorded attempts to hear of your stay. We will surely look to a way to improve our communication for our future guests. 

We are of course privileged to have our location strategically set up as one of the closest to the famous Yala National park. Thank you for appreciating it and writing about it to our guests who will read this review before reserving their stay. Once again, I would like to apologize to you both for not meeting your expectations. 

On the other hand, I would like to take this opportunity to thank you for your honest feedback which we truly believe will elevate our standards further in the future. We hope this visit will not be the reason to not repeat your visit again. We most certainly expect to see you again at Cinnamon Wild Yala to enjoy our improved experience. 

Until next time, we wish you the best. 

Yours sincerely, 

Lashanthan Gopalan 
Resort Manager 
Cinnamon Wild Yala', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-23', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12: We had a wonderful time as part of our honeymoon, the hotel and staff were very inviting and welcoming. The food in particular was excellent - my wife is coeliac and they were very attentive in showing her the gluten free options (of which there were many!). The room (beach chalet) was amazing - incredible views, very clean and comfortable.
column13: Brilliant stay as part of our honeymoon!

column12: My stay at Wild was nothing short of perfect. The team working there is incredible from Lashanthan the Resort Manager, to the FO Team - Wathsala, HK - Dilani and the little touches in our room, the talented barman Ananda and Saman, the waiters Vihanga, Chef Nandana and the super super talented Naturalists who helped us with the best safaris Kasun, Gayan and Sampath. They made my three days at Wild amazing. The place was extremely serene and just perfect to unwind and relax. I can't wait to go back again.
column13: An amazing wholesome stay in the Wild.

column5:
{'id': '969860644', 'text': 'Dear Harry,

Greetings from Cinnamon Wild Yala

I'm thrilled to hear about your incredible experience! It's our utmost priority to ensure that every guest feels welcomed, pampered, and immersed in the wonders of Sri Lanka's wildlife.

Gayan's passion for nature and his expertise in spotting wildlife truly make him an exceptional guide. We're delighted to know that you had such a memorable safari experience with him. His dedication to providing guests with unforgettable encounters is a testament to our team's commitment to excellence.

Our beautifully appointed rooms are designed to offer a serene retreat amidst the lush surroundings. We're glad that you appreciated the comfortable ambiance and the opportunity to observe wildlife from the comfort of your own space.

Thank you for recognizing Cinnamon Wild Yala as a "must-do" destination in Sri Lanka. Your kind words mean a lot to us and inspire us to continue striving for the highest standards of hospitality.

We look forward to welcoming you back to Cinnamon Wild Yala in the future for another unforgettable adventure!

Yours sincerely,

Lashanthan Gopalan
Resort Manager

column12: We stayed at the resort for two nights in Yala. We were quite satisfied with  what we experienced  to  what we expected. The service was very good. All staff were very good. The location is ideal for thrill seekers. I believe their booking process can be little better as we ended  paying almost double because of the misunderstanding. The family was initially split into two rooms and then offered an inter-connected room. We are a family of 4 with children aged 18 and  13 and more than happy to stay in one chalet. We have  stayed in many resorts in the past never experienced this before as they would ask the ages before booking is confirmed. I think these unpleasant experiences can be avoided at checkin if they improve their booking process.

column12:
We stayed for three nights at Cinnamon Wild so that we could easily visit Yala National Park. Our stay at the hotel was very comfortable. We were a party of three female family members including an elderly grandmother. 
The general manager Mr. Lashanthan, chef Mr. Nandana, and all hotel and dining room staff we met, specifically Ratnayake, individually and collectively took extra effort and care to make our stay memorable. Their attention and care extended towards our safety, comfort and enjoyment during the three night stay is commendable and very much appreciated.
column13: A note of appreciation to Cinnamon Wild Yala

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We'e just had two nights and three amazing days at Yala Safari Camping and were blown away at every stage. The main hotel area has stunning views over the park and an array of wildlife to watch while relaxing. The rooms are luxury with aircon, comfy bed, good shower and surprisingly minimal bugs.

We did a half and full day safari in Yala national park. We saw elephants, birds, deer, water buffalo, crocodiles and were lucky to see two leopards! Our driver Shiran and guide Ravi were great at spotting animals and kept a respectful distance. We also did a boat ride, bird watching tour on our final morning. All packed breakfasts, tea, snacks, and lunch were great! 

Dinner setup at the lodge was truely magical, candlelit with stunning sky full of starts. The food was very good, we especially enjoyed the Sri Lankan lunch on day 1! 

The service throughout our stay was exceptional, definitely exceeding expectations, and we couldn't have asked for anything more! Thank you to Ravi and his team for a very special few days that we will remember forever!

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: Amazing location. Beautiful view. Lovely tents and great staff. We had two game drives seeing elephants, crocodiles, leopard and awesome nature and wildlife. In the evening we had a great BBQ on the deck under the starts. Thank you very much

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12: We were wonderfully hosted by the crew of Yala Safari Camping. Beautiful setting and great food and service. On our first safari trip we already saw elephants, leopards and a bear! Special thanks to Ravi, Achi, Promod, Madawa, Chamara, Chamith, Danu, Sagara and Mahesh.

column6: {'id': '5817895', 'name': 'Yala Safari Camping', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 509, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.378556, 'longitude': 81.38269, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d5817895-Reviews-Yala_Safari_Camping-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.srilankayalasafari.com', 'address': 'Yala Block II Road, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Yala Block II Road', 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 6, 'count4': 32, 'count5': 467}}
column12:
We travelled with a groups of 6 friends and the experience from start to finish was of the highest quality. The staff were incredibly attentive and went out of their way to assist us whenever they saw an opportunity. Even organising a last minute birthday cake for one of our friends. (They only found out about his birthday 2 hours before). 

The cabins/tents were extremely private and very spacious. You really got the sense of being in the park falling asleep listening to the sounds. Aircon as well was a lifesaver. 

The food for each of our meals was incredible, shoutout to the chefs and kitchen team. 

We did both the afternoon and sunrise safaris. Each was unique, we went to two different blocks in the national park and saw an incredible array of wildlife. Thanks to our driver Achi and our guide Ravi. They always put us in the best positions to see the animals and were very knowledgeable. Their genuine care for the national park and the animals was amazing to see. 

An unmatched experience in Sri Lanka, would love to go back again!
column13: Incredible luxury camping in Yala, amazing food and safaris.

column12:
An amazing safari and stay experience!
Before check-in, we were able to contact the hotel directly via WhatsApp, and they sent us the meeting point address in advance for pickup. Although we booked a tent, we were given a cabin instead, which had excellent air conditioning and plenty of hot water. The meals prepared by Chef Promod were some of the best we had in Sri Lanka.
We booked the safari for the next day directly through the hotel, and our guide Achi was fantastic. He located the Sri Lankan leopards twice by sound alone‚Äîwhat luck!

column12:
Greatest outdoor experience ever‚Äî from the setting to the accommodations and care everything was first rate. 
Safari was organized and lifetime experiences - every effort was made by the tour guide to make us command a successful Safari. 
Resort provided meals and housing beyond expectation. The tent cabins were comfortable providing a unique stay. Traditional and unique meals were fresh and variety with professional service. 
The staff is the most knowledgeable and provided amazing service and fun. Resort lobby and restaurant are amazing and designed by the owner with eco-touches. The crew made the experience most magnificent. 
We look forward to returning soon!

column10: Reach hotel before 1pm to join the afternoon safari tour
column12:
This hotel is definitely an ideal choice for safari adventures. The manager Ravi welcomes us at the meeting point and escort us to their exact hotel location with their private jeep. What awaiting us are the friendly
Hotel crews with their welcome drinks and sumptuous seafood & Sri Lankan lunch. 
Thanks to Ravi and Mahesh for the amazing safari game drive, their efforts and passion to look for the wild animals that we can see here, including leopard of course! Also very close distance encounter with the elephants just drive us crazy.
Well prepared bbq dinner under the starlight surprises us! Such a romantic ambience. We are serve with good food and free flows of alcoholic beverages. 
We need to walk down 60 steps of staircase to reach our room. The room is close to nature,  yet spacious and comfortable. 
The lobby and restaurant area overlooks the national park offers the most stunning view especially during the sunrise!
Last but not least , every hotel crews around here are super helpful and friendly, make us feel home!
Everything here are simply Beyond Expections!
column13: Hidden Gem in Yala National Park
