column10: Get a cocoon with pool and bring your own binoculars
column12: This was our first safari and on a birthday trip so we splurged to stay at Wild Coast.  Yes, it‚Äôs expensive but it ticked off all of our boxes: near Yala National Park, on the ocean, private and comfortable rooms with personalized service, sustainable mission, and all-inclusive safaris and delicious food and drink.  The facility is beautifully designed to blend into the park flora and fauna with as little environmental impact as possible. The unique cocoon suites (most with private plunge pool) are located around watering holes that attracts wildlife.  We watched monkeys frolicking in the trees and watering hole from our cocoon.  Yes, there can be other wildlife around since this is a fence less property: elephants, leopards, snakes, buffaloes, etc.  That is why you have to be escorted by a staff person around the property at night.  But the main reason to come here is the private safaris., and you get one each day. Since you are staying at the Resort, you bypass the line of jeeps waiting to get into the park (and there can be as many as 100 jeeps in that line).  Tauranga was our ranger/guide for our two safaris as well as a late afternoon walk to a nearby tank.  He freely shared his knowledge of wildlife, birds and trees of Yala with us and best of all has an excellent eye for wildlife.  With his help,  we were lucky enough to view a leopard watching a crocodile eating a boar during our afternoon safari, and lots of elephants and birds.  There is no guarantee to see wildlife,  but it‚Äôs still a fun and unique experience.  Bring your own binoculars, water and a scarf (it can get dusty on the open air jeep).  After our safaris, we were welcomed back with cool towels, drink and dinner in the restaurant.  It‚Äôs a Relais & Chateaux so we were not disappointed by the delicious and varied food and drink selections.  I was celebrating my birthday, so we were surprised by a dinner on the beach on our last night.  This is the luxury way to experience a Yala safari; highly recommended!

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
We stayed here as a family of four for 3 nights from 16th to 19th August. Our family Cocoon had incredible interior and was spotlessly clean. The cleanliness was maintained brilliantly despite the jungle location by our lovely housekeeper Chathuranga who came twice a day ,morning and evening for turn down. We noticed everything being freshened up and details like slippers and water being put by our bed. The best turn down we experienced  in Sri Lanka. 

The restaurant was fantastic, dining there one would never believe that you were in the middle of the jungle, the choice and presentation of foods was incredible. As vegetarians we were well catered for. The croissants at breakfast were the best we‚Äôve ever tasted outside of Paris!! Our teenage sons are both autistic and they prefer more simple foods. After conversation with restaurant manager Chamika, he kindly allowed them  to eat from the kids menu and allowed any modifications they needed to be comfortable. Chamika is a genuinely warm and caring gentleman and really put us at ease regarding these requests. Thank you so very much Chamika this was really appreciated by all of us as a family. 

Through no fault at all of the hotel one of our sons was unwell during our stay, twice in the restaurant as it happens. The staff were incredibly kind to us, in particular I wanted to mention Tilshan. He walked with my son and I back to our room both times, helped him to freshen up outside of the restaurant and was just generally caring and accommodating. He was often our sever in the restaurant and carefully remembered all of our particular orders, we really are so grateful to him. I also wanted to mention Rhunini in the restaurant, as we understood she is new to the team and currently in training. We found her to be an incredibly kind, attentive and proactive young lady who is so mature and we have no doubt a bright future in hospitality ahead of her. 

We were on the all inclusive package and as a result we had 3 game drives included in our stay. We were extremely fortunate to have been allocated Shani as our ranger. At present the only female ranger in Yala national park!! What an inspiring lady, who was so kind and patient. Shani was so concerned the morning that my husband and son were missing from a game drive after my son had been unwell, thankfully he was better for our final game drive and she went out of her way to make sure he was happy and comfortable that afternoon. Shani has a vast knowledge of all the wildlife, despite being relatively new to this position. Her passion for her country‚Äôs animals and birds was infectious. We thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent with her on all three of the game drives, she answered all our questions and along with the two drivers we had; was so patient in allowing to watch, listen and take as much time as we needed to enjoy a moment whenever we stopped. 

We were fortunate to see leopards twice on our last day (morning and evening) Shani was genuinely so happy that my son who had been unwell had also managed to see one after missing out that morning. We also saw a pair of the very rare black neck storks during our final game drive. This was all incredible and we felt so lucky, however we have to say it was such a privilege to see every animal, bird and reptile that we did. Shani we can never thank you enough for 3 amazing drives; giving us an introduction to Sri Lankan wildlife; making us want to visit Yala again and allowing us to create many happy family memories. 

One small negative was the pressure we felt at the end of the stay here by our host to provide a review. We completely understand the importance of reviews particularly in Sri Lanka, however an email to both my husband and I in the middle of our final game drive about this really wasn‚Äôt the time! When we returned to the property to finally relax at the sundowners;  with our son feeling much better, wishing to enjoy the moment and reflect on our game drive,  we were approached by the host and asked again to complete a review! In my opinion it would be better to allow guests to enjoy their holiday moments and discuss this at check out. I don‚Äôt know if this is happens with every guest or if it was just us at these timings?There were numerous WhatsApps around that time in the group set up by host, for communication during our stay which made us felt it was all about a review. Yet the same gentleman hadn‚Äôt cared to check in with us to see if our son was ok the morning after being quite  unwell the night before, when everyone else we saw immediately asked if he was alright. When it was review time the texts were numerous!! We personally don‚Äôt appreciate this kind of pressure. As a family we will be the first to give thanks, praise and give feedback verbally when it‚Äôs deserved. We almost always write reviews too, but in our own time. We prefer to relax and be present in the moment when on holiday and leave the reviews until we are home. Please take this into consideration! Other than this we really had a lovely stay, thank you to all of the team for your hospitality.

column12:
Wild Coast Tented Lodge is probably one of our most memorable stays ever.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights and went on to 2 safaris into Yala that were included with our stay plus we signed up for an additional morning safari. We had a leopard sighting (from about 100 meters away) on 2 of our 3 outings. Wild Coast does a great job with organizing the safaris. For the morning safaris, they coordinate guests and jeeps the night before and secure entry tickets on-line which allows you to get into the "fast" entry lane and get into the park sooner. The lodge's convenient location to the park also means less driving time. Once in the park, the lodge's drivers and guides stay in communication so that if there is a leopard sighting they will let each another know.

The level of service at Wild Coast is some of the best around. Everyone went above and beyond. The food was also fantastic with so many options. We were in a Cocoon Suite that was very comfortable - bed, AC, shower, everything was great!

I would highly recommend a stay here.
column13: Loved Everything About Wild Coast Tented Lodge

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column10: Whilst the morning park drives mean an early rise (meet at 5:30am),don‚Äôt put this off. The park rides to Yala National park are so rewarding
column12:
My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of our 3 week long honeymoon to the Maldives & Sri Lanka. I have to say this was probably the highlight of our trip.

What is unique about this hotel ‚Äòcomplex‚Äô is that it is completely open to the elements and the national park around it. There are no perimeter fences to keep out the wild animals, but they do have 24 hr security to ensure all guests are kept safe.

Our pod room was amazing. It felt luxurious, clean and had everything you needed. Given nature was on the doorstep, there were no unwanted guests in our room at any time.

The real highlight of the hotel are its staff, in particular our assigned park ranger Thilamka. He was so knowledgeable about the national park and the nature contained within. Thilamka accompanied us on 4 outings - 3 x park drives as well as to the elephant transit sanctuary. I‚Äôm convinced that without his skill, knowledge and expertise, we wouldn‚Äôt have had the 5 separate leopard sightings we experienced - as well as seeing the plentiful other wildlife on offer such as elephants, water buffalo, sloth bears, mongoose, jackals, crocodiles, birds etc etc. Truly amazing to see these animals in their natural habitat and massive thanks and appreciation goes to Thilamka for all the guidance and knowledge he shared with us during our trip. He is a massive asset to the Wild Coast Tented Lodge family. 

Other thanks goes to the guest experience officer Chathuka. He made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived and he couldn‚Äôt do enough for us during our stay. 

Our only slight negative on the property was the hotel restaurant area. The dining area - tables, benches etc - all looked quite tired and are in need of some upkeep and a deep clean. The cushions we sat on for breakfast, lunch and dinner and bird faeces on them for example. I appreciate the restaurant is ‚Äòopen‚Äô to the outside and the crows do gather at meal times, however, a wash of the cushions periodically isn‚Äôt a huge task.  A lick of paint to the stonework and a clean of the supporting roof steelwork would also bring this up to date and to standard. 

Overall, a hugely awarding and positive stay at Wild Coast Tented Lodge, and we would return again in the future.
column13: Awarding stay at Wild Coast Tented Lodge

column12:
We chose the best property for our honeymoon in January. 
We spent two nights and enjoyed to the fullest as we felt a homely feeling no sooner we entered the property. 
The staff was amazing . All with a bubbly smile and always with a big heart to serve us and make sure everything is smooth .
Hasindu gave us a warm welcome and escorted around the lodge 
The rooms were very pretty and the eco friendly setup used was top notch.
The food was our favourite part with unlimited food and drinks to try .
The food was something to die for. 
Thilshan was really helpful in choosing the right dishes and he was a very energetic staff member in giving us a good service and Eric was really helpful too. 
Not to forget the candle lit dinner by the beach . That was lovely . Beautifully decorated space for us 
We also got a excellent ranger to go on the safari although there were no animals to be seen on our session but he was very knowledgable .   
Thank you so much for a memorable stay and for all the beautiful experiences during our stay.

column10: Ignore the warnings by security. Go run on the beach. Miles of gorgeous and unspoiled wild coastline. It's not for swimming.
column12:
A fantastic experience. Everything was perfectly executed. Rooms, food, amenities...it was flawless. 

I found the value as well to be outstanding given the inclusive nature of game drives, world class dining, and cocktails included. It's priced at just the right balance. Expensive, yes, but I feel value driven in the end. 

While I have not tried any of the other lodges in Yala, I could never imagine going back to anywhere but WCTL. It's a world class gem.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12: Perfection! Food excellent, staff delightful, accommodation unbelievable. Safari exciting with wonderful tour guides. Your safely was top priority at all times. Gorgeous pool and non stop bar. Road in and out a bit bumpy due to more than usual rains.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
Not what you can really call ‚Äòsleeping under canvas‚Äô, but very pleasant nonetheless.

The self-contained ‚Äòpods‚Äô have all the amenities you would expect from a hotel of this caliber, including a roll-top bath centred in the bathroom section, with a separate shower and WC.

Compared with other safari lodges we have stayed in (Kenya / S Africa), the room and hotel facilities were not to the same standard, but they were still very pleasing, and the food was good.

One of the main attractions for staying here is the fact it is on the coast with access to the beach, and it is also close to Yala National Park, so an ideal resort if undertaking a safari visit.

Service was generally helpful and efficient.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column10: Prepare to have an amazing experience
column12: What an amazing place to stay  - how often do you get to walk with an elephant on the beach and have a leopard run behind your safari vehicles on the same day?   This is a beautiful place run by some special people.  We will return as soon as we possibly can.  Thank you for making us feel cocooned in every sense of the word.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12: We arrived exhausted after a business trip to Colombo. The entire staff could not have been more welcoming, from the refreshing cold drink and towel on arrival to the concierge showing us our Cocoon Pool Suite. The suites leave you speechless, every detail has been carefully planned and thought of. A cross between a early 19 C gentleman's safari tent & Jules Verne's Nautilus. The private pool was spotless, warm and overlooked a watering hole. We had a dip whilst watching herons fish, amazing. The restaurant and bar overlook the hotel pool, we had a dip looking out over the Indian Ocean then swam up to the bar for a glass of bubbles, sitting looking at the view. A real 'pinch-me' moment.  The three course breakfast, lunch, dinner were all superb, food totally delicious, you have to try the Sri Lankan curry experience. We had sundowners on the beach watching the sunset, very romantic. The safari tour was a really fulfilling experience - our guide was knowledgeable - pointing out birds we hadn't even seen. We saw elephants, crocs, and the very rare sloth bear. The driver got us back in time for the sundowners - very dusty but happy!  Finally what made Wild Coast a totally magical experience - the amazing team of staff, from the General Manager down everyone was delightful, well trained and a pleasure to be with. We have made it our plan to return for the tea trail tour, visit all three Resplendent Ceylon hotels, especially the wonderful Wild Coast. Thank you guys for a great stay.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12: Stunning property and if you're an interior design lover like me you will be stunned by the rooms luxurious glamping colonial aesthetic down to the details. The staff were so kind and accommodating, I cannot thank them enough for making my birthday stay so special. The park can get very busy with swarms of vehicles from resorts across the area. However we were very lucky with sighting - seeing the very elusive sloth bear and elephants. If you like a tranquil, luxurious stay with plenty of pool time and delicious food then this is the stay for you!

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
The resort is beautiful with best of food and hospitality, So we had a pleasant and memorable stay.
I just feel they could do better for my request of room D√©cor : Some flowers & petals for our friends birthday.

Also it was thoughtful of them to provide us food on safari.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
Wild Coast Tented Lodge was our second stop after Cylon Tea Trails. A part of the Resplendent Cylon Hotels. Truly worthy being a Relais et Chateaux Hotel and Restaurant. The staff were going above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and relaxed. 

ROOM:

We booked the Pool Cocoon Suite, it was very nice. All the amenities were thought of in the room. We did not get any monkeys, we just had a frog get in our room because we kept the door open. 

It was private, and shaded. Yet we spent most of our time in the main pool area because there is no room service as they were concerned that some animals mainly monkeys would come. Because the pool was shaded it was a bit chilly, it is not a heated pool because they are trying as much as possible to be eco friendly. The hot water in the showers is heated by the A/C. The main pool is not heated either, yet it was warmer as it was not as shaded as the one in the room. 

The rooms are spotless thanks to Meedum and Hishanthan, our laundry was there in time as well. 

SAFARI:
We stayed there for three nights which was enough, we were entitled to a safari for each night, but we went on two and got to see the different animals. we went to two blocks of the park as on the first day the block next to the hotel was closed due to the heavy rain they had a week ago. So we went to the further away block which we saw elephants and deer and peacocks. The next day the block next to the hotel opened so we went there as well, if it was not open, we wouldn't have gone as going back to the same block is not worth it. Our ranger Thilanka, was amazing, he really used the time efficiently at the safari. We wanted to see the leopard and we did because we did not waste time stopping to see the same animals again. We also got to see the sloth bear, which Thilanka told us is even more rare. Thilanka was very knowledgeable we asked many questions and he answered all of them thoroughly. He also takes nice photos! Thank you Thilanka for making our safari memorable. 

RESTAURANT:
The restaurant and pool area are very mesmerizing. the scene and our luck with the great weather. We spent most of our time there. We had the afternoon tea after the safari, the tea cakes and sandwiches refueled us after the trip. The dinner menu had tandoori style chicken which we ordered every night. We also tried the passion fruit cheesecake which was fabulous looking and delicious. The breakfast had many options too and was a-la-carte so made specifically for your liking. All courses had a Sri Lankan experience, we had a Sri Lankan dinner once which was very spicy, so be careful when you order. I think restaurant area, needed more fans to help with the heat and humidity. I would also like to send a special thanks to all those working at the restaurant because they made everything to our liking as picky eaters, they bared with us. Thanks to Dasun, the restaurant manager, he was always there with a smile to greet us and help his staff.  

A SPECIAL THANK YOU to Sandaruwan, from the guest experience team who took care of us from A to Z. All of our requests, and the planning of our trips and dinners. He made us truly experience the hotel and it's surroundings.  

I would highly suggest this hotel for honeymooners and group of friends.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
We stayed at Wild Coast in 2022 December (not in 2023) for 3 nights.
We booked 2 cocoons (one for us (2 adults+ 2 little kids) and one for my husband's parents).
We travelled in a tour company owned van with a driver. Drivers quarters + meals were provided.

Check-in - It was amazing! Cold towels, Drinks and frozen pops for kids, it was just what we needed in that hot weather.

Cocoons were just perfect!! It had everything we needed and more! Absolutely amazing!
Sweets on the desk, mini bar fully stocked and replenished everyday, all the luxuries along with wild boars running around, yet we felt the thrill of living in a tent in the wild.

Food : The best Sri Lankan food we had on our entire vacation!
Everything else great too! Deserts were so good! The chef and the staff went above and beyond to make it perfect with everything we needed or even wished for. They were all very kind, friendly and humble.
Snack bento boxes for the safari were really good! They even made special ones for our kids with what they eat (they are picky) and it was such a lovely gesture.
BBQ night and movie under the stars for kids bring such wonderful memories.
And the sundowners when you get back from the game drives were just perfect!!

Tracker - Unfortunately I cannot recall that wonderful gentleman's name (he was from Panadura) but he was excellent. We went on 3 game drives and he was full of knowledge and was attentive to our wishes. We saw everything except for the bear thanks to him and the nice driver we got.

Vinol (manager), Abhishek and Sandaruwan (from check-in till we checked-out), Vihanga (our server) were the stars!!!! They are absolute gems for Wild Coast!
The people, the beautiful place, the nature, truly made our stay at Wild Coast as one of the best places we've been in the world! They made us feel at home!
Our kids still talk about the game drives and time spent in Yala with so much joy and love.

We came to Yala from Hatton (Tea Trails) with high expectations as we had a wonderful time there and Wild Coast did not disappoint us!
Simply cannot forget Nataliya James from the reservations team who helped us with our Tea Trails and Wild Coast bookings. She was kind, helpful, detailed and most of all, patient with all the emails I kept sending her.

We cannot wait to come back again!
column13: Greatest place in Yala with the best Sri Lankan food ever!!!!

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column10: Drive there in a SUV. Always listen to staff instructions.
column12:
Stayed here for 2 nights. While there were minor hiccups when booking, when we contacted someone high up the issues were quickly resolved. 
Getting there: took us about 4.5 hours from Colombo. Went with a driver (drivers quarters available) and went in an SUV. The last segment is probably hard to drive in a car with low clearance. Wouldn't recommend. Safe place to park.

First impressions: the hotel is beautifully designed and blends in with the surroundings. We were very warmly greeted by the staff. Check-in was very quick.

Room: family coccoon pool suite (we wanted a pool). Was very cosy and comfortable. The right blend of rustic and quiet luxury. The mini bar is well stocked and theres a great selection of books to read while tucked in bed.Enjoyed a dip in the pool while watching wild boar doing the same in the neighbouring water hole!

Food and drinks: amazing food every meal. Theres high tea and sundown cocktails. Too much to eat!!!

Staff: excellent hospitality. the staff were very kind, attentive and very well prepared to handle situations when wild elephants were roaming on hotel grounds. Despite an elephant wandering by the pool and the restaurant during lunch, we never felt unsafe. The main thing is to trust the staff and follow their instructions. 

Activities: did two safaris with an experienced guide which was quite good.

Spa: got a couples treatment which was so relaxing.

Overall the experience was excellent. Will definitely come again!

column5: {'id': '932930951', 'text': 'We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and managed to get some great sightings! Your feedback about your wait at dinner time is duly noted. Thanks for your review. We hope to welcome you back!\n\nThe Resplendent Team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-08', 'responder': 'Resplendent Ceylon', 'connectionToSubject': 'Marketing'}
column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
We travelled as two couples in December and decided to stay in a ‚Äòfamily‚Äô Cocoon ‚Äì one couple staying in the main ‚ÄòCocoon‚Äô and one in the smaller ‚ÄòUrchin‚Äô for three days. And quite simply‚Ä¶.wow.

As you can see from my other reviews, I have been fortunate to stay in some very special places, and this place is up there with some of the world‚Äôs best. The ‚Äòtent‚Äô is amazing, fitted out in a retro-colonial style, but with every mod-con you can think off ‚Äì air conditioning, shower, stand alone bath, super-comfy bed, etc. It‚Äôs stunning. We also had a fantastic mini-pool, way bigger than a ‚Äòplunge pool‚Äô, and they kindly delivered extra sun loungers too. 

The couple in the ‚ÄòUrchin‚Äô had an outdoor shower, and full-size twin beds. The Urchin isn‚Äôt huge, so storage space is limited, but most people only stay a few days in Yalla.

The common area is lovely and although we never had to use it, the main pool looked great. The dinning service was good, if sometimes a little slow and confused ‚Äì but we were there at peak Christmas time. I had some dietary requirements they failed to communicate to the kitchen, but once they had, they were great. We had a particularly lovely meal out on the beach, which is indescribably beautiful. The seats in the main dining area are ok ‚Äì a little more focus on looking trendy than comfortable, and at one dinner, we had to wait awhile for a table.

Of course, you come to Yalla for the animals, and having done almost half a dozen safari‚Äôs across Africa, we managed our expectations accordingly ‚Äì and on our first drive, having passed over 100 trucks waiting for the 6am park opening, we were not surprised to not see a lot; a distant elephant, a fair few lovely birds, a few deers and load of other trucks and jeeps.

However, for our second drive, our lovely ranger suggested that we head some distance away to ‚ÄòBlock 5‚Äô ‚Äì which was over an hour away. We agreed, and it was clear that his local knowledge was about to pay off. At the arrival gate, there was only a few trucks, and within moments of arriving a friendly elephant had approached the truck, his trunk almost inside the vehicle. 

And then the moment we had been waiting for ‚Äì our driver spotted not just one Leppard, but three! And they spent a good five minutes wandering around, allowing us to take those all important photos. What was great was to also see the sheer delight from our driver and guide, who were as excited as we were, snapping photos along with us.

They also were completely indifferent to the fact that the afternoon drive was almost 5 hours, rather than 3.

Yalla Tented Lodge is a magical place, and with a little better dinning room management, would be a perfect place.

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
It was a very different experience but in a positive way. Firstly, the hotel is located in the middle of a national park close to a visually beautiful ocean coast (however, it is forbidden to swim there due to safety). It has cocoon villas, and each guest stays in their own luxurious cocoon with a pool. The restaurant food and service is top-notch.

I would say the activities provided were the most exciting and fun for all ages: for example, for our family, we had adults, grandmothers, and teenagers. Yet , everyone was in joy. The hotel provided us with a safari trip to the national parks where we were able to see different wild animals like elephants, crocodiles, and even 2 sibling leopards. One of which is called Lucas. 

Apart from the safari, we stayed in the hotel during New Years Eve so we experienced the celebration organised by the staff. The meal was absolutely exquisite with multiple courses and, of course, a sweet dessert. 

The desserts were my favorite from the menu, I would like to special thanks to pastry chef Dammika Naun, whose creative visual presentation of the meals was surprising. Also, I can not forget to mention Pathum, a very cheerful and enthusiastic young man who served us during our stay. 

Hope to visit this place again!

column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column10: Take every opportunity to go on the game drives. We did two in one day and by doing that saw four leopards in one day!
column12: An excellent experience! The most luxurious "tent' I've ever stayed in, with all the inclusions anyone could ever want. The food was outstanding - if wanted you could eat continuously from breakfast to evening. Local specialities or western influenced with lots of seafood. And then there's the game drives!!! Very different to an African adventure but still excellent - great drivers and guides, and lots of wildlife - the highlights being the Sri Lankan Leopards and the Elephants. (One improvement suggestions... an adults only pool would be good.)

column5: {'id': '932932507', 'text': 'Thanks for your kind review- it is truly appreciated. We are so glad you and your children enjoyed Wild Coast! We hope to welcome you back.\n\nThe Resplendent Team', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-08', 'responder': 'Resplendent Ceylon', 'connectionToSubject': 'Marketing'}
column6: {'id': '12973489', 'name': 'Wild Coast Tented Lodge - Relais & Chateaux', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 606, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.262167, 'longitude': 81.40662, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d12973489-Reviews-Wild_Coast_Tented_Lodge_Relais_Chateaux-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/wildcoastlodge', 'address': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park 82600 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82600'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 31, 'count5': 562}}
column12:
This lodge grew on me. I liked the cocoon rooms which were beautifully put together. The food was very nice. There is one main common area with the bar, dining area and pool. It was pretty busy as we were there in the school break so possibly better at less peak times.

It was our children‚Äôs favourite hotel of the ones we stayed at - they loved the monkeys and idea of elephants roaming the camp. 

We didn‚Äôt end up using our plunge pool as it was shaded by trees and the weather was fairly cool.
Yala park is fairly vehicle heavy as everyone is chasing the same sightings.  We went to the wetlands at Bundala and preferred it as more peaceful and some really beautiful landscape. No leopards but elephant herds, buffalo, birds, crocs and monkeys.  Our safari guide was super helpful and knowledgeable. All the staff were friendly and attentive.

Note that if the nearest block 1 entrance is closed (for example due to poor road conditions) then it seems to be a lengthy 1.5 hour drive to the next entrance. There are also four lodges / hotels using the same dirt track for access so it can get pretty gummy. Not the fault of the hotel but a shame if they are over building.
column13: Very nice family safari lodge near Yala.

column5: {'id': '977075706', 'text': "Thank you, Ravid, for your wonderful feedback! We're thrilled to hear that you had a relaxing and memorable time with us at Mahoora. Our team takes pride in sharing their knowledge and creating a welcoming experience, so it‚Äôs fantastic to know they made your stay special. Nothing quite compares to dining by the fire under the stars, and we're glad you enjoyed the meals as well. column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
My partner and I had the best time on a full day Safari with Dilhara, our guide, and  Samantha, our driver. 
Dilhara is extremely knowledgable and passionate about Yala national park and all its wildlife. 
During our Safari, we saw many crocodiles, a slot bear and her cub,  water buffalo, wild boar, elephants, monkeys, a leopard and many beautiful birds and reptiles. 
Dilhara and Samantha kept us safe at all times whilst ensuring we had the best possible experience. 
This is a must do Safari when visiting Yala.

column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
Professional and organised camp setup. Raj was the main contact who was excellent and contacted us before arrival to make final arrangements which was appreciated. 

The tent was excellent. Cosy with everything we needed including an en-suite bathroom. In the evening the camp felt magical with all the lanterns lit up as did the evening dinner set up around the campfire.  

We did the full day safari which we didn‚Äôt regret seeing Elephants, deer, birds, buffalo and a Leopard with our guide and driver who were excellent. They went out of their way to ensure we saw as much as possible during the day. 

This is clearly a well managed safari camp and  we would highly recommend it.

column10: Guys! Don't hesitate to do you next trip with the Eco Team Yala
column12:
This was the second time that id was in a tented camp.The 1st with Mahaoora and it was a awesome experience . They were very professional in what they do.
From the tine if arrival at Mahaoora start with the welcome drink till the end of the stay which was two nights was really good.
 The food was very good Breakfast, Lunch, and a candle light BBQ dinner. The service was excellent and kind staff to attend tie your needs.
Mistake of all the two half day safaris that stolen the show. Being a wild life buffer the the Lepoard that i am after. We had  good sightings on both days. The Naturalist & the driver was very professional. The Naturalist gave me lots of info on the wild and its animals. 
I would advice any person to go with the Eco Team to have a awesome experience and your moneys worth.
.

column10: Do the night walk they provide for free, and use shoes just in case. Be respectful üôè
column12:
Oh wow! I am amazed by this place, the people, the surrounding, the vibe, everything.
I don't know where to start but if you have any doubts, let's not! You should definitely come to this clamping, and ever get the dinner in the bonfire,  because is amazing and only a couple of times in life you will be able to see the stars, and have a romantic dinner in a place like this.
Another thing, you do the safari with them, they are the best. They know a lot, the communicate between their jeeps and if one sees an animal, they take you there, this is an advantage. We were extremely lucky and where able to see a leopard, a dream come true. Besides that, you will see most of the animals in this reserve, and they are all majestic.

column5:
{'id': '968115338', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you and your friend had an amazing time and got to experience the incredible sight of leopards on safari. It‚Äôs great to know that Dilhara, along with our guides and drivers, helped make your tour memorable.

We‚Äôre also delighted that you enjoyed the beauty of our camp, the quality of the food, and the comfort of the tents. Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a special experience, and it means a lot to hear your appreciation.

Thank you for recommending us, and we hope to welcome you back for another wild adventure in the future!

column12: I went with a friend (two women) and we had the most amazing time! Not only we got to see leopards in the safari, which came with professional guide and drivers (ask for Dilhara for the tour), but the overall staff attention was invaluable. The place is beautiful, the food is good and the tents are clean and comfortable. There is hot water inside. I truly recommend it!

column5:
{'id': '968335835', 'text': "Hi Cciantar

Thank you for sharing your experience and for appreciating the safari, the atmosphere, and the service provided by our team. We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed the wildlife encounters and the overall ambience of the camp.

However, we are sorry to learn about the loss of your valuables. While we understand how distressing this must be, we must respectfully clarify our position on this matter.

During your stay, our Guest Relations Officer provided a comprehensive welcome briefing. This included a clear explanation that the tents are not equipped with safety lockers, as they cannot be locked like hotel rooms. The briefing was translated to your group by one of your companions who understood English, ensuring that everyone was informed.

We also made it clear that safety lockers are available in the welcome area, which is clearly visible and accessible to all guests. Unfortunately, you chose not to use this facility. Additionally, at check-out on the 24th, when asked if all belongings were accounted for, you confirmed that everything was in order.

It was only on the 26th of August, through your tour agent, that we were informed of the missing items. Moreover, you confirmed that your valuables were last seen just before your departure from the camp, and from that moment, all bags were under your care and confirmed that everything was in order before your departure.

As a responsible company, we took immediate action by thoroughly checking the premises and questioning our staff. Our head of operations has been in touch with your tour agent, Jayamali, and provided all the necessary details regarding this situation.

While we cannot take responsibility for the loss of your valuables, we hope that this experience will not overshadow the positive memories of your stay.

Thank you again for your feedback.

Best regards,

Anuruddha Bandara", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-04', 'responder': 'Anuruddha Bandara', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column10: You cannot trust your belongings in these tents.
column12: After an amazing experience at the camp which included, Vima a nice Safari guide who knew all about the wildlife we encountered and having a big nice camp with hot shower, BBQ dinner including a nice atmosphere with bonfire we had a big surprise. Arriving at our next destinations after leaving the camp in a rush I opened my luggage and found that valuable things and money were missing. This was to our surprise being in the wild with no-one around.  Just you have to make sure to have a lockable luggage when staying at this place

column5:
{'id': '967344774', 'text': 'Hi Doug and Klaire,

Thank you for your detailed review! We‚Äôre delighted to hear that Mr. Raj, Sagara, and Manjula made your stay comfortable and memorable, and we appreciate your recognition of their efforts. It‚Äôs great to know that you enjoyed the early safari and the arranged transport out of the camp.

We‚Äôre glad you had a rewarding safari experience with Samantha and Dilhara, despite the unpredictable wildlife sightings.

We appreciate your feedback on the amenities and meal arrangements. We‚Äôll review these details to ensure clearer communication and a more consistent experience for our guests. Thank you for helping us improve, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for another great adventure!

With kind regards, ', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-08-29', 'responder': 'Anuruddha Bandara', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
Wonderful stay made comfortable and assuring by led by Mr Raj and the crew including Sagara & Manjula. Mr Raj was of great service and help by picking me at 4am in the morning from the gates in total darkness, he also assisted in checking me in early which allowed me to catch an early safari. He also arranged transport out of the camp by a local driver which was helpful. Much appreciated. Overall all the staff try their best to make guests comfortable. 

Safari was well guided and driven by driver Samantha and naturalist Dilhara, whom I spent most of my time with on private safari. Managed to spot leopards on some safaris but on others we couldn't spot any at all.

Areas to improve: at Big Game Camp, it was communicated that amenties include shower gel and shampoo but only shampoo was provided. As a guy, thats ok as we are more flexible, but for ladies it will matter more and if communicated, it should be provided. Daily meals were randomly switched between locations within the campsite as well, which made guests like myself confused too.

column5:
{'id': '967343852', 'text': 'Hello Petitect,

Wow indeed! We‚Äôre thrilled you had such a fantastic stay with us. It‚Äôs wonderful to hear that the tent, delicious food, and full-day safari all exceeded your expectations.

A huge thanks for highlighting Joseph, Samantha, and Manjula‚Äîyour kind words about their exceptional care and service mean a lot. We‚Äôre so glad they made your trip extra special. We can‚Äôt wait to welcome you back for another incredible adventure!

The food was delicious.
We had a great full day safari!
Special mention to Joseph who was amazing and to our driver Samantha who made our trip extra special.
And thank you to Manjula for taking great care of us!

column5:
{'id': '961691546', 'text': 'Hi Lily,

Thank you so much for your amazing review! We are delighted to hear that you and your family had such a memorable experience with us, from the afternoon safari with Vishwa to the five-course dinner under the stars, and the serene breakfast by the pond.

We‚Äôre thrilled that you found the entire experience worth every penny and appreciated the efforts of our dedicated team. Your kind words will be shared with everyone, including our reception staff, drivers, guides, and chefs.

It was our pleasure to host you, and we look forward to welcoming you back for more unforgettable family moments!

Best regards,', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-26', 'responder': 'Anuruddha Bandara', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12: Amazing! The whole experience from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We paid for the whole deal: Afternoon Safari with Vishwa (awesome guide), afternoon tea, 5 course dinner under the stars around the campfire, night walk included, sleeping in awesome family glamping tent sealed with a delicious breakfast by the pond with the peacock walking by! What a memorable treat. A family time we will remember forever - worth every penny. It pretty much cost $880 AUD for our family of four ($220 per person) - great value for what we received. The efficient workers at reception to our driver & guide, wonderful chefs who made our delicious food & all the other staff behind the scenes - THANK YOU from our hearts to yours.

column5:
{'id': '961690920', 'text': "Hi Craig,

As you have deleted your previous review and our response, we are responding to this review again.

Thank you for choosing our property after extensive research (4 years of study according to your last review) and finding us capable of delivering a great experience. We deeply regret that your stay did not meet your expectations.

After thoroughly investigating the incident and speaking with our staff, we are puzzled by your dissatisfaction, particularly regarding our team's conduct. Even our sales colleague, Nathasha, who has been in close communication with you throughout, is at a loss as to why you felt our staff were rude.

While we apologize for your negative experience, we would like to address some of the points raised in your current review. We promptly attended to the concerns you raised, including the double payment issue due to miscommunication. Hence, we politely reject your statement that we have been dishonest. In fact, we checked you out without charging for the extras, trusting that you will make that payment after making any adjustments you need.

We appreciate your feedback and are committed to improving our services. We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience in the future.

column12: It was a great experience. In the evening a BBQ was provided and we had a delicious meal by candlelight. the children were allowed to roast marshmallows at the campfire. then we went on a walking safari and saw a number of animals. Early in the morning we left by jeep for the safari park and spotted animals there. it was an amazing experience and I would definitely say to do this if you want to get the full experience of a safari. the tent we slept in was also fully equipped. shower, sink and a normal bed to sleep in. the area where the tents were located was well maintained and neatly clean.

column5:

Thank you once again for choosing Mahoora as your base to explore Yala National Park. We hope to welcome you back soon for another unforgettable adventure.

column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
We had a 2 night stay here and loved it!! The staff are so friendly and helpful and they made our stay so enjoyable. They went above and beyond to help us the whole time we were there and we'll always remember this team for how hospitable they were. 
The food was excellent & plentiful and the dining settings are lovely. It was so enjoyable eating great food under the stars.
The tents themselves were fantastic. It's a real luxury to be able to have a decent shower and bed when your camping!
In terms of the safaris, we were very happy. We had a great driver and ecologist and had immediate access to the park so we didn't have to wait. As a bonus, our brilliant driver spotted a leopard for us (the first one seen for quite a while), so we were very happy!!
Overall, this was a great experience and we were so happy to have chosen Mahoora!
column13: A great base to see Yala National Park!

column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
I recently visited Mahoora with my wife and a friend in May of 2024 and our stay exceeded our expectations.
Our tent was large and comfortable including hot showers. Although there was no air conditioning we were comfortable with the fan running at night. We were happy with the cleanliness of our accommodations and were more comfortable here than many of the hotels we stayed at on our trip.
The staff at Mahoora were friendly and knowledgeable and did everything they could to ensure that we enjoyed our stay. It was never difficult to find someone if we needed anything and they were happy to set up activities during any time we had. We were taken to a nearby lake with a couple of staff members pointing out birds, we did a cooking class on site where we learned to make Dhal curry, and we went on a night walk finding nocturnal animals. While relaxing around camp the knowledgeable staff would point out animals on site and teach us about the local ecology.
The dinners were excellent and an enjoyable way to wind down in the evening. Despite outdoor dining bugs were not an issue. We added on a few extra beverages and were surprised how cheap they were.
We also did the Yala safari booked through Mahoora and were taken out for the day with our guide MJ. His passion for wildlife was evident and we were blown away by how much he knew. If he was unsure of a bird or plant he would look it up in the evening and get back to us. His English was excellent and he was a lot of fun to hang out with for the day. On our safari we managed to see leopards 3 times in addition to many other animals. I highly recommend booking the safari through Mahoora and would recommend asking for MJ. I‚Äôm sure that other guides are great too but our experience was excellent. If someone from Mahoora reads this, give our thanks to MJ and make sure you keep him around!
I can‚Äôt think of any complaints from our stay and have so many good memories from staying here. It was the highlight of our trip!

column5:
{'id': '957669404', 'text': 'Dear Khan

We are truly sorry to hear about the incident at Mahoora-Yala by Eco Team. We take such matters very seriously and deeply regret any distress this situation has caused.

While we do not have CCTV cameras directly covering the tents, due to privacy reasons, we do have cameras monitoring the entrances and paths. Our investigation did not reveal any evidence of an intruder. I

it was your choice not to make a formal complaint to the police which we respect. 

We understand that our staff insisted on payment for consumed food and services, and we apologize if this caused any discomfort. Unfortunately, they do not have the authority to waive these charges. 

Channa has tried his best to resolve the issue and explain the protocols and processes we follow in such situations. We apologize if his approach did not meet your expectations.

We are committed to improving our services and ensuring a secure and enjoyable experience for all our guests. 

Thank you for bringing this to our attention.', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-02', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column10: Please check if the Glamping site has CCTV cameras and if it has any safe to keep your important stuff. Don't do the mistake that I did.
column12:
I booked my night with Mahoora- Yala by Eco Team on 19th June, 2024. It's a glamping site, you have to pass the night in the tent. and on 20th Morning we have gone to the safari with Mahoora team at 5.30 AM and came back to the tent at 10.30 AM. Found out my money is Missing from my bag. Then I asked can I see any CCTV footage if there's anyone went in my room, they said no we don't have any CCTV camera. Then I asked why didn't you keep any safe in the tent as you are charging a lot per night, they just replied "it's a glamping site, we don't provide luxury, You go to the police if you want", How come a safe is a luxury? How come no one briefed us to keep our belongings to us all the time?

I went to the police station, the police don't understand English, the Mahoora management requested me not to make any police complaints and let's go to the camp site again and they will compensate. I didn't file the written complaints at police station as I thought I will be leaving the country in 2 days and I don't want anymore hassel. after coming back to Mahoora camp, They locked the main entrance, asked me to pay my dinner bill and then asked me to go to the police station again and do whatever you want. The upper management is the worst especially the operational manager Named Channa. He told me you have no proof that your dollars are missing, I asked "How am I going to have proof if you don't put CCTV camera? So many foreigners are coming to the Glamping site and if any incident happens, you will just say this is not a luxury hotel, if anything happens to you, first pay your bill and do whatever you want? " 

So, people make sure you don't make the same mistake as I did. Don't trust any glamping site hotels if they don't have CCTV Camera and please check if they have safe. And please don't book with Mahoora- Yala. 

Thanks
column13: Never book with Mahoora- Yala by Eco Team, My money was stolen from the Tent, No CCTV Camera, Worst upper management

column12:
We did three wonderful half day safaris - an afternoon one on the day we arrived, and two early morning ones. We were thrilled to see a couple of leopards (and a fleeting glimpse of a third), a bear, crocodiles, elephants, buffalo, mongooses, deer, hares, wild boars, monitor lizards, squirrels, as well as peacocks, eagles, beautiful Bee eaters, kingfishers and many other varieties of birds. Special thanks to our expert driver, and our knowledgeable guide and naturalist-in-training Vimansha, who tracked and spotted so many animals, and made our safaris an experience we will never forget.
All the staff, from the camp managers to the groundsmen at Yala‚Äôs Mahoora-Eco Resort were welcoming, friendly, kind and helpful. Lakma, MJ and all the others ensured our stay was memorable.

column12: Complete disappointment. The gave us different rooms that the ones we booked . The towels were ripped and dirty. We asked for first aid kit and there was almost nothing available to care for an injury. The dinner portions were very small and did not deserve the additional 20 dollars. The got mad at us because we did not booked a safari with them and refused to pick us up from the road even though the Google location they have use was wrong. Please don‚Äôt waste your money there.

column10: Avoid this place
column12:
Dont get fooled by the reviews. It was a nightmarish experience- tiny tent, very basic amenities. We went in mid April so it was very hot and stuffy. No extra fans provided..we suffered in the hot and humid weather. The actual tent pics are not what is posted in the website. 
Food - again basic and no second helpings of the fish and chicken were available
Packef breakfast was 3 bread slices with 4 drops of dry coconut chutney, and a banana.
No signages in the property so getting around in the night was a huge problem.
Safari- driver seated in the ac compartment no naturalist or guide provided. So u have to do your own sightings. Apart from peacocks birds hare and deer we saw nothing. If there was a guide it would be helpful identifying the birds and better sightings.
Overall a nightmare- pl avoid this place
column13: Nightmarish experience- the pics and reviews do not match

column5:
{'id': '947425615', 'text': "Dear Guest,

We regret any discomfort caused by the cleanliness of the shower room and the unpleasant odor in the tent. This falls far short of the standards we strive to uphold.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused by the inability to upgrade your accommodation as promised. We understand the importance of a comfortable night's sleep, especially after a long safari, and we regret that we couldn't provide a suitable solution during your stay.

Regarding the issue with the bathroom pipes, we're deeply concerned by your report and will investigate this matter thoroughly to ensure it is addressed immediately.

Your experience does not reflect the level of service and quality that we aim to provide, and we sincerely apologize for failing to meet your expectations. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and will take all necessary steps to prevent similar issues in the future.

We understand that this experience has been highly disappointing, but we hope that you may consider giving us another opportunity to provide you with the exceptional experience we strive to deliver.

Warm regards,", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-19', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column10: Confirm that you are in the tents advertised!
column12: We let our tour agent book our accommodation so when we saw we had a premium tent and saw the web pictures we were excited. On arrival it was a disaster. The tent had three small camp beds and a curtained shower room which was dirty and the tent stank of Urine. We asked what had happened as we went back online and saw the tents which we thought we were having and they were available. Promised to upgrade next day but after a gruelling 13 hour safari we were told it was not possible to move us. As my son it 6feet 3 and I am the same but 18 stone we did not sleep properly for the two nights. When we did sleep we were woken by the smell of Urine. The bathroom pipes ran out into the bushes. The most disgusting  accommodation I have ever seen

column5:
{'id': '947424949', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We're glad to hear that you had a good overall experience and enjoyed the friendliness of our staff, the quality of the food, and the vibrant atmosphere at dinner. It's fantastic that you had outstanding game drives and saw all the animals!

We apologize if the tent you received didn't match your expectations based on the photos. We have different tent options available based on the package booked, and we strive to provide relevant accommodations accordingly. Additionally, we do provide welcome drinks upon arrival, along with snacks and beverages for the safari, as part of our package offerings. Your feedback is invaluable, and we will look into this. 

We appreciate your suggestion for improved communication during the drives and will address this with our guides. Regarding the cooling fans in the rooms, we do provide stand fans for added comfort, and we'll look into ways to enhance cooling options for our guests.

In terms of directions to our camp, we do provide contact information and directions in the confirmation email sent to all our guests. We regret any inconvenience caused by the difficulty in locating us and will explore additional options to improve visibility.

We value your input, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for an even better experience in the future.

Warm regards,", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-19', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '1226088', 'name': 'Mahoora Tented Safari Camp Yala', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 444, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.40626, 'longitude': 81.37566, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d1226088-Reviews-Mahoora_Tented_Safari_Camp_Yala-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.mahoora.lk', 'address': 'Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Situlpawwa Road', 'street2': 'Kochchipathana', 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '91400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 18, 'count2': 12, 'count3': 11, 'count4': 67, 'count5': 336}}
column12:
This is a nice place but the pics on here they posted didn't really look anything like the tent we got. Overall, I had a good experience though. First the good stuff. The staff were great and friendly, and the food was good. The vibe at dinner was fun. The game drives were outstanding and we saw all the animals.
On the negative side of things, our tent didn't look like the pics they posted on here. During the drives, our guide was just talking to the people in the front and the people in the back couldn't hear what he was saying. They don't have drinks or snacks on the drives. Not a big deal but it was super hot when we went and cold drinks would have been welcomed, especially for what we paid. It would be a nice touch to have a welcome drink when you arrive and come back from game drives. Also, when it's hot, the little fans in your rooms don't offer much relief and there isn't really a way to cool off. Also, there isn't a sign to get to the camp from the main road, so our Uber driver got lost. They should add a sign so it's clear where they are located.
column13: Good but it could be great

column5:
{'id': '936479772', 'text': "Dear JumboMumbai,

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you had an awesome experience during your stay with us.

It's fantastic to know that you found our tents clean and well-equipped, providing a comfortable home away from home. We're delighted that your half-day safari was made even more enjoyable with a lovely and knowledgeable driver, enhancing your wildlife-spotting experience.

We're of course touched by your kind words about our caring staff, making you feel like family. Travis is truly a gem, and we'll make sure to pass on your special mention to him. It's heartening to hear that he and his team went above and beyond to meet your needs.

Most of all we're glad you enjoyed our delicious and healthy food options, and we take pride in providing a unique combination of tasty and nutritious recipes.

Once again thank you for highly recommending us to families and couples. Whether it's a night stay with a full-day safari or a half-day option, we're delighted that you had an awesome experience.

Cheers to more wonderful experiences, and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future!

Best regards,", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-01', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column10:
Carry some mosquito sprays, just in case.

Though we didn't need it !!
column12:
We had good fun.... stayed in the tents for a day and had a half day safari trip.

So here is our take

1. The tents are awesome. Clean and well equipped. 

2. We had a lovely driver and as we paid for a half day guide, it was well worth it as he helped us spot wild.life and identify it

3. Staff are so caring, felt like home away from home.

Special mention for Travis, as a leader at site he kept all of what we needed and took exceptional care with his team and when required he himself chipped in

4. Food is yummy... and abso healthy. Never experienced the combo of healthy and tasty recipes that Mahoora had

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED FOR FAMILIES AND COUPLES,   SPEND A NIGHT AND FULL DAY SAFARI

OR IF PRESSED FOR TIME, AT LEAST HALF A DAY

Really awesome experience
Cheers to Travis, and his team ü•Ç üçæ
column13: Awesome experience - home away from home

column12: Highly recommend this place. The gentlemen who work here went out of their way to accommodate our needs. Particular thanks to Travis in management - he was so professional and kind. The Tarindu, our game tour guide, was very knowledgeable. And Joseph, our waiter, was very helpful during our dining experiences. My husband thoroughly enjoyed playing cricket with some of the staff and other guests on the first evening. The tents were spacious and comfortable and the surroundings peaceful and relaxing. We had a very special and memorable experience. Thank you.

column12:
We had a lovel time during our Glamping Safari at Mahoora Yala, despite the mixed reviews we read. 

When we arrived, the staff welcomed us and the ambiance of the camp was pleasent. The tent was decorated giving a cozy vibe, complete with an attached bathroom, quickly became our home away from home, in the wild. 

Though the climate was a little gloomy during the safari we still managed to see a variety of birds, reptiles, and animals. 

The food was ample and they did cater according to our taste buds. 

Overall we  enjoyed our experience and it was nothing short of lovely memories.

column12: We had a wonderful stay at Mahoora By Eco team  Yala. The staff was incredibly friendly, and the dining experience was delightful! Our safari was thrilling, and we even had the chance to spot leopards. The experience of sleeping in the heart of nature, beside the national park, and hearing the nearby wildlife was truly unforgettable. However, there is room for improvement in the meals; we believe they could be more delicious.

column5:
{'id': '932228946', 'text': 'Dear Conpad246,
We value your feedback and apologize for any inconvenience caused during your stay. We are happy that you have appreciated our food and the staff.  Our team strives to ensure comfort despite challenging weather conditions. Clear communications during your stay would have allowed us to address specific issues promptly. We are actively working to improve tent conditions, and other concerns mentioned.

We deliberately keep the tent and open-air dinner lighting low so as not to attract insects into the tent. Wildlife sightings during safaris can vary due to many factors, but we regret any disappointment. Your feedback is important to us, and it will be shared with the team. It is through insights such as yours that we can continuously strive for improvement.

column12:
Food was good however you couldn‚Äôt see what you were eating due to only 2 candles for 5 people.

The tents were damp, showers didn‚Äôt work properly and occasional smell of sewage. Lots of mosquitoes.

Staff were very friendly however but was hard to get them in the evenings. Only stayed two nights but that was one too many. 

As for the safari, it was a 6 hour trip which resulted in us seeing less animals than on our drive into Yala. Seriously recommend you avoid this campsite.

It‚Äôs heartening to know that Sajith, our Head Ranger, played a key role in making your safari drives so memorable. We‚Äôre also overjoyed that you enjoyed the ‚Äúcreature comforts‚Äù here, from our accommodations and cuisine to our warm Sri Lankan hospitality. Your kind words about our team‚Äôs dedication mean the world to us, and it‚Äôs an honor to be a part of your Sri Lankan itinerary.
