column12:
I stayed at Kulu 29/06-01/07 and had an amazing experience. The tents are very comfortable with showers and air conditioning, with a large campsite which offers nice views of a lagoon. The evening and morning safari was very good with lots of unique animals. Our guides, Pramoth and Rohana, had extensive knowledge of the area and could identify various species of birds that were very hard to see. The staff went above and beyond regarding hospitality which enhanced the experience. Also, the food was amazing. 

Overall, the Kulu experience was amazing and a must-do for people looking to visit Yala. 

-George 2024

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12:
There are so many options for travellers when it comes to accommodation in and around Yala National Park - you really are spoiled for choice.
However.... if it's a genuine safari experience you are looking for, along with the little luxuries that make you feel like you are on holiday  - a stay at Kulu Safari should be at the top of your wish list!

I'm not going to lie, my senses were initially on high alert!! Everything really is tented! You are at one with the nature, without the usual security of 4 walls!  The tent was very rustic, but had everything you needed - a lovely big firm bed, separate shower and toilet, and thankfully.,. A/C!  
After acclimatizing with a sit down on the deck taking it all in, we threw ourselves into Kulu and all it had to offer.

Over the next couple of days, the wonderful Praba and Agith, took us on many adventures. Not sure we have ever seen such a heard working team - Not only were they looking after the camp, but also serving meals (unbelievable Sri Lankan feasts and BBQs), taking us on exciting safaris (which turned out to be be private as we were the only guests over a couple of days) , sharing their expert knowledge on the wildlife, kayaking with us on the lake, and setting up the most breathtaking dinner locations complete, and generally being the most fabulous hosts and companons!

We may not have  seen the elusive leopard in Yala (not through lack of trying!) but a sloth bear sighting , a crocodile kill, and the most unbelievable bird life I have EVER seen, really made it so special.

Breakfast in the treehouse and romantic dinners on the jetty with our own bonfire being watched by the resident crocodiles were out of this world!  

I have stayed in Safari lodges in other parts of the world, but I can tell you that none have been quite as authentic and personal as Kulu.

We came away feeling richer and more grateful that when we arrived - a magical place!

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column10: Avoid using the main gate to Yala
column12:
We had a wonderful time at the Kulu Safari camp.  Praba our guide looked after our every need while in camp and demonstrated an obvious passion and expertise for the wildlife of Yala that we really appreciated.

The camp is lovely and the food amazing.  We particularly enjoyed our dinners out on the dock watching the lightning in the distance and listening to the night chorus.  The tent we stayed in was okay and the excellent air conditioning unit provided relief from the heat however the bathroom could do with a refresh. 

The first afternoon in Yala we were lucky enough to have Praba, the driver and two others from the Kulu team act as spotters which was great.  We had a wonderful leopard sighting along with all sorts of other wildlife.  Each of the drives we saw something amazing with a highlight being an elusive sloth bear crossing the road ahead of us as we were driving out for the evening.

We were fortunate that Kulu Safaris is situated away from the main Yala gate and mainly sticks to less busy areas of the Park.  On our final drive we ventured into the popular part of Yala so we could see the Indian Ocean and it was horrible to say the least.  Far too many vehicles with seemingly minimal respect for the wildlife.  The focus is to get the tourists as close as possible so they can get their 'selfie'.  It was an unfortunate reminder that tourists are both part of the solution and part of the problem of achieving sustainable tourism and how important it is to ensure you are supporting a reputable company that is focused on the welfare of the wildlife and balancing that with giving you a very special experience.

There were parts of Yala that we did not have time to see so we hope to be able to return one day to enjoy the hospitality of Kulu Safaris and their excellent safari vehicle (the best we have experienced in quite some time)
column13: Wonderful experience, great food and excellent guide

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12:
We are an Indian family of 4 living in Singapore for years now. We have been to quite a few countries, quite a few holidays and some of them were in forests. 
Trust me Kulu Safari and their hospitality was one of the best. We have rarely come across such great hosts in our lives. 

One, its inside Yala National Park. You enter this place and for the rest of the days experience living inside a forest. But in Air Conditioned tents. So you experience both rustic living as well as luxury at the same time. 

Second they have a chef who can create magic with food. The daal, the bitter gourd salad, the banana flower salad, the bbq dinner near the lake, every meal was top class. Also everyday we did dinner at different places in the forest, which was quite an experience. 

Finally must praise the guys who run the day to day affairs in this place. Its a team of father (MD) and his two sons - Pramoth and Ajith. And also the rest of the staff. All were multi taskers. From cooking the food to setting up the meals area in the forest to taking us to jungle safaris inside the forest, they were doing it all. And with a BIG SMILING FACE. Especially Pramoth and Ajith were a hit with our 6 year old twins. They had become more like elder brothers to both the kids and the kids loved them. Must also mention the lady (whose name I forgot) who cut up the food into bite size pieces and fed my son. Such hospitality is hard to find.

Will rate this place 5 star, especially for young kids and their parents. You will love it here, if you love forests, that‚Äôs a guarantee!

Lots of love to Pramoth, Ajith and the whole team of Kulu Safari from all of us.

column6: {'id': '630497', 'name': 'Kulu Safaris Sri Lanka', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 422, 'locationString': 'Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.390171, 'longitude': 81.373665, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g612381-d630497-Reviews-Kulu_Safaris_Sri_Lanka-Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'http://www.kulusafaris.com/', 'address': 'Yala National Park Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': None, 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': ''}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 2, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 18, 'count5': 397}}
column12: This is a tented camp, so if your definition of luxury is carpeting then this isn't for you.  But if your definition of luxury is comfort, cleanliness, excellent food, and being near the exact things you want to see and experience, then you cannot possibly do better.  Moreover, the attentiveness of the staff is better than anywhere we've ever been.  They anticipate needs, provide special experiences, and generally over-the-top care.  We enjoyed our 3 safaris and saw more animal life then we could ever have expected.  Our driver was superb and the naturalist guides were so very knowledgeable.  The nearby park sends an official ranger with each vehicle, and even he was impressed with how well we did.  The meals were fantastic - we even toured the kitchen which was clean and walked the small kitchen garden.  Sometimes they set up means at a small table just a few feet from our very comfortable tent.  The tent itself was on a foundation that was well off the ground, had bathroom and shower, and the beds and towels were quite nice.  The G.M. gave us a tour of the trees and plants in the immediate area - just because we inquired about them.  We've done hikes, safaris, and nature tours for decades, and this is the best place we've ever been.

column10: Go up in the treehouse every morning you can! Not for the faint hearted however! :)
column12:
Cannot recommend this place enough!
There aren‚Äôt enough superlatives to convey how good our stay has been.
The team work so well together to accommodate your stay and their knowledge, respect and friendliness knows no bounds.
With our guides we were lucky enough to see everything we wanted to see and more!
We leave Kulu with a wealth of knowledge, memories and stories that will be told and treasured for a long, long time.
The food is out of this world in a setting that could quite easily be on a different planet.
Everyone here made our stay a pleasure to behold. Our hearts and our bellies are full!
Thank you so much and hopefully, one day, we will see you again soon.

column10: Only 12 minutes from the Yala Natural Park entance
column12:
This hotel is one of the best located in Sri Lanka and in Yala. It is built on the top of a sandy dune in the middle of wild nature. It is only 12 minutes ride to the Yala Natinal Park Main Entrance. The hotel is organizing Safaris, horse riding and yoga lessons.
Every room is huge and comfortable with big balcony and an amazing sea view.
The hotel general manager, Colonel Udayarathn, is a very fine personality who makes you feel comfortable. He is helping you with any concern and you feel save and protected in the hotel area.
The infinity pool has fantastic emerald color, you can relax or have a little gym excercise.
The architecture of the guest housed  is unique. 
We stayed here for 2 nights in july, the ocean was wild and we had a coninuous salty breeze. The nights were calm and  cool and we slept well in cosy beds.  
All in all we do highly recommend this hotel for people who love nature and relaxation.
column13: Amazing view over the wild ocean

column12: We had an amazing 02 night stay at Layasafari. Excellent facilities and service by the staff.Breakfest and lunch was so delicious. Dip in the pool was a different experience with poolside bar service. Special mention on General Manager -Wasantha' s hospitality and his vision of bali style concept near the pool felt more relaxed. Thanks to good weather the young boys enjoyed quad bike ride on the sand dunes by yhe beach. We also did early morning beach walks which kept us healthy. We certainly recommend more than 02 days at the resort and next time will be a long stay. Wasantha - keep continue with your vision to further take this resort to the next level and we wish you all the best.Laya safari you rock!!!!

column6: {'id': '3748692', 'name': 'Laya Safari', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 745, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.249011, 'longitude': 81.39219, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d3748692-Reviews-Laya_Safari-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/layasafarihotel/', 'address': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 71, 'count4': 207, 'count5': 418}}
column12:
Stayed for one night before doing a morning safari.
It was very quiet when we stayed but we had the pool, swing bar etc to ourselves. All staff are very friendly and helpful and attentive.
The evening meal was nice but the breakfast was AMAZING! We had fruit, a selection of bread / pastries then a choice of eggs with chicken ham and hot dog type sausages and toast as well as water, smoothie and coffee - perfect after an early morning safari.
The room was spacious and comfortable with 2 levels separating the bedroom from the living area / balcony and the bathroom was luxurious. We had an upper floor room and the view from the balcony was amazing.
Unfortunately we did not see the elephant but we were awoken by a cow casually eating grass by the pool.

column6: {'id': '3748692', 'name': 'Laya Safari', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 745, 'locationString': 'Palatupana, Yala National Park', 'latitude': 6.249011, 'longitude': 81.39219, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3748686-d3748692-Reviews-Laya_Safari-Palatupana_Yala_National_Park.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/layasafarihotel/', 'address': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd, Palatupana, Yala National Park 82000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kirinda-Palatupana-Yala Rd', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Palatupana', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '82000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 29, 'count2': 20, 'count3': 71, 'count4': 207, 'count5': 418}}
column12:
Hotel staff were very Polite, attentive staff. 
Comfortable accommodation with great views of the beach. 
Apparently an elephant visits the hotel each day but didn‚Äôt see one in our stay. 
Relaxing pool beside the bar and beach. 
Generous breakfast. 
Close to safari. 
Safari was very busy with limited viewing of animals
column13: Perfect hotel on the beach close to safari

column12:
Excellent room fully equipped. Magnificent view over the ocean.
The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. The swimming pool was wonderful. 
But the restaurant was a catastrophe. Unprofessional staff. They served fish and chips with a pan-fried slice of fish with bones. The drinks come after the food was finished. The bread for the soup was also to late.
column13: Nice hotel but a bad restaurant

column10: Please avoid this place, if you do book this place don‚Äôt pay at check in. Consider to look around the place and cleanliness of rooms.
column12: My stay at this hotel was far from satisfactory. The room was of poor quality, the staff, though friendly, were severely inexperienced, and the absence of a buffet on weekends left much to be desired. Adding to the frustration, they charged the full payment upon check-in, leading to a one-hour wait. The lack of tea bags and cleanliness issues further dampened the experience. I've attached photos for reference. While the staff is friendly, their inexperience and management's shortcomings have significantly impacted the hotel's potential. A change in management might be beneficial for the property's future success.
column13: Terrible! Not worth for price at all

column12: Upon arrival we were greeted by a wild Asian elephant in the garden. No kidding. The outside pool area is absolutely gorgeous and perfectly landscaped. Outdoor bali style beach bar and swings. Our room had sea views. Beach walks are just a Stone throw away. The food was buffet style. Everything down to the desert was made with love and set out lovely. The staff were really attending. The location is perfect and only a 10min drive to the safari park which means we were top of the que at 6am when the gates opened.

column10: get sea view room
column12: enjoyed our stay there recently,location is really nice pool area is very impressive the room we had was okay had a couple of issues which staff did try to sort,probably pay the extra for the sea view rooms if im honest.Staff were amazing we got stuck there through a flood and colonel udaya helped us with his own personal vehicle to get passed the water and then booked us a hotel in our next location ,a very big thank you to him.....i personally thought hotel was a little overpriced but its location ,location,location......AND what really made up for the price is the local elephant that i bumped into at 4am that was literally outside our villa ,never had that experience before AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING

column12: My experience began well having arrived just before 11 a.m. after circa 22 hours travelling when I was given an early check in with no extra charge.  I had a lively light lunch in the gardens by the pool looking out at the beach and listening to the sound of the ocean.  The dinner was delicious.  All the staff were most welcoming and helpful.  The highlight was the best ever massage in the spa where I potted for the Balinese massage - a perfect way to banish jetlag. A great start to my holiday.
column13: A great start to my holiday

column12:
The place is beautiful. The room is great. The dogs are happy and the sand is clean. Everyone is kind. I checked in late last night and the 2 sweet boys from the lobby, Reshan and Shiyan, checked me into my room. The view from the room amazing to wake up to. Very clean atmosphere. At breakfast Shaldi was very good to me, the food was great. Must thank Kassandra for keeping me company while i was relaxing at the reception. 
 
I came solo, this is my first trip since my husband passed and i believe people who live here are very lucky indeed.

column12:
Good waterfront hotel.
Clean and peaceful. Friendly and polite staff.
The beach in front of hotel is well take care off and clean. Good selection of options for breakfast. While almost nobody goes swimming; I did venture into the open water and found it to be quite good if you are a confident swimmer.
The street in front of hotel has few quite good restaurants too. My favorite is Italian place called Prego. Another one with live music is Torro.
Also tried massage in the hotel spa. It is a must do.
column13: Good place to relax and watch the waves break

column12:
I had an absolutely fantastic stay at this hotel! The rooms were spacious, offering all the amenities you could possibly need for a comfortable and relaxing stay. The views from the room were breathtaking, making it a true pleasure to wake up every morning. The staff were warm and welcoming, always going above and beyond to ensure we had everything we needed.

The food was exceptional, with an impressive buffet spread that catered to every taste. Whether you're a foodie or just someone who enjoys variety, the dining options were simply superb. The pool area was another highlight, with a stunning pool and a poolside bar where you could unwind with refreshing drinks.

All in all, a perfect place for a getaway!

column12:
From the second we walked into this hotel it sparkled. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff at the entrance, Kassandra and Keryvn, are so friendly and welcoming. The room was large and clean with a great bathroom. There was a small balcony where we had a sea view.

We dined in the main restaurant for breakfast and the choice was massive and we ate in the See Lounge in the evenings and food was great.

Now what is really special about this hotel is the pool, it was heaven. The view of the sea was amazing. Everything you need regarding food, drinks, towels is available.

We would definitely recommend this hotel
column13: Friendly staff, great food, excellent amenities. Altogether: a wonderful experience

column12:
The check-in process was impressively smooth and high-tech. Kassandra introduced us to our room and gave us a run down of the place. Special thanks to the young trainee Maheshini and her manager Mr. Riyas who went above and beyond to offer us a sea room. Their hospitality was top-notch, and we were thrilled with our room.

The room itself was spacious and pristine, offering a spectacular view of the swimming pool. The housekeeping team did a fantastic job, keeping the room spotless throughout our stay. We were especially happy with the attentive service, as we were provided with water bottles whenever we needed them, even late into the evening.

column6: {'id': '8073048', 'name': 'Sentido Heritance Negombo', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2266, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.234856, 'longitude': 79.84086, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d8073048-Reviews-Sentido_Heritance_Negombo-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.heritancehotels.com/negombo/?utm_source=www.tripadvisor.com&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=hn-tripadvisor', 'address': '175 Lewis Place, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '175 Lewis Place', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 53, 'count2': 34, 'count3': 126, 'count4': 425, 'count5': 1629}}
column12: We were pleased to be welcomed by Kassandra, who explained all the details of the hotel facilities to us. We chose to stay in a premium room, which was ready upon our arrival. A special surprise from the hotel‚Äîa chocolate platter, cake, and bed decorations‚Äîwas already waiting for us in the room. That was a lovely touch! The room was large, clean, and well-furnished, with a very comfortable and spacious bed. I must say, the hotel grounds are incredibly beautiful, and the landscape design is amazing. The view from our balcony was fantastic! Room service was excellent, with towels changed twice a day. There were plenty of sunbeds available, so even if you got up late, there were no issues. The See Lounge offered high-quality cocktails and meals, with a comfortable setting that even included beds near the windows to enjoy the ocean view. Watching the sunset as the sun dipped into the ocean, accompanied by the sound of rolling waves, was simply enchanting. In one word, we were charmed by that place.

column10: The best rooms are on the ground floor because they have direct access to the pool.
column12: The service on island is excellent. Kassandra and Gayan were very professional and caring. We truly enjoyed the food and beautiful view. column10: Perfect for one night before flight home
column12:
Good quality large resort hotel with well designed sea facing rooms each with balcony.
Beautiful sculptures in the front grounds with good perimeter security.
Pleasant staff but transactional in their approach lacking the friendly personal spark found elsewhere in smaller Sri Lankan property we had stayed at whilst touring over previous three weeks.

column12: Had an incredible stay at Sentido Hesitance Negombo. Arrived late at night and was quickly checked into the room by Reshan. The hotel rooms are wonderful and comfortable, the beds feel like home. The ocean view in the morning was breathtakingly remarkable - truly unforgettable experience. During the day I spent time by the pool, Raveen from the pool bar looked after me well. Overall wonderful time and think this hotel is worth a shot. The reception staff Sithija was also very helpful as I kept loosing my room card and he was nice enough to give me a few extra.

The dining room and food were spectacular, and the breakfasts one of the best we had in Sri Lanka. So much choice, and the hoppers were amazing! Fantastic friendly staff - Shaldi, Dinusha, Lahiru, Cassandra and Rashmi were outstanding.

column12:
Very beautiful resort and lovely staff

We spent 3 nights with our Romanian family friends and Belgian family friends. We flew all the way from the Maldives, and it was a wonderful holiday‚Äîwe all enjoyed it. Upon arrival, we were welcomed with a drink made from orange, which was delicious. We specifically came to experience the sea vibe, but unfortunately, we had some bad weather. However, we managed to make the best of it. The pool bar is nice, and the bartender is very friendly. We really need to mention our boys from the pool bar‚ÄîPrabath, Raveen, and Nayanajith‚Äîwho did a great job. Thank you again, guys!

Whenever we went to the restaurant, the hostess girls always greeted us with a smile. We also met the head chef during dinner; he is a really nice person, and his team did a great job. The food was amazing. We went to the main bar upstairs and had some drinks. The bartender there was also very friendly.

At the reception, I need to mention Kevin, Rushmi, Kassandra, Sithmi, and Shiyan, who gave us a warm welcome and arranged a late checkout for us. Once again, the front office showed excellent hospitality. Well done, team!

In the main bar, they played live music every night. The musicians were really talented, and we enjoyed the performances. The hotel was amazing, and we are all definitely coming back again. Thank you for everything üôè‚ù§

column10: Kids pool is under renovation
column12:
Sentido Heritance Negombo is a hotel that my family usually picks when we need some quality relaxing time.  Heritance Negombo stands out for its breathtaking views of the Indian ocean, stunning sunset views and more than anything, the friendly and courteous staff who are willing to serve you with a smile. 

For the newly weds, I would highly recommend the honeymoon package on offer.  I booked a two night stay for my niece and her husband who had their wedding just this week and they were effusive in praising the hotel staff who made their stay memorable. 

A special shout out to Ms. Radini Wadinambu who went out of her way to make sure everything is taken care of and exemplified customer service.
column13: Magnificent views of golden sunset and super service at Sentido Heritance Negombo

column12: The check in process was horrific. It took over 90 minutes and a ¬£50 call to the UK booking agent to get checked in to our suite. We had to provide the hotel with the confirmation code that their head office had given the UK booking agent before they would check us in. It was very stressful & not the experience you‚Äôd expect from a five star hotel. The worse of it was that there was no apology. We were offered complimentary breakfast but this was then withdrawn. They also will not allow me to speak to a manager so I‚Äôve asked to speak to Ranjan Stanislaus but emails and WhatsApp messages are ignored. Very disappointing end to our Sri Lanka trip.

column12:
This is honestly one of my favourite hotels, it is a great place with very attentive staff. There was a diversity of food, although the dining area was a bit small and it was hard to find a place for breakfast or dinner (regardless at what time you went). 

The pool was spacious, with access to a grassy-portion overlooking the beach. The float-up pool bar was a definite plus too!

column12: I had an absolutely amazing time at the Heritance Negombo! The staff went above and beyond to make my birthday truly unforgettable. From the moment we arrived, the team went above and beyond to ensure we felt special. They surprised us with flowers, a beautiful cake and personalised service that truly made the day memorable. The hotel itself is stunning, with great amenities and a perfect location. I'd also like to highlight the amazing breakfast with a huge selection of food and the very helpful and friendly staff. I highly recommend Heritance Negombo for anyone looking to celebrate a special occasion or simply enjoy a luxurious getaway to Negombo or even for business purposes! The reception staff Gayan, Shiyan, Shenali and Kassandra were especially friendly and helped us whenever with an extra key card or if we would get locked out of the room.

column12: We arrived at 10am after flying from the UK and our rooms were ready for us. The staff are helpful and friendly and the rooms are beautifully designed, containing everything you need. We had a beautiful lunch which was reasonably priced and the breakfast buffet was superb. We spent the afternoon by the pool before staying one night and moving on to explore Sri Lanka. At only 30 minutes drive from the airport this is the perfect hotel to start your holiday.

column12:
Lovely motel in a beautiful location.
The staff were exceptional , food was tasty and our room was presented as an art form with the room keeper presenting us chocolates before bed time, they just couldn‚Äôt do enough for us.
They organised the cab to the airport with minimal fuss, a great end to our holiday.

column10: Tuk tuk to town or fish market is approx 600 Rp .. Fish market is a crazy experience but wear very good covered shoes. Say no to the guides.
column12: We only had a short stay at Jetwing Beach Hotel but thoroughly enjoyed our time. It is 15 minute tuk tuk to Negombo Town and very quiet at night being the off peak season in October.  We found all the staff to be outstanding and incredibly responsive. Negodi and all restaurant staff were wonderful and despite some communication issues with English it all came together in the end. Although quite an old building it has a colonial feel and our room was clean and well serviced making it very comfortable with a large king bed. ! Thank you for a great experience
column13: Great First stop in Sri Lanka near the Airport

It was out third stay and we will definitely return!!

column10: A tuk tuk into centre of Negombo should cost around 500 LKR. All banks can be found there, with ATMs.
column12:
Fabulous few days spent at this lovely hotel. The building is striking, and the bedrooms are large with fabulous bathrooms and air con. The large pool (must be at least 25m) is pleasantly warm, and has a constant depth of 4 feet. It was never over crowded.
The hotel is generally peaceful, and has a luxurious feel. You feel relaxed as soon as you walk through the entrance.
The staff are all excellent and I got the impression they are all happy in their work. Jetwing has ethical values regarding its employees, that I think are admirable.
Thank you to Kasuni in Reception for being especially helpful and kind.

column12:
Exceptional service & the warm welcome make your stay extra special üòÄ

Great staff that always serve with a lovely smile & very caring & attentive. The lovely young lady who checked us in was Professional, friendly & helpful. Unfortunately, we didn't get her name. Great location and great views. Stayed for 6 nights and had a great experience. Rooms need a bit of an update but very spacious & comfortable. I must say the shower room is a bit too dark with the dark paint.

A big thank you goes to Kamal for looking after us during our stay. He was very attentive, kind, caring, helpful & Professional. He made sure that there's enough water for us everyday as that's what we requested on a daily basis. He always made sure that we have what we need daily. Keep it up Kamal.

All staff are great, very hospitable, helpful, caring & kind.

This wonderful & efficient team is managed & led by an outstanding general manager, Mr. Ravindra De Silva. Thank you Mr. De Silva.

I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Well done & all the best!!

column12:
Wow what a beautiful place on the sandy shores of Negombo beach. From the moment we arrived, the service was genuine and the staff were all so incredibly welcoming. Suite rooms are just beautiful with views and a fantastic outdoor bathroom. Our butler Robert ensured everything was perfect. 

I enjoyed a great abhyanga massage at the spa and the kids spent endless hours in the pool. Wish we had stayed longer to enjoy more of those breathtaking Indian Ocean sunsets!

column12:
First day of our 2 week Sri lankan holiday and we have just enjoyed an indulgent breakfast.  A mix of local pastries, breads and fruits, along with strong coffee and finishing with Sri Lankan tea. The bonuses? Sitting outside after a morning thunderstorm, enjoying the view out to sea as we plan our day in Columbo and feeding breakfast treats to the resident squirrels  - so cute!
Our thanks to the attentive staff at Jetwing Beach and especially to Minoj, who made sure our cups were always hot and well-filled.
column13: Off to a great start in Sri Lanka

column6: {'id': '308529', 'name': 'Jetwing Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2498, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.243559, 'longitude': 79.84192, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d308529-Reviews-Jetwing_Beach-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingbeach/', 'address': 'Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Porutota Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 40, 'count2': 79, 'count3': 265, 'count4': 861, 'count5': 1253}}
column12:
What should we say? We definitely spent our best vacation here! Why was that?
1. The hotel staff and all the people we met were incredibly friendly. First of all, the hotel's tour guide (such a great person and we are delighted that we were able to get to know him: Thank you Fernando Prathap for arranging everything so well for us and allowing us to totally let go on vacation. That was more than service, we are incredibly grateful for your kind and open manner). We should also mention our great driver (Lasantha, who not only drove us, but also has an incredible amount of knowledge and took the time to explain everything to us in detail. He also organized everything for us. We had such great trips with you to Colombo and also to Sigiriya. We are also happy that we got to know you). Then we have to mention Dimal and Malaka, who made every beach day and every evening in the bar a wonderful experience for us. With their friendly and nice manner, we always had fun coming to the bar in the evening or spending a relaxed day on the beach. Thanks also to Nilan and his team, who waited for us every evening with a great dinner. The service was more than excellent. We looked forward to coming to dinner every day. More than a great performance from you! And finally, we should mention the men from the pool who always provided us with fresh towels.But you also warned us when it rained for 5 minutes or how we should behave in the sea. Really great service! (Miranda Poolboy).
2. The landscape and the excursions were excellent. I don't need to say much about the landscape of Sri Lanka. Simply fabulous. Such a beautiful country! We booked two excursions through the hotel and Fernando, which went without a hitch. Our guide on one of the excursions (Lal Fernando) was really great and explained everything! We were woken up in the morning and given a BreakfastBox and were perfectly happy. Everything was taken care of and we could just let ourselves go. We organized an excursion ourselves with Lasantha. It was also great because he took a lot of time and even went to the temples with us. Amazing!
3. The hotel: I don't have to say much. Contrary to some of the complaints I've read here, I have to say that the hotel was more than clean! The rooms were cleaned down to the smallest detail every day (thanks also to Dinesh and the team). We never had anything to complain about. Even the leaves on the lawn were removed every morning. Everything is top furnished with high comfort. The beds are great! We felt so comfortable. The dining area, the pools and the location by the sea are also indescribable. You have a direct sea view from every room. We also tried the gym, which was great and the coach showed us some new exercises. We even had the opportunity to go to Jetwing Blue for dinner (which we never did as we were so happy with our hotel and the people).
A big praise also to the hotel and the hotel management and the people about the handling of animals in the hotel: Because the hotel is located to the sea, it can of course happen that dogs and cats come by (which is not bad at all, because the dogs and cats are totally friendly as they are already used to people. Animals are part of nature. The hotel is totally friendly with these animals, unlike other hotels that simply shoo them away. We were always allowed to leave two wonderful dogs by our lounger. This enriched our vacation even more, as we also have a dog at home. Of course, consideration is also given to people who don't want this!!!)
Many thanks to all the people mentioned here. You have made our vacation something very special. We look forward to everyone who visits us in Germany! We will definitely be back, because we have fallen in love with Sri Lanka and the wonderful people!

column12:
Our first travel to Sri Lanka and the first best choice of staying at the Jetwings Beach‚Ä¶ sea facing property and absolute serene!!! column6: {'id': '308529', 'name': 'Jetwing Beach', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2498, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.243559, 'longitude': 79.84192, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d308529-Reviews-Jetwing_Beach-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingbeach/', 'address': 'Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Porutota Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 40, 'count2': 79, 'count3': 265, 'count4': 861, 'count5': 1253}}
column10: If you go off-season (May-Sept) the sea will most likely be too wild to go in any further than your knees but there are also less people
column12:
My family and I have traveled extensively, staying in many different hotels across various countries and in all price ranges. That being said, I can safely say that Jetwing Beach is one of the greatest places I‚Äôve ever had the opportunity to stay.

Every single member of the staff, from room service to the waiters, is incredibly friendly, helpful, thoughtful, and genuinely nice. It‚Äôs almost impossible to have a bad start to your day when you‚Äôre greeted by so many smiling faces just on your way from the room to breakfast.

The food is amazing; you can choose from traditional Sri Lankan dishes or typical Western cuisine, both of which are great. Even our son, who is a very picky eater, found some dishes that he loved. It‚Äôs true that sometimes there is a longer wait than what we Europeans are used to, but that only means your food is being prepared fresh to order. Also, we found longer waiting times to be typical of almost every other place in Sri Lanka as well.

The hotel is located directly on the beach; there isn‚Äôt even a road or anything you have to cross. You just step out of the hotel, and your feet will touch the sand. They also have a very nice pool area, also directly next to the beach, where you can lounge in the shade of some palm trees while watching the waves in the distance or the sunset after your swim.

The rooms are very nice, the AC works fine, and we especially loved the extra-large shower and the beach-facing balcony.

Room service is amazing‚Äîthey service your room several times a day, always making sure you have enough water, toilet paper, or other necessities (and sometimes, they‚Äôll have a sweet surprise for you!).

All in all, we spent two wonderful weeks here!
column13: One of the best experiences we've ever had

column12: I have been to all jetwing negombo hotels and a lot of other hotels in Sri Lanka. This place has it all. Nice beach , multiple pools , good food and an amazing staff BUT, the reason I didn‚Äôt give 5 stars is because the front officers are like robots with zero emotions. Didn‚Äôt like the two gentleman at the front at all.  They did their job but with a zero smile. I came from cinnamon habarana village and it‚Äôs like a huge difference at the front office. But at the same time the rest of the staff we bumped in to was full of smiles and really welcoming. Not up to the cinnamon level but very close to it. For example at all / most cinnamon hotels our kid was spoiled with so many requests. But i understand that part. Which is fine. Some really sweet room service young boys were attending to our needs. Finally didn‚Äôt like the pool guy at all. Maybe he is having an off day but he came off a bit rude. Overall will visit again coz the location is amazing.
column13: Excellent stay but could have been better with proper training to some staff

column12:
We were here for five amazing days and were blown away by the hospitality and comfort of this hotel. Some of our highlights were the beach under the palm trees, the wonderful swimming pools,  extremely comfortable beds, spa massages, delicious food and most of all the kind and attentive staff - pool attendants, bar staff, wait staff and cleaning staff. Special shout out to Thushantha and Kumar. 

We all had an incredible time and the only downside was having to drag ourselves away at the end of our holiday. We will not hesitate to return on our next trip to Sri Lanka.

column12: This was my second stay, and I regret it. The service levels in the restaurants and pool area are unacceptable. It took 20 minutes to get a drink after I had to chase the bar staff twice. The menu took 16 minutes to arrive after I requested it. Several staff members were inside the bar chatting instead of assisting the service team. I overheard them speaking in Sinhala, prioritizing orders for three European tables. It‚Äôs disheartening, especially since I didn‚Äôt experience this during my previous stay at Jetwing. As a hotelier, I see a lack of management oversight that is causing standards to slip. The value of the hotel has dropped so dramatically I won't be returning, but I did appreciate the friendliness of some staff members from reception.

We stayed for two nights at Jetwing Blue and it was a great experience. The food was delicious and the beachfront view and the surroundings were amazing. The staff is very friendly and supportive.

column12: Kingsley housekeeping is very good and friendly and efficient. He looked after all our needs. Friendly welcome and happy staff. The swimming pool is very clean and a very big room with bottled water. The view from our room was gorgeous with lovely palm trees.

column6: {'id': '308530', 'name': 'Jetwing Blue', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2428, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.241645, 'longitude': 79.84201, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d308530-Reviews-Jetwing_Blue-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingblue/', 'address': 'Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Porutota Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 104, 'count2': 143, 'count3': 321, 'count4': 830, 'count5': 1030}}
column12: House Keeper Kingsly who took care of us is very good person. He is very friendly and taks very nicely. He is so concern about the guests. For example I have drooped a small shamoo/ bath shiwer bottle in the bath room by mistake. When he was doing his service , he had cleaned everything nicely and asked me whether I got a cut injury or not. That means he is really taking care of guests residing in the rooms assigned to him. When I asked about sourrounding boutiques he described the things to me. I really wanted to buy a pair of bathroom slippers for my little grandson  who is five years old as his sizes are not available at the hotel. So Kingsly was telling me there are shops to buy things like that but better not buying many things as the quality may not be that good. He  further said  for a pair of slipers considering the need will be alright.This really show us his concern on the guests. So I would like to commend his services  and congratulate him for his good job done.

column12: We had an amazing experience thanks to the incredibly helpful and friendly staff, who were always ready to assist. Even though we arrived at our room a bit early while cleaning was still in progress, Sandun took care of it in record time and made sure we had plenty of water for the day. The location is perfect‚Äîjust 50 meters from the beach, with beautiful views from the rooms and a lovely swimming pool to enjoy. Highly recommended!
column13: Perfect Hotel for Arrivals and Departures in Sri Lanka

Beautiful hotel.
Room service was excellent, especially Sandun!

Even the rain did not spoil our stay. A Sri Lankan smile makes the sun shine any day!!

column12:
Houskeeping Mr. Kingsly you done a great job.

I was thoroughly impressed by the housekeeping service. The room was impeccably clean.The attention to detail was remarkable‚Äîeverything from the bathroom to the floor and surfaces was spotless. I especially appreciated the little touches, like neatly arranging personal items and making sure amenities were always replenished.

The housekeeper was respectful of my space and worked efficiently.It truly made my stay comfortable and stress-free. Thank you for maintaining such a high standard of cleanliness and care. I look forward to staying here again!

Room house keeper- Kingsley

column12:
We returned to this hotel after 12 years. Since our first visit, nothing has changed My family and I had an amazing time during our week-long stay in a suite, with the balcony jacuzzi being our favorite feature. Damion was incredibly helpful and accommodating, going the extra mile to fulfill my last-minute request for a candlelight dinner by the beach and even securing a discount for us.

The restaurant staff, particularly Babara and Ureka, took exceptional care of us, ensuring that our two-year-old received all her off-menu requests. Viduranga from room service consistently delivered our dinners to the room with great care, and our favorite was the breakfast buffet for its wide variety. Shelton, who kept a watchful eye on my daughter outside the dining area, was truly an unsung hero. 

The Butlers, Susantha, Roy & Jagath, were outstanding, always addressing our needs and surprising us with little sweet treats during turn down service. The friendly and smiling staff made our stay truly memorable. We are looking forward to returning for another great stay.
column13: The friendly and smiling staff make your stay memorable

column6: {'id': '308530', 'name': 'Jetwing Blue', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2428, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.241645, 'longitude': 79.84201, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d308530-Reviews-Jetwing_Blue-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingblue/', 'address': 'Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Porutota Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 104, 'count2': 143, 'count3': 321, 'count4': 830, 'count5': 1030}}
column10: There is a steady stream of Tuk Tuks to take you to local places of interest. Be firm in where you want to go.
column12: We have had a great chill out time at this Hotel. We have been in Sri Lanka for a two week tour, which ended with a 5 night stay in Negombo at Jetwing Blue. When we arrived in Sri Lanka we stayed a couple of nights in Colombo and then went on a 7 day tour around the country. To finish up chilling out here has been perfect. The tour was a bit hectic, so this has been a good place to relax before flying home. The hotel is located right on a beautiful beach and our room had a view overlooking the pool and the beach. The hotel is ideally located being by the beach but also to places of interest close by. The hotel caters for your every need and the staff are very attentive. Nothing is too hard for them. A great restaurant overlooking the beach and a good variety of food. Highly recommend their buffet dinners. If you want to eat out there is also a good choice of restaurants to choose from which offer local fare or western food if that is your preference. We would definitely come back here. Many more options in Negombo rather than Colombo. As mentioned previously, all the staff have been excellent but special call out to our house boy Thisal who kept our room in tip top shape and Babara who works in the restaurant and ensured we were well catered for. Both these people engaged with us and took personal interest in our well being.

column263:
We planned on splitting up our trip from Sydney to Paris (on Sri Lankan Airlines) with a stay in Colombo.  Initially we were planning a couple of weeks but due to the impending presidential elections and DFAT advice we cut it down to a couple of days. We had a great experience with Jetwing hotels back in early 2019 so figured they would be a safe bet for a couple of all inclusive days with full board. We looked specifically at Jetwing Blue and Jetwing Sea - but life got in the way for a couple of days and we missed the 30 day ‚Äòearlybird booking‚Äô window by a day - so prices went up by 20-25 percent approx. We asked if there was any flexibility? Nope. The person at the other end of the email came up with a ‚Äòdeal‚Äô since we were arriving at midnight and leaving at midnight with two full days in between (pay the room only rate for the first and last day - and the full board rate in between) - the deal actually cost the same as paying for 3 full nights on the Jetwing Website at the full board rate. So we did that instead to avoid any issues as to meals.

The absolute highlight of the stay was the full board / Breakfast Lunch and Dinner daily - great food, particularly the set menu options at lunch and dinner - really had our fill of stunning Sri Lankan food and delicious deserts - in fact the person making the daily soup options and daily dessert options should have a culinary medal - just outstanding. The breakfast buffet was fine - interesting options and eggs to order and the lovely chef made one of the juices without sugar for our second day breakfast - Sugar is pretty much everywhere unfortunately - particularly in the bread, which is a shame - we‚Äôd love to see more paratha/fresh naan/dosai etc - the local breads were outstanding but the bread basket at lunch and dinner is not worth worrying about - but then we didn‚Äôt stop in Sri Lanka to eat bread. The catering staff - front and back - are just fabulous

The front desk staff (which I should have expected based on the responses during the booking process) are just not particularly hospitable. Having missed out on the discount that made this stay affordable, we booked a standard room. I emailed to say I‚Äôd appreciate a bath tub. Nope. You need to book the more expensive room.  The hotel was by no means full - massive, and almost empty. I asked again when we arrived at midnight after a very rocky flight - nope. If you want a tub, come back in the morning and pay for it.  We tried to connect to wifi at the front desk at midnight. Didn‚Äôt work. Said so. They pointed to the password again. Still didn‚Äôt work. (If pointing at things made them magically work, we‚Äôd all be doing it!) We got to the standard room (which I‚Äôm sure looked snazzier when the hotel was built 52 years ago). There was a big stain on the runner at the bottom of the bed. I called down to say the wifi still didn‚Äôt work and to come and get the dirty linen. Someone came up and still didn‚Äôt get the wifi to work. Be aware as a woman in Sri Lanka, nothing is officially ‚Äònot working‚Äô until a bloke has taken your phone and tried to put the password in a dozen times. Just sayin‚Äô is all. Eventually a technician came up to the room and, having put the password in multiple times, finally agreed it wasn‚Äôt working and finally accepted that the problem was not our devices and finally trotted off and reset the router/modem gizmo. FINALLY!  So at least we had wifi.  We slept, ate, swam, slept more and walked to the ocean for a look. Then walked back to swim in the pool. Day two started alarmingly when they set up a scaffold on our building, just 2 rooms down from ours and started hacking into the concrete. It looked cancerous. More hacking ensued.  Knowing that we were leaving at midnight, we really, really could not be bothered even trying to speak to the Front Desk as answers to all questions so far pretty much resulted in words to the effect of NOPE. We put earplugs in, turned the A/C to high and tried to ignore the incessant hammering and smashing. They did stop at meal times. Thoughtful. We went and discussed our displeasure with the front desk just before dinner. Ohhhhh‚Ä¶ If only you‚Äôd said something, we would have moved you. SERIOUSLY! If only you‚Äôd visited the guests in the wing you were starting to smash apart and said, sorry about this, let us put you somewhere else for the day‚Ä¶ Eventually, as he was away on urgent business, the General Manager who is a lovely gentleman returned to the hotel and we had a good chat.  He has been in hospitality for many, many years and understands the concept. Possibly the only person in the Jetwing Sea who does (aside from the darling chefs and wait staff team).  Anyway. It‚Äôs an old hotel and not aging at all gracefully. Sri Lanka is suffering a skill drain and it‚Äôs obviously very, very difficult to get good staff, let alone keep them. If you have low expectations, unending patience, manage to book more than 30 days out (precisely) and just want a couple of days between flights, it will do the job. Probably.
column264: Overall a three, however, the food and serving staff are a five........

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column10: Ask for a room in the new wing
column12:
We choose jet-wings sea to be closer to the airport and stayed one night. 

Our rooms were in the new wing and they were excellent - well appointed, large, great bathroom and a sitout that opened onto a lawn and then the beach. Comfortable bed.

The swimming pool is 20m long, clean with perfect temp. 

We had a la carte lunch which was great, though we felt that the breakfast spread could have more variety. 

Overall excellent value for money.
column13: Great rooms in the New wing

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}

The location is very beautiful. it is close to the beach. the cool breeze in the evening is another thing which made me more romantic. the big coconut garden is a superb place to hang out in the summers. the rooms r fully furnished. you can feel yourself royal. its very comfortable and you can have a cozy stay,

column12:
Great stay at Jetwing sea, food was amazing and reasonably priced. The rooms were big and very comfortable.
Staff were friendly and attentive. There are 2 big pools and the location is very nice and on the beach, thank you for such a great stay

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
I find it difficult to do a review for this hotel as we really liked the staff and the location of this hotel. For the price we paid, which we think is the off season, the hotel was very good. I cannot imagine paying full price for this hotel, will tell you why below.
The location is perfect, beachfront, near a fishing village, on a small street, a bit busy. I am sure it would be busier during the peak season.
The hotel is definitely dated, and could use a small facelift. Mind you, it is really well maintained, meaning that it is very clean.
The common areas needs updating, of fix the small issues.
The rooms are not bad, clean and comfortable.
Wifi is poor, I thought.
We paid for breakfast, which I thought was very disappointing. They charge a lot for breakfast and the food was extremely poor, in terms of quality, taste and variety.
We only had in one morning and decided to go eat outside.
Now for the pros, the staff are very courteous and helpful, always with a smile, this is exactly what I would expect.
The pool is also very nice and clean.
We will definitely stay here again. Hope they would do something to improve the quality of the food.

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}

column12:

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
We recently stayed at the Jetting Sea Hotel for a family reunion, booking four rooms on a full-board basis, and our experience was amazing. The food was not only delicious but also offered a great variety, with options that pleased everyone in the group. A special shout-out to Mr. Rukshan(  Rukshan or Rukmal)  who went above and beyond to accommodate our requests, even preparing special meals for the babies that weren‚Äôt available in the buffet.

The reception staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, making us feel right at home from the moment we arrived. The service throughout our stay was impeccable, and the rooms were spotless, beautifully maintained, and offered stunning views that our family loved. The hotel‚Äôs location is ideal, with incredible views of both sunrise and sunset, enhancing our overall experience.

We would also like to thank Mr. D. De Silva, the manager, for his exceptional service and for upgrading our rooms at no extra cost. All our rooms were on the same floor, with the best views available, which made our stay even more special. 

Our entire family thoroughly enjoyed our time here, and we are already looking forward to returning for our next visit. Highly recommended!
column13: Exceptional Family Reunion Stay with Stunning Views and Outstanding Service

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
A solid choice. We spent one night here after landing late in Colombo. The hotel is dated, staff is very friendly and committed. The pool is a great feature as well as a stroll to the sea in the morning (the beach seems endless). The breakfast buffet is good (not great) 
The AC makes a lot of noise. 
We learnt later that Sri Lanka hotels can be a world better. Still a solid choice. No regrets.

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
Very nice hotel, brilliant location 
Food was superb, although the seafood restaurant was closed due to a private party, the chef said I could order and fish/seafood dish and he would cook it for me.
In the end I went for seafood platter from the menu and it was to die for
OH had been tenderloin which was nice but a bit tough 
Service was also excellent, would be happy to return

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12: Our last stop during the short holiday at Jetwing Sea was amazing. We were highly satisfied with the service provided by the hotel staff. The food was fantastic; nothing negative to say, just a memorable stay. This is actually our second time here. All the foods were delicious, and the service was excellent. They particularly treat Sri Lankan with great hospitality. The pools are spacious and kept spotless by a dedicated attendants and it was lovely open the curtains in the morning and see the beach right outside our room!
column13: Memorable experience and great hospitality at Jetwing Sea!

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
We stayed 4 days at this hotel and there is only good things to say: the room it‚Äôs clean and spacious. 
The staff are very friendly,courteous and helpful.
I would like to thank all the team! Specialy thanks to abdulla,who worked at reception gave a wonderful service May, the gards that were always assinting with a smile. üòä 
The breakfest its very good! I loved  Milk rice with fish curry and sambol but in special the coffee.
amazing 
And after a full day seeing negombo , we arrived at our room and it has a kind surprise from the cleaning service: a folded towel 
The swiming pool its very nice and clean.
The location is very good. 
When I travel with family all details are important and counts. And this hotel think and care about their costumers. I totaly recomend and I will stay there again in future for sure. Good friends and great memories to remember.

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12: We were welcomed with fruit juice. The reception staff were hasty in wanting our passports, however we found this common in Sri Lanka. The hotel is a very long building so all rooms have a sea view. The lift was at the end of the wing so a long walk to lift and then back to the restaurant / reception. While there were stairs in the centre of the hotel there did not appear to be a working lift. Our room was spacious with a large bathroom. The tap over the basin was hard to use as it is too close to the back. Jug and tea bags were provided. The breakfast catered for all tastes with the more western food in a separate room. It was good being able to look out at the beach while eating.

column12: Nothing to say negative, such a memorable stay with Jetwing sea. Actually this is our second stay. All foods were delicious and service is great. They specially treat Sri Lankans with great hospitality. Beach is rough when we were there, bathing is not recommended. Two pools are there including baby pool. Room is clean with excellent amenities. All meals served in buffet. Free parking on the other side of the road.

column10: Go with the Sri Lankan food at the buffet. While the Western food offered is ok, the Sri Lankan food is excellent by hotel standards.
column12:
We were very happy with our stay here. Our flight arrived just after midnight and so it was nice to have a hotel so close to the airport to have a good, comfortable sleep to begin our trip.
The buffet breakfast in the morning was excellent (well above what I expected) and the rooms were neat and clean.
The pool is nice and big and kept spotless by an ever vigilant pool attendant and it was lovely to open the curtains in the morning and see the beach right outside your room!
All up, this was a great place to begin our trip in Sri Lanka and we will most likely stay again when we next go.

Very  open plan  and airy  rooms are   A/C  and  very  comfortable,   I had a  plunger  coffee maker and filter  coffee. 
 Shower  was great
column12:
This was a transit  hotel for  me   from Sri Lankan airlines.
 As soon as I   started  check in  the   reception  Hiruni  noticed  it  was my  birthday !    when I checked into  the  room    there  were  ballons  wishing  me  happy  birthday and later   she  and  staff  members    bought  me  a  very  nice   cake   with my  name   on it,  I was deeply  touched and  thank Hiruni and the  guys    from  my  heart  it  made  me  feel  extra special.
 The hotel   is right  on the  beach   and  has   lot's of  services and a pool  it  would  be  a  fantastic place  to  stay    for  a few  days   alas I  was there  only    9 hours.

column10: One tip for future guests: if you have the chance to explore outside the hotel, do so! The road along the hotel offers plenty of great eatin
column12:
We spent our Poson Poya holiday at Jetwing Sea and had a wonderful time. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by Hiruni, who was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. She also assisted us during check-out, making the whole process smooth and pleasant. Kudos to Hiruni for her excellent service!

The food options, although not extensive, were delicious and catered well to Sri Lankan local tastes, with a good amount of spice. We appreciated the authenticity and quality of the meals.

The hotel features two pools, which were great for relaxation. However, there is no dedicated kids‚Äô pool, but we managed just fine with what was available.

For the price we paid, Jetwing Sea offered a very good vacation experience. The overall atmosphere was welcoming, and the amenities provided were satisfactory. We would definitely consider staying here again and recommend it to others looking for a pleasant getaway.
column13: Great choice for a budget vacation

column6: {'id': '316667', 'name': 'Jetwing Sea', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 2314, 'locationString': 'Kochchikade, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.251501, 'longitude': 79.84224, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g2269230-d316667-Reviews-Jetwing_Sea-Kochchikade_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwingsea/', 'address': 'Palangaturai, Kochchikade, Negombo 11540 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Palangaturai', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kochchikade', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11540'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 108, 'count3': 296, 'count4': 854, 'count5': 996}}
column12:
The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable, with every amenity provided. The rooms were clean with a nice sea view, enhancing our overall experience.

The food was delicious, with both the dinner buffet and breakfast buffet offering a great variety of tasty dishes. The breakfast had a particularly wide selection of food, making for a wonderful start to the day. 

The staff were friendly and provided outstanding service, especially Hiruni and the restaurant staff. We had a pleasant dining experience.

Overall, this is a fantastic place for families and couples. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We absolutely loved it. Highly recommended!

column12: The rooms are spacious, modern and airy! The shower and bathroom replicates the "old Raj" look with a complete outdoor experience! Loved the staff and ambience! The pool is 100m long and leaves us relaxed and comfortable! Don't miss this gem of a stop before you head out on your adventures or before you hop on the plane to head back home--it's not far from the airport! Definitely a repeat customer in the future!

column12: Beautiful Geoffrey Bawa design property with lagoon view from the dining terrace and a giant 100m pool. Huge room with elegantly  simple and  yet luxurious interior. Grounds are serene with tasteful architectural touches. Great for get away!
column13: Elegant resort for perfect get away

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Jetwing lagoon is a beautiful property landlocked between the Negombo lagoon and the sea, with a breathtaking view.

The amenities are on par with its peer hotels in Sri Lanka, the food is some of the best we‚Äôve ever had in the island, the Ayurvedic spa offers wonderful treatments and the hotel overall  has a very calming atmosphere.

But the best asset of the hotel is probably its staff, who offer impeccable service. From the moment we checked in we had our every need attended to. Prabath from the hotel provided an amazing service which made our stay all the more delightful. Every single member of the staff was friendly and always had a smile on their face.

It was an absolutely memorable stay and we will definitely be visiting again.
column13: Wonderful, must-visit property offering the best service

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Fabulous hotel/wellness experience. Huge rooms, clean airy and the biggest indoor/outdoor bathroom ever. Tried the free foot massage and so great by Anoma that I booked for a full leg for the afternoon and full body the next day. Perfect to ease tight and painful calves, ready for our tour.
Breakfast is included and enough so you really don‚Äôt need to eat again, served overlooking the lake . Highly recommend

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Excellent food and very peaceful , serene atmosphere. Would definitely recommend Jetwing for a nice couples retreat.

The staff was very helpful for all aspects of our stay. We were only here for one night so we did not have time to try the spa treatments but we will definitely be back.

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Rumesh has done a super job. One of the best SPA treatments I ever had.  Please is so clam and quiet. It has a long pool. One side beach and other side lagoon. 

Food is yummy. Place is clean. Beach also nice however, can have sea bath. Sea is rough. 

After long trip around the country or just land from the airport this is few min drive from airport to relax after just arrival or just before departure.

column12: Went to the ayrurweda spa and had an amazing experience. Ms Ayesha did an excellent work and she is super friendly and nice. Love the vibe and I love how they do an initial consultation and then recommend what and how and which oil treatment to go ahead with. Great job!!!!

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Superb massage - through to the post massage drink was superb. I would especially like to thank Anoma and Rumesh. Anoma was gentle in manner but gave a deep soothing massage - one of the best I have ever had. Rumesh made my husband feel comfortable and his massage was very rejuvenating. The steam treatment as the end really made it special.

Thank you once again - we will not forget our first Sri Lanka massage.

Kind regards

column12:
A very pleasant stay at JETWING Lagoon. 
A complimentary foot massage was delightful as was a morning yoga session. 
Probath and his team in the restaurant were outstanding with their attention & explanation of the Sri Lankan cuisine. 
Our stay was delightful
