they seems selected for each of our body conditions. 
the private room keeps enough privacy to spend relaxing time

column12:

column12: We stayed in the Luxury (with terrace).  Really nice room with novel outdoor bathroom out back.  Beautiful big pool and very quiet and peaceful with nice garden oasis.  About 15-29mins out of town but easy to get a tuk tuk o reach other areas for restaurants but also good food (but a little pricey) in the hotel restaurant.

Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. While we are thrilled to hear that you had an enjoyable stay at our hotel, we appreciate your understanding regarding the upcoming renovations and the transition to a wellness resort. The new concept aims to further enhance the wellness experiences, and we are excited about the possibilities it will bring.

We usually offer a set menu on weekdays, and we understand that it may not have been what you expected. However, we are pleased that you found the food to be a highlight, nonetheless. column12:
Last night of our 3 day stay at the lagoon. Mixed feelings as we found out the hotel is closing end of month for renovations and a new ayrevedic concept. 

Can see why with rooms being dated and in need of repair. Having said that our experience has been enjoyable. Staff are friendly and kind despite the uncertainty. Food has been a set menu rather than buffet we were expecting as they are controlling stock. Still the food has been a highlight. 

Hotel does feel a bit desolate with very few guests. At times it felt we were the only ones there though there were a spattrting of other guests. 

Enjoyed spa treatments and if their new concept is based on Avrevedic treatments they will do well. 

Wish them all the best and thank you for making our few days at the hotel a pleasant one.
column13: A decent stay but about to close for renovation

column10: Our room had cockroaches in the bed, a terrible experience.
column12:
This hotel was once an amazing hotel with great architecture by Geoffrey Bawa. The layout and the long pool is still great. But unfortunately this hotel is currently in a bad state and urgently in need of many essential upgrades. 

We paid for a expensive premium room, with an interesting planning and architecture. But problems soon arose. Firstly our AC didnt work. Secondly our bed had cockroaches (!), which was a terrible experience. The wifi also did not work. Eventually we got a room upgrade. Our new room was better, but in also in a bad state with a non-functioning fridge. 

It seems like the entire property lacks proper maintainance. The hotel area also had a bad smell many parts of the day, and also many annoying crows near the pool area (a general Negombo problem). Some of the employees are amazing, and very very friendly and helpful but their assistance could not improve our experience to an acceptable level. 

The price is very overprised. In the current situation this is barely a 3 star hotel, not 5 as stated. I can, unfortunately, not recommend this hotel to anyone in the current situation.
column13: Find another hotel in Negombo, dont stay until the hotel is properly renowated and maintained

column6: {'id': '2510666', 'name': 'Jetwing Lagoon', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1567, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.168034, 'longitude': 79.82589, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d2510666-Reviews-Jetwing_Lagoon-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglagoon/', 'address': 'Pamunugama Road Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha, Negombo 11504 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pamunugama Road', 'street2': 'Thalahena, Shramadana Mawatha', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11504'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 24, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 91, 'count4': 469, 'count5': 953}}
column12:
Good things first:
The rooms were absolutely amazing. Room service options were great and worth the price. The pools, yes pools, there are two, one within and once across the street. Both are amazing - you can watch the sunset from the pool across the street.

The bad:
This started with the booking. We had a booking made by a friend as a gift, which we confirmed before arrival but once we arrived we were told we had to make the full payment. Their bookings through booking.com is apparently irrelevant to the hotel. This is fine, there are different procedures but they made a huge fuss and was unapologetic about it making it super awkward between us and our friends. Took us over an hour to sort things and check-in. Some attitude they‚Äôve got.

The mehs:
The buffet was just meh and for their prices I might have to say it wasn‚Äôt really worth it.

The plusses:
The spa, massages, are great, they do have a doctor in-house so the treatment you get is methodical and you can feel it but it is a bit pricey. The view of the lagoon is great throughout the day and at night. The guy who gave us the buggy ride as we checked out was one of the few staff members who would go above and beyond to make a guest smile!

Overall okay. But I can‚Äôt whole heartedly give any more stars because having been to many other Jetwing hotels, this being one of the most expensive ones, customer service wasn‚Äôt great. But I must reiterate, the rooms, the view and the experience is nice.
column13: Nice views but not the nicest of the Jetwings hotels.

column12: Such a beautiful hotel! The luxurious rooms surround a giant swimming pool. Restaurant serves a wonderful breakfast buffet. Right between the lagoon and the beach. There's a second smaller pool by the beach, too, which I didn't realise until later. Lovely outdoor spa showers and sitting areas in the rooms. Five star treatment. Also, the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and even gave me the use of a day room to cool off after I'd checked out and while I was waiting for my evening flight. Highly recommend staying here if you're in Negombo!
column13: Such a lovely and luxurious place

column12: Just a beautiful hotel, we had the suite, roomy and well appointed with mini bar, complimentary fruit and spa. Service is exceptional in all areas everyone is efficient, friendly and ready to please, food has been wonderful and on commenting on a particular dish the Manager  went to the trouble of getting me the recipe. Danushka served us daily with a beautiful smile, just lovely people. Last but not least the swimming pool is amazing. If all Jetwing hotels are at this standard we will be back.

column12: We organized a five day residential retreat with a group of 25 international professionals at the Jetwing Lagoon. The staff of Jetwing Lagoon, from the General Manager to the restaurant, F&B and housekeeping staff were all extremely cooperative. Our event went seamlessly without any hiccup and all our participants felt well looked after. The staff was proactive, communicative and showed a genuine interest in contributing to making our event success. We cannot thank them enough for small gestures, such as a beautiful welcome ceremony by the lagoon and a lovely BBQ and campfire organised on the beach for our farewell. Jetwing lagoon staff did Sri Lanka proud.

column5:
{'id': '941726630', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience at Jetwing Lagoon on TripAdvisor. We are thrilled to hear that you had such a wonderful time during your yoga retreat program held at our hotel.

It's fantastic to know that you enjoyed the unique blend of Geoffrey Bawa's architectural design, the serene surroundings of both the beach and lagoon, and the delicious culinary offerings during your stay. We take great pride in offering a variety of dining options to cater to different preferences, and we're delighted that you found plenty of vegetarian and vegan options to suit your tastes.

We're also pleased to hear that you found your room comfortable and beautifully appointed, with the high ceilings, earthy tones, and Bawa-designed furniture adding to the ambiance of your stay. It's wonderful that you were able to relax and rejuvenate in the spacious bathroom and enjoy the fragrant toiletries provided.

We're glad you were able to take advantage of the expansive pool area and enjoy both the pool and the beach during your stay. Your feedback about the peaceful and quiet atmosphere of the beach is much appreciated, as we strive to provide a tranquil environment for our guests to unwind and connect with nature.

Our team works hard to ensure that every guest feels welcomed and well taken care of, so it's gratifying to hear that you found our staff helpful throughout your stay.

Thank you for recommending Jetwing Lagoon Negombo to other travelers seeking a peaceful getaway in beautiful surroundings. We would be delighted to welcome you back for another relaxing and healing stay in the future.

Ayubowan! (May you have a long life),

Chitra Chandrasiri

column12:
I stayed at the Jetwing Lagoon Negombo for a yoga retreat program, and it was a wonderful place to experience the best of many worlds, including the resort itself designed by Geoffrey Bawa with decor that I wanted in my own home (!), direct access to both the beautiful beach on one side where you can see the sun set, as well as the Lagoon on the other side where you can see the sun rise. The foods and beverages offered, either as a course meal, a la carte, or buffet, were delicious and plenty to choose from. It was a treat to start the day with yoga facing the sun and breeze, then nourish my body with fresh coconut and papaya juice, plenty tropical fruits, freshly made hoppers and other Sri Lankan delights; there were many vegetarian/vegan options to choose from. The room I stayed in was gorgeous with high ceilings, overlooking the largest pool I have ever seen in a hotel, earthy tones, and Geoffrey Bawa-designed furniture, beds were always clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also very spacious and comfortable, with a tub in the middle, and very pleasant fragrant toiletries all available. There is also a pool right by the beach, so you have the option to dip both in the pool as well as in the beach. The beach was very quiet when I was there with hardly anyone there, which gave me privacy to fully enjoy and freely roll around the beach soaking up all nature has to offer. The staff were very helpful from beginning to end. Overall, had a fantastic, relaxing and healing stay here and would recommend it to anyone visiting Sri Lanka who is looking for a peaceful getaway in beautiful and well-run surroundings.

column12: Hi I went on a yoga retreat to Jetwing lagoon. I have been there few times earlier too. The property us one of the most serene properties you could find by the lagoon. The lawn, the trees and the ambience is perfect for a peaceful yoga retreat or even for a relaxing vacation with family or friends. The staff is extremely helpful. The pool by the beach and the long pool in the property itself is an added bonus for sure. Very spacious room. Great staff. Loved the place and recommend it.

column12:
Three nights solo stay at less than $200 was indeed a bargain. 
With a balcony view of the pool and ocean, large double bed, large desk, fridge and chairs with a table.
Beach front property with two pools and an outdoor bar with music  large restaurant which I didn't use. Helpful reception staff on check-in.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12:
Had a very bad experience at Camelot beach hotel.
We went there for a Day out package. They took more than one hour to check in. And they had a big fuss to give us room. Staffs are not educated. They don‚Äôt know how to handle a customer. Very poor service. Never seen such useless hotel.
And while eating we got a fishing net on our food. Fishing net was inside the crab flesh. I can‚Äôt image how they can be so careless and Not hygiene place eat. Very poor food quality. I have attached the pics below. Pls check it
column13: Very bad hotel and inexperienced staffs

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: The hotel is located right by the beach. We had our rooms in the ‚Äúold wing‚Äù of the hotel. Unfortunately the elevator was broken but it was totally ok to climb the stairs to the room. We had full board and the breakfast and dinner were served from an extremely extensive buffet. Breakfast was one of the best I‚Äôve seen in a hotel in Sri Lanka. Lunch was selected from a menu and was vey filling. On dinner they had some music performances which was great. The dinner buffet was also very good with amazing selection. They have two pools and good seating areas by the pool. Beach is quite dirty by the hotel. Rooms weren‚Äôt the biggest but it was totally enough for two people. The balcony was quite little.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column10: Be sure to ask for the wood apples. They are super healthy and yummy.
column12:
I have always loved staying at Camelot. Their smoothie bar for breakfast is wonderful. Always lots of beautiful avocados and passion fruits. And they have my super favorite pickled Ambarella. 
The staff are all great, but I have to name Shanika, Sewwandi, Ayesh, Sithumi, Darshi. They are all so hardworking, friendly and service-oriented. 

Can't say enough about the whole place. It's a great value!
column13: Great staff, always helping make your stay pleasant

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column10: Advisable to stay at this hotel
column12: Service was excellent starting from reception area to cleaningness of the whole facility. We arrived at 2 AM and had been welcomed by reception staff. All arrangements with organising trips and communications have been done in high professional level by Charindu, Sasindu, Kavishka and the rest of reception staff members. High compliments to be put to housekeeping staff Nirupama and Anton for keeping room clean and tidy. Kitchen team under management of Mr Dahanayake has done a great job in providing very healthy and nutritious food. Especially we liked buffet type breakfast with variety of meals for all tastes and food preferences. Resort's grounds have been kept in perfect order by staff working on the garden roles like Mr Bertie. Resort's manager Mr Jude personally approached us for any suggestions or comments about our staying. We greatly appreciate all efforts of the whole team under his management to keep our holiday as comfortable as possible. This resort has earned our big compliments and we will recommend it for staying. We will be back here on our next trip to Sri Lanka.
column13: Excellent service and staying in Camelot Beach Hotel

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: This is a very pleasant hotel, right on the beach and close to shops, restaurants and bars. The rooms are really good sizes, there are 2 pools and the staff are really friendly and helpful. We tried the restaurant for lunch, which was very good value with high quality food, and the breakfast was also good too. I would recommend this hotel.
column13: Good value hotel in a great location

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: We stayed at the hotel for two nights at the end of our trip throughout Sri Lanka. The employees and service was excellent, particularly Priyangi Hansini and Janith Dishan were lovely with the younger children we travelled with. Food is great and the pool and hotel is in good order. One star deduction due to the dirty and trash littered beach.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: Comfortable room, lovely service - although check in took quite a while, but we were offered cold towels and a welcome drink which was great. Buffet had a good selection for both evening meals and breakfast. Only stayed one night so didn‚Äôt get chance to use the pool/ beach hence the 3* review. No complaints.
column13: Decent quality comfortable hotel with good service.

column12: We only stayed for three nights, but what a great experience! The buffet was excellent as were the staff in the restaurant. Special mention needs to be made of Miss Priyangi, Miss Sewwandi, Mr Ayesh, and Mr Farhan who were all most helpful and attentive during our stay. They are a great asset to the hotel.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: We've been there on 2 different moments in 1 trip. The first time the check-in took way too long, the second time they had definitely learned from our feedback and the check-in was much faster. The rooms are clean and spacious and if you're lucky they are ground floor so you can directly enter the swimming pools. Swimming in the sea is not advised because of strong currents. The food was good, but other restaurants are within walking distance.
column13: Good hotel near to the airport.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12:
Thank you for making our one week stay a pleasant one.

We would like to thank the 

- Kitchen staff: Chef Eranda, Dilanka, Sajan, Enoka, all the other chefs, also adding Nipun, Thikshana, Lahiru, & the rest of the team members. 

- Restaurant & Bar staff: Priyangi, Vishva, Nipuna, Sithumini, Chanaka, Nawitha, Kokila, Kalidu. (Thank you for providing us an excellent service, very professional and always with a smile greeting us all.)

- House keeping staff: Madushan, Shasika, Wadeeha, Sehal, Anton, and all the rest of the staff members. 

- Pool staff: Priyanta, Raj, Uditha, Bogoda, Ajith and Viraj.

A big shout out to all the maintenance staff who are working behind the scenes. Always greet with a smile. 

Thanks once again to Shehan, Dulakshani & Dilshani. Keep up the good work! 

Things to Improve:
* Very slow Wifi facilities.
* More entertainment and activities.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12:
We were first presented to a room without a balcony and sea view which didn‚Äôt match the description of my booking. When I brought out this issue, the hotel staff said the rooms were fully booked. I insisted in getting a room that matched my booking. We waited for a while and they finally gave me a room with balcony and a bit of sea view.
However, the room is so old that definitely needed some renovation. The air con fan couldn‚Äôt work probably. There were drippings from it. Their towels got some stains too.
From my observation, there are old wing and new wing building in this hotel. I don‚Äôt know what are their criteria on where to put the guests but we were put in the old wing building. 
They do have a nice pool facing the beach but the rooms really letted us down.
The room costed around $78 per night and I didn‚Äôt expect the quality like this. Very disappointing.
column13: Old hotel, not value for money

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12:
Starting with the front desk Shehan, Dulakshani, Ireshan has being very helpful and gone out of the way to make our stay a pleasant and enjoyable one to remember. 

We would like to give special thanks to Dilanka, all kitchen staff & the restaurant staff Sewwandi, Dilum, Farhan for an excellent service of making an effort to cater for 2 vegetarians.

We would also like to thank each and everyone who‚Äôs working in house keeping, pool & bar staff. Pool staff always try to find a spot for our liking each time they see us. Thank you. Sorry for not mentioning all the staff names. 

We thank the gentleman who‚Äôs always standing near the restaurant by the pool each morning scaring away the birds while we have our breakfast. He‚Äôs always with a smile and so pleasant. Thank you for the tremendous service you provide.

We would like to also thank the security staff for always greeting us with a smile. 

Thank you once again for making our vacation a fabulous one & will be back. We will surely recommend Camelot Beach Hotel. 

We wish you have more variety of Srii Lankan foods such as hoppers,
pittu, string-hoppers, & more selection of protein base dishes for vegetarians.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12: The first hotel in my life where the AC was not working, the room service refused to give tooth brush as they did not have in stock. No room service after 12 in the night and thus extra blanket was not available. On top of it, hardly any vegetarian food when we had paid for it and mosquitoes in desserts. Pathetic staff. Go at your own risk. Don't get fooled by the beach view. Multiple hotels with a better beach view available

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column10: I ask the chef to chop up some fresh garlic and fresh ginger to add to my sambar, and he always helps me out. Healthy!
column12:
I have been coming here for many months, so I have a lot of experience with the excellent staff, menu and environment. 

I often eat the breakfast buffet here, which is superb. They have a wonderful smoothie bar, with super Sri Lankan fruit choices. If you are lucky you can get wood apple, my personal favorite fruit. They have my favorite veg -- Sri Lankan sweet potato. They have pickled mango, pickled ambarella, and pickled garlic. Superb! Their poached fish is to die for.

I have gotten to know the staff. They are all friendly, professional, hardworking, and extremely efficient, even when the restaurant is full. 

Too many staff to name as they are all excellent. Priyangi is a recent addition to the superb team. Kudos to all of them. 

I ask the chef for special fresh green mango (cut fruit0, and he tries his best to accommodate.
column13: Wonderful breakfast buffet, and superb staff!

column12: The grounds of this hotel are lovely. Two great swimming pools and a beach side bar with ala carte menu. Excellent buffet breakfast. Located between the beach and the shopping strip - the location couldn‚Äôt be better. Second walk to shops and pharmacy. The rooms are comfortable but a little shabby although the bathrooms are nice and there was hot water and consistent electricity. Area and hotel is safe and quiet - great for kids. Staff were excellent. A shoutout to Shehan, Kalindu, Kokila, and Janith!

Luckily they were very accommodating and we sat at the bar,  and had  lunch while enjoying the sea breeze and their beautiful gardens. Our pizza lunch was lovely. column12: This is our 3rd visit to Camelot and the standards have always been upto standard. The cleanliness of the rooms to the mouthwatering dishes prepared by all the talented chefs is amazing. It‚Äôs a very relaxing place to enjoy with your family. The hotel staff is very friendly and very helpful. Some of the amazing people whom we met here over the years are Chef Herath, Dulakshi (GRO), Kapila at the restaurant and Uditha the friendly pool attendant. I wish the Camelot staff all the very best and keep up the good work and the beaming smiles!

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column12:
We had a good time at the Camelot everything was fine.
Two lovely pools to enjoy always had sunbeds available also the beach was great.
Breakfast very good always something nice . We had a coastal room on the ground floor with a patio so it was just steps away from the pool.
We had a lovely surprise when we see our good friend viraj working here, good hard working man we have known for many years at a different hotel so happy to see him again. Also udotha pool attendant always has our sunbed ready we have also known for many years and a good friend.
The pool bar is great the staff there are always friendly happy to serve, a fantastic view overlooking the beach.Just outside the hotel are many shops bars and restaurants Camelot has a prime spot with tuk tuks outside to take you anywhere you wish. Will definitely be returning again.

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}

column6: {'id': '477844', 'name': 'Camelot Beach Hotel', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1385, 'locationString': 'Kudapaduwa, Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.23364, 'longitude': 79.84091, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g20034338-d477844-Reviews-Camelot_Beach_Hotel-Kudapaduwa_Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/camelot.lk/', 'address': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo, Kudapaduwa, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '345, Lewis Place, Negombo', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kudapaduwa', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 55, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 242, 'count4': 481, 'count5': 539}}
column10: Take up the half board option the foods good
column12: This is an excellent three srar hotel about 15 kilometres from the airport. Our room was clean and tidy with a proper shower cubicle and plenty of hot water.. There was, a fridge safe and tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The swimming pools, yes there were three, with two reasonably large pools and a small one. All of them were well maintained and clean. The only thing I would say as it was busy during our stay, a few more sunbeds and especially parasols would be useful. We went for the half board option and found both the breakfast and evening meals were good, well presented with plenty of choice. All in all we enjoyed our one night stay and could, quite happily, have stayed longer.

column5:
{'id': '942605346', 'text': 'Dear Eliyaroam, 

Thank you for choosing to stay at Camelot. We most certainly do have a variety of room categories to accommodate all requirements. 
I am surprised that  you were unable to find Sri lankan menu items for breakfast. The whole left side of the buffet has curries to milk rice and or rotis. Not forgetting to mention that the bakery table has a variety of Sri Lankan buns - from fish buns to seeni sambol (devilled onions) buns which are entirely unique to Sri Lanka. 
I do hope you return to Sri Lanka and Camelot so that we can showcase our Sri Lankan Culinary delights. 

Thank you 
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-03-17', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column10: Lower floor rooms with access to the beach and barbecue area
column12:
This hotel is situated with the access to the Negombo beach view. There are various categories of rooms. Rooms with no view ,rooms with partial view of the beach. Rooms with full view of the sea. Lowe floor rooms with balconies open to the swimming pool.
We arrived a day earlier without booking so we aroom with no view  then upgraded to a better room the next day.
The hotel had more Europeans on the low budget stay. The restaurant breakfast were filled with various types of buns and cakes. I didn‚Äôt see anything Sri Lankan other then chutneys

column5:
{'id': '942605588', 'text': 'Dear Alan224, 

Thank you for your review. I am sorry about the flooding that took place in the room. I do hope you brought it up with our team so that we could have recitified the issue immediately. 

Negombo is definitely used as a transit stop by many but we most certainly have long stay guests with us as well. Some have been with us from more than 1 month. 

I look forward to welcoming you back so that we can offer you a better experience.

column12: Perfect hotel to start a journey in Sri Lanka.  Not to far from the airport.  Friendly staff.  Room ok but bathroom door was not sliding properly. Sea view.  We had lunch at the pool, chicken fried rice & chicken fried noodles.  Nice pool.  Restaurant in buffet; food was good.
column13: Perfect hotel to start a journey in Sri Lanka

column12: We spent 8 nights at Camelot Beach. The hotel is in a great beach front location and the gardens and pool area are spacious and well laid out. The hotel was very clean and the bedroom was well equipped. The service in the restaurant was excellent as was the food and choice of dishes, the presentation and range of deserts was amazing. We experienced outstanding customer service throughout our stay, everyone was so helpful and attentive, special mention for Ananda (front office) and Dulakshi (Guest Relations Officer) for exceptional customer care. We look forward to an another visit to Camelot Beach.

rent a catamaran from the beach for an hour sail ( with captain!)

column12: Everything you need for a friendly, clean, modern and comfortable hotel by the sea, not too far from Colombo airport. Modern and spacious rooms, a pleasant pool and pool cafe. And  a fabulous massage (thank you Sampath- hope I got your name right). The front desk helped with first aid, money exchange and many of the unexpected complications of travel.  They are a friendly and efficient team.  Excuse me if I spell your names wrong or forget anyone - Leshan, Cherinda, Dulakdhsni, Sapun. Well done and thank you everyone.
column13: Comfortable, modern and friendly medium sized hotel on Negombo Beach, not far from the airport.

column12:
A lovely hotel with kind and attentive staff with great breakfasts. The hotel is only a short walk to the beach and provides free airport shuttle services. The communication with them before staying to arrange the airport shuttle was great. 

If you‚Äôre looking for a location with a lot to do around the hotel, this isn‚Äôt the one for you, but if you‚Äôre looking for a nice base for the start or end of your holiday, or a break at some point within your holiday, I think this hotel is perfect.
column13: A lovely hotel with kind and attentive staff

column12: We only stayed one night at this hotel at the beginning of our SL trip, well located for BIA, the team were very helpful in getting our rooms ready early which was greatly appreciated.  Rooms were clean and well appointed and the team v welcoming and helpful.  The Sri Lankan breakfast was good too.

column5:
{'id': '962602123', 'text': "Dear Guest,

We appreciate your tip about our hidden location and the roof terrace. Your insights are invaluable to future guests.

We look forward to welcoming you and your family back on your next adventure in Sri Lanka!

Management Team

column12: A lovely little hotel with fabulous staff and brilliant food. Tucked away in Negombo but great access to all amenities. A perfect place to rest after a flight before continuing your adventure. Very comfortable spacious rooms, a very warm welcome, hugely friendly staff and superb local cuisine.
column13: A fabulous post flight stopover and introduction to Sri Lanka

column12:
We chose the Belmont for its proximity to the airport. Arriving late at night we wanted a close hotel to start our SriLanka holiday. 
It is a lovely hotel. Rooms are large and well appointed. good bed, nice bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is outstanding, the sri lankan option delicious - see photo. The pool is very nice. Highly recommedned.

column5:
{'id': '958034003', 'text': "

Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for your wonderful review! We are delighted to hear that you had a great stay with us at Belmont Boutique Hotel. It's fantastic to know that our concierge service was able to assist you promptly and that you enjoyed the rooftop terrace, clean and comfortable rooms, and the lovely pool. Our team takes pride in being welcoming and accommodating, and your kind words mean a lot to us.

column12: Excellent concierge found us a tuk tuk and boat tour at an hour's notice. We loved the rooftop terrace then took a short tuk tuk ride to dinner at a beach restaurant. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the pool was lovely. All staff were welcoming and accommodating.

column5:
{'id': '958033847', 'text': "
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to write such a wonderful and detailed review of your recent stay at the Belmont Boutique Hotel. Your kind words truly warm our hearts and serve as a testament to the hard work and dedication of our team.

We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed our airport pick-up and drop-off service, which we offer as part of our commitment to making your stay as convenient and stress-free as possible. It's wonderful to know that you found your room spacious and inviting, with options that cater to different preferences. Our team takes great care in ensuring that every guest experiences a comfortable and restful night's sleep, so it's gratifying to hear that our mattresses met your expectations.

The cleanliness and comfort of our rooms and bathrooms are of utmost importance to us, and we are pleased to hear that you found them to be nice and clean. We strive to provide all the necessary amenities, including shampoo, soap, and toilet paper, to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Your compliments about our restaurant are especially appreciated. We pride ourselves on offering a variety of freshly made meals to cater to diverse tastes, and it's fantastic to hear that you absolutely enjoyed the food. Our chefs will be thrilled to know that their efforts have made such a positive impression.

We are also pleased that you found our Wi-Fi connection to be very good. Staying connected is essential for many of our guests, and we aim to provide a reliable service.

Our small pool is one of the features we are proud of, and we are glad you had the opportunity to enjoy it. It's designed to offer a relaxing space for our guests to unwind.

Lastly, your kind words about our staff are greatly appreciated. We believe that friendly and helpful service is at the heart of a great hospitality experience, and we are thrilled to hear that our team made your stay enjoyable.

Thank you once again for your thoughtful review. It means the world to us to know that you plan to return to the Belmont Boutique Hotel. We look forward to welcoming you back and providing you with another memorable stay.

Warmest regards,
", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-07-04', 'responder': 'Nicola Dabrera', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column12:
A lovely little hotel also offers airport pick up and drop off, which are included in the hotel price. The room and bathroom are nice and clean.
Rooms ‚Äì Spacious and inviting, with the option of a very large bed or twin beds. The mattresses, with a firmness rating of 3.5 out of 5, are designed to ensure you have a restful night's sleep. The rooms also feature a sofa and luggage stand for your convenience.
Bathroom ‚Äì nice bathroom. Shampoo, soap and toilet paper provided.
Restaurant ‚Äì Great food I absolutely enjoyed the meals. There are plenty of choices, and they are freshly made once placing the order.
Wi-Fi connection ‚Äì The hotel had a very good Wi-Fi connection
Pool ‚Äì a small pool is located in this hotel.
Staff ‚Äì Very friendly and helpful staff.
I will return to this hotel.

column12:
A great Boutique Hotel only a short drive from the airport. A complimentary transfer was nice. We stayed for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay here. 
The breakfasts were amazing both English and Sri Lankan. Lunch was awesome too. One of the reasons we chose to stay here was the great reviews for the food and they didn‚Äôt disappoint. 
The bed was extremely comfortable, the service was fabulous, the food was excellent and we really enjoyed our pool time. 
Highly recommend this great place to stay whilst in Negombo.

column5:
{'id': '941346619', 'text': 'Dear Sajad,

column12:
I would like to start with a warm thank you to the staffs as well as the chefs.Their kind gestures made our day.
  
We can‚Äôt forget the architecture of the captivating hotel that left us fascinated.

The rooms we‚Äôve got-not to complain were clean and bright-with an alright view.Bathrooms and hygiene products were all set for the better.

The food and desserts are to die for! I appreciate the chefs and workers helping out setting it in an amazing layout;and the clear blue pool next to the neighboring food tables are also peaceful and clean. 

I have no words in what I feel about the rooftop balcony.Really cool and relaxing.

Everything about this boutique hotel is surrounded by an absolute calm atmosphere.I don‚Äôt regret one bit staying the vacation along my buddies.

I highly recommend Belmont Boutique Hotel ! :)

column12:
This is a hidden gem. It seems situated in an odd spot but it really is not - fantastic safe location that is close to everything you need. Not that you need to go out for much at all as the staff, food, drinks, pool, rooftop view and well appointed room make it a very hard placd to leave.
The complimentary drop off to airport and ‚Äòcan do‚Äô attitude throughout our stay was first class. When we next visit Sri Lanka, this will be our first and then last place to stay. 
Can not speak highly enough of our stay here.
column13: Fantastic way to start and finish beautiful Sri Lanka

column5:
{'id': '935211392', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at Belmont Boutique Hotel. Your feedback is invaluable in our constant endeavor to provide an exceptional stay for all our guests.

We are thrilled to hear that our concept of being a technical stopover for Westerners near the airport resonated well with you. Our strategic location and complimentary shuttle service are indeed designed to cater to travelers seeking convenience and efficiency in their transit. It is gratifying to know that our efforts in ensuring clean and well-equipped rooms have been appreciated. We understand how crucial these aspects are for a comfortable stay, especially when one is in transit and time is of the essence.

Regarding your observation about the noise levels, we truly empathize with your experience. Providing a peaceful and relaxing environment is a priority for us, and it seems we fell short of this goal during your stay. We are constantly working on ways to minimize external noise and improve sound insulation in our rooms. Rest assured, your feedback will be discussed with our team to explore further improvements in this area.

Your comment about the shuttle service is particularly concerning. While we strive to provide efficient transportation to the airport, it is paramount that this is done safely and comfortably. Your feedback about the driving style of our shuttle driver is being taken very seriously. We will address this with our transportation team to ensure that our drivers adhere to the highest standards of safety and sensitivity towards our guests' comfort.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused and would like to assure you that your concerns are being addressed with the utmost seriousness. We are committed to not only meeting but exceeding the expectations of our guests.

It is feedback like yours that enables us to fine-tune our services. We hope that despite these issues, you will consider Belmont Boutique Hotel for your future travels, giving us the opportunity to provide you with a better experience.

Thank you once again for your valuable feedback.

Warm regards,

Belmont Boutique Hotel", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-24', 'responder': 'Nicola Dabrera', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '23932183', 'name': 'Belmont Boutique Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 152, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.235011, 'longitude': 79.842575, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d23932183-Reviews-Belmont_Boutique_Hotel-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/hotelbelmontlk', 'address': '82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '82/5, Cemetery Road', 'street2': 'Ettukala', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 148}}
column12:
The hotel's owner has implemented a very effective concept to make this place a technical stopover for Westerners close to the airport.
The rooms are very clean and nicely equipped, and the free shuttle service is very efficient, making it possible to catch a plane in less than 30 minutes.
On the other hand, the place is noisy and the night is trying. The shuttle driver could drive more carefully and sensitively.

column5:
{'id': '934023077', 'text': "Dear valued guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience at the Belmont boutique hotel. We are absolutely delighted to hear that your stay with us was nothing short of perfection in paradise!

Your kind words about our staff warm our hearts. It's our goal to provide exceptional service, and we're thrilled to know that our team was friendly, welcoming, and accommodating throughout your stay. Building connections with our guests is something we cherish, and we're grateful that you had the chance to get to know some of our team members.

We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the breathtaking views, delightful weather, and the overall ambiance of our property. Our commitment to excellence extends to every aspect of your experience, from the moment you step onto our property to the moment you reluctantly leave. It's rewarding to know that you found our dining options to be first-rate and eclectic. We strive to offer a culinary experience that complements the beauty of our surroundings.

It warms our hearts to hear that your room exceeded your expectations. Comfort is paramount to us, and we're pleased that you found the beds and pillows to be amazing. We understand the struggle of wanting to stay in such a cozy haven, but the promise of paradise outside beckons!

Your description of starting the day with a healthy breakfast followed by a refreshing swim in our spotless and impressive pool captures the essence of the tranquil experience we aim to provide. We're pleased to hear that you could enjoy these amenities without feeling crowded, allowing you to unwind and make the most of your time with us.

We empathize with the sentiment of wishing for a shorter journey to reach our haven of relaxation. We truly appreciate your loyalty, and we assure you that whenever you decide to return, we'll be here to welcome you with open arms and continue providing the exceptional experience you deserve.

Once again, thank you for choosing the Belmont boutique hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback, and we look forward to the day when we can welcome you back to paradise for another unforgettable stay.

Warm regards,
The Belmont Team", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-14', 'responder': 'Nicola Dabrera', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column12: From the moment we arrived on the property I was thoroughly impressed with the service and treatment that was received at the Belmont.  The staff was friendly, welcoming and completely accommodating at all times. I got to know some of them very well and they are truly good people.  The location, views and weather were amazing.  The dining is first rate and eclectic. The room was flawless , comfortable, with amazing beds and pillows: I didn‚Äôt want to get out of bed in the morning but I knew that paradise awaited.  I just felt so relaxed, starting the morning with healthy breakfast and then a swim in the pool which was spotless and impressive and never crowded.  Then afternoon at the beach. If it didn‚Äôt take a full 24 hours to get there, my husband and I would definitely return every year!!!

column5:
{'id': '933368166', 'text': "Dear valued guest,

We sincerely appreciate your extensive feedback on your recent stay at Belmont Boutique Hotel. It brings us immense joy to hear that your experience, from the moment of check-in until departure, was nothing short of incredible. We understand the weariness that comes with a long flight, and we are delighted that our smooth check-in process helped you transition seamlessly into relaxation mode.

It is particularly heartening to receive compliments from someone with over twenty years of experience in luxury hotels in NYC. Your acknowledgment of our staff's dedication to exceeding expectations is truly gratifying. At Belmont Boutique Hotel, we strive to go above and beyond standard operating procedures to create a memorable and exceptional experience for our guests.

We are pleased to hear that you found our rooms to be subtly minimal, aligning with your preferences. Our housekeeping team takes pride in ensuring the utmost cleanliness and comfort for our guests, and we are thrilled to learn that their efforts were appreciated during your stay.

Your positive remarks about our rooftop bar and food service are truly appreciated. We extend your compliments to our chef and the entire food service team for their attentiveness, efficiency, and the constant warmth they bring to their service.

The combination of our pool and convenient access to the beach aims to provide a diverse and enjoyable experience for our guests, and we are glad to hear that you found them excellent. The fact that you didn't want to leave after 5 days of vacation is the highest compliment we could receive.

Thank you for highly recommending Belmont Boutique Hotel as a place in paradise. We look forward to welcoming you back in the future, and we hope your return to NYC and work is smooth until the next time you seek a well-deserved retreat with us.

Warm regards,

The Belmont Boutique Hotel Team", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-01-09', 'responder': 'Nicola Dabrera', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '23932183', 'name': 'Belmont Boutique Hotel', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 152, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.235011, 'longitude': 79.842575, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d23932183-Reviews-Belmont_Boutique_Hotel-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.facebook.com/hotelbelmontlk', 'address': '82/5, Cemetery Road Ettukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '82/5, Cemetery Road', 'street2': 'Ettukala', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 1, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 148}}
column12:
A hidden gem in paradise‚Ä¶ Incredible from the moment of check-in until departure. I didn‚Äôt want to leave!!

After a never ending flight and travel to the hotel one can only hope for a smooth check -in to get into the room and fast as possible!

We were picked up from the airport (complimentary) and driven a short distance to the hotel and were greeted with smiles and efficiency. 

I‚Äôve worked in luxury hotels in NYC for over twenty years and I am familiar with the standard operating procedures that are required to get star rating and I have to say that the staff went above and beyond meeting and anticipating expectations.

The rooms were subtle and minimal which i love and housekeeping was superb!!! The rooftop bar and food were excellent and I want to compliment the chef and everyone in food service. They are attentive, efficient and always smiling. 

The pool and close access to the beach were excellent and after 5 days of being on vacation I can‚Äôt wait to return to NYC and get back to work but I really did not want to leave.

Highly recommend this place in paradise!!!

column5:
{'id': '933166553', 'text': "Dear Chris,

Thank you so much for your incredibly heartwarming review of your stay at Belmont Boutique Hotel. We are overjoyed to hear that your experience surpassed expectations and that you found our staff and service to be exceptional.

It warms our hearts to know that you enjoyed the comfort and luxury of your room, along with the breathtaking view of the beach. It's delightful to hear that the allure of the scenery almost convinced you to stay in and relish the tranquility rather than exploring the local sights.

We are thrilled that our culinary offerings, especially the Sri Lankan chicken curry, left a lasting impression. Our chefs take great pride in creating memorable dining experiences, and it's fantastic to hear that they succeeded in delighting your taste buds.

The description of the rooftop bar experience with its 360-degree view of coconut trees and the sea brings a smile to our faces. We designed the rooftop bar to be a haven for our guests, providing not just a drink but an immersive and unforgettable panorama. We are delighted to learn that it left an epic impression on you.

Your enthusiasm to return is the highest compliment we could receive, and we can't wait to welcome you back to Belmont Boutique Hotel. Your kind words motivate us to continue providing exceptional hospitality, ensuring that your next visit is even more memorable.

Once again, thank you for choosing Belmont Boutique Hotel, and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

column12:
This was one of the finest experiences I‚Äôve ever had traveling abroad. 

The staff and service were way beyond expectations.

column12: This hotel was absolutely beautiful in every way. A great peaceful location and spotlessly clean. The staff were amazing, friendly and helpful.  They provided a free airport pickup then provided a special service. The included breakfast was also excellent I would recommend the hotel to any travellers without hesitation.

Lovely welcome with a refreshing drink and efficient check-in. Our room was very spacious and of a good standard. Beautiful sea view and a nice balcony to watch amazing sunsets. 
Big choice of fresh and tasty food for dinner and breakfast in the lovely dining room overlooking the beach. All staff were very friendly and professional.

column10: Make time explore, people are so friendly. Don't get ripped off by expensive tours and taxis, download Pickme app for taxi and tuk tuk.
column12:
We are currently on our last few days of a 2 week stay at Goldi Sands. We are half board and have used this hotel as a base whilst exploring the West and south of this beautiful country. Our sea view room is large, bright and kept spotlessly clean, it has air conditioning, a ceiling fan to keep you cool and fresh. Bathroom is spacious with a large rainfall shower and toiletries provided. You have a kettle, tea and coffee, a mini fridge and hairdryer. Laundry service is excellent value for money. I must mention that all staff work extremely hard every day to maintain the high standards of cleanliness, they are so friendly and welcoming, thank you. The food is absolutely delicious, dinner is especially good, with local and international dishes every night, desserts and salads particularly outstanding. We would like to say special thanks to the food and beverage staff and magnificent chefs. This is a low key hotel, no loud thumping disco or rowdy games around the pool, so if you want lively nightlife, this is not the hotel for you. If you want to relax, be indulged and get some zen, then you won't be disappointed. This is not your usual package tour hotel, the majority of guests are international and just spend a few nights passing through.
The only disappointment we had (no fault of the hotel) is not being able to swim in the sea, far too rough, but the pools are a lovely alternative.
Well done Goldi Sands Staff team, and thank you.
column13: Clean, comfortable hotel with exceptional service

column10: The jacuzzi  never on . Dont give in easily.
column12:
We booked two deluxe family rooms & paid the deposit .When we arrived they confirmed the booking ,but wanted us to make the full payment before check-in,which we did .When we went to our rooms ,there were only two single beds in each rooms where as it should be one large kings bed & one single bed .The person in the check in said that is all available .We refused to accept after already paying .Finally after 20minutes he called the manager .Surprise,Surprise .The manager without further arguments ,offered the rooms which we have paid for . We noticed other tourists sitting in the reception area ,having similar problems!
The rooms were comfortable with views.The domestic & restaurant staff were very good .For breakfast unless you go early food will be in short supply!  No refilling of sausages,croissants etc!
column13: Not the rooms which you paid for.

column5:
{'id': '952549963', 'text': 'Dear Guest, 
Greetings from Goldi Sands Hotel!

Thank you very much for an event by event running commentary of your experiences at Goldi sands hotel which would be most valuable for our intended travelers. 
Thank you for pointing out the operation manual for bed side switches, which is highly informative for our maintenance department. 

Special thank you for highlighting the pinecolad, ‚Äúwhich appeared to be made of liquid chalk.‚Äù 
We are glad to hear that you enjoy the Srilankan beer and other services of the bar staff.
 
The issues with the cats and dogs are being brought under control. Some of the guests feed them and they attend to come and hang around at the restaurant. 
We are trying our best to solve the problem by chasing them away, even though it is not to the liking of some guest. 
We appreciate your comment on the food and we will look into the fish curry.
We have started giving music lessons to a couple of our musician who perform during the week. 

All in all, we are glad to hear your valuable comments and look forward to seeing you again at Goldi Sands Hotel. However we regret any inconvenience caused and rest assured, we look forward to seeing you in the near future.

Thank you, 
The management. 
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-05-27', 'responder': 'Administration Manager Goldisands', 'connectionToSubject': 'Other'}
column6: {'id': '316666', 'name': 'Hotel Goldi Sands', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1621, 'locationString': 'Negombo, Western Province', 'latitude': 7.24535, 'longitude': 79.84174, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g297897-d316666-Reviews-Hotel_Goldi_Sands-Negombo_Western_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.goldisands.com/', 'address': 'Poruthota Road Ethukala, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Poruthota Road', 'street2': 'Ethukala', 'city': 'Negombo', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '11500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 64, 'count2': 62, 'count3': 232, 'count4': 609, 'count5': 654}}
column12:
Our first trip to Sri Lanka is a 2-week all-inclusive package deal with TUI. We step out from the airport into the bewildering heat and humidity and are soon on our way to the Hotel Goldi Sands, around 20 mins drive. The welcome from the front desk is just as warm and within 10 minutes we are shown to our room. We get room 103 - the last one on the North end of the hotel. It's late but first impressions are that it's clean and spacious, if a little tired around the edges...which is exactly how we feel after a VERY long day flying, so it's off to bed without even unpacking.

The next morning allows us time to explore the room and hotel more thoroughly. If you've ever enjoyed a stay in a UK 3-star hotel then you won't find anything to complain about here. Being on the edge of the hotel means we get the largest balcony - a good 4m wide and around 8m long - which we soon discover gives us the sun earlier than all the rooms to the left of us. As for the room itself - well, it's pretty basic. The beds are firm (which I like) but always refreshed each day. The cupboards and drawers are from the 1980s but, again, enough for me and the ABSOLUTE MOUNTAIN OF CLOTHES my wife brought. The patio door makes a horrific squealing noise when you close it. The shower controls are incomprehensible. The TV remote and set-top box need a PhD in quantum physics to operate them. The electrical socket on my wife's side doesn't work unless the bedside lamp is turned on. There's a dial on my side that operates an unseen radio appearing to only receive signals from Mars. And the ceiling fan clatters rhythmically on all settings apart from "1". But it's our home and we soon grow to love returning to its air-conditioned bliss every night after sweaty trips out.

As for the rest of the hotel - it's very good overall. Set on a massive beach with fringes of palm trees, it's facing West so every night (weather permitting) we're treated to the most beautiful sunsets. All the local families come down each evening to watch the sun dip below the horizon, the local kids play football on the beach, and it's mostly wonderful. Yes, there are beach vendors trying to sell you stuff but that's part and parcel of a place like this. And while I understand Sri Lanka has much nicer beaches further South - if you've ever trudged around shoddy UK seaside towns (you know who you are), this part of the Negombo coastline will seem like heaven.

Back to the hotel bar and it's time for a few drinks. The local Lion beer is very quaffable and there's a number of decent cocktails available for all-inclusive (just avoid the Pina Colada, as it appears to be made from liquid chalk). The bar staff are brilliant - I never have to wait more than a minute or two to get a drink - and very friendly.

Then it's time for dinner. We're seated along the edge of restaurant nearest the lawn which we soon discover is the starting point for the local stray dogs and cats to beg for food. The dogs look at us imploringly with their...er...puppy-dog eyes. The cats yow plaintively. But we can't feed them. Oh, no - warning signs tell us it would be a bad idea. And it is. One unsuspecting German couple drop a small piece of chicken on the floor and all Hell breaks loose. Barking, fighting...it's literally a dog's dinner. We laugh and go back to our meal which is, frankly, delicious. Every night there's a themed buffet (Italian, Mexican, BBQ) in which the hotel chefs do a fantastic job cooking up some genuinely tasty stuff. And, every night, there's a section devoted entirely to Sri Lankan food. I'm a curry fan so this is a particular treat. In fact, I end up having curry for breakfast, lunch, and dinner for 2 weeks. And it's all really good quality. String hoppers, daal, curries in white, red, green, and black, kottu - it's all fabulous and worth trying if you're into spicy food. For the less adventurous, blander options are available. I should point out that some of the dishes are very rustic, so a fish curry will not just contain great chunks of fish, but also bones and scales and the rest. Hey, you're in Sri Lanka, not McDonalds. The restaurant staff are equally lovely, bringing us more drinks and giving us lessons on how to say 'don't feed the dogs' in Sinhala.

As we tuck into our okra coconut curry and sambal, the hotel 'entertainment' starts up. Tonight, it's a guy playing saxophone to backing tracks of Western rock songs. It's utterly hilarious as this local Sri Lankan tries to navigate the unfamiliar territory of Baker Street or Bryan Adams. Faltering phrases, bum notes - it's all here and I'm loving it for all the wrong reasons. A couple of evenings later and we have a trio of two guitarists and a singer. The singer looks either bored or terrified, and at least one of the guitarists hasn't tuned his instrument. It's chaotically beautiful.

We enjoy the hotel pools on several occasions and even have a dip in the sea which, although quite rough, we are amazed to find is as warm as bathwater. And we walk up and down the beach which is mostly devoid of plastic bottles, sweltering in the heat and trying to avoid the beach-sellers. We did venture outside the hotel - so if you want to read my reviews of the places we visited, check those out.

All in all, the Hotel Goldi Sands is a great hotel. The staff are very pleasant, the (Sri Lankan) food is superb, and the whole place is clean and quiet. Oh wait...did I say quiet? I forgot about the crows....
column13: Very good, with a few rough edges

column12:
This was our third visit to this wonderful hotel sitting next to the Indian Ocean, sadly I think it
will be our last stay.
The hotel, facilities, food and particularly the staff are all first class. We had a room on the first
floor of the original building which as ever was charming, well appointed and a fantastic sea
view.
Although we are not a particular fan of buffet style meals the food presented was tasty, varied and 
plentiful. We were All inclusive and its a shame that wine is NOT included in the package, even one
glass at dinner would be appreciated.
Pool, beach both excellent .
My main reason for not returning is the Managements decision to cater mainly for large groups that only stay
for one night. Every day there is a constant procession of guests arriving/departing, overwhelming the restaurant
and spoiling the ambiance of the pool/beach area. Long stay guests appear to be less looked after in favour
of the one nighters.
That said I must give a special mention to some of the staff that made our stay so memorable, although all the staff
are brilliant. Samantha and his pool team, Sanjeewa in the bar,Ruchira,Ruvee and Mohan in the restaurant.
Well done Goldi Sands *
column13: Third visit but probably our last.........................

column12: I should really thank the team and Mr.Nimanka specifically because they really helped me throughout the reservation to departure. The vegan/vegetarian food was carefully curated by the professional chefs and I'd recommend the food to be best curated vegan/vegetarian cuisine. column10: Visit the swimming pool at the other Jetwing hotel too - it's really big and on the beach!
column12: Beautiful hotel, complete peaceful haven, perfect start to my holiday.  Treatments were great - always felt so relaxed afterwards, and Danika, my massage therapist, was very friendly and considerate. Early morning yoga was lovely (and teacher could speak fluent Japanese too!).  And the food was amazing - delicate flavours and textures, beautifully presented.

column12: This hotel is beautiful and peaceful.  All the staff were helpful and gentle.  The Ayuverdic treatments were relaxing, and the food and drink was delicious - all prepared individually to complement the Ayuverdic plan.  The beach is an easy few minutes walk away, as is the other Jetwing hotel with its large beach-side swimming pool which is available for the Pavilions' residents' use.  Staying here was exactly the right start to my holiday in Sri Lanka.

column10: you can also purchase  traditional organic rice from the hotel or good market opposite Jetwing beach.
column12:
Dear fellow traveller,

If you seek absolute peace, pampering and a relaxed holiday to de-stress and unwind this is the place. Just under one hour drive from Colombo we arrived at this beautiful hotel in Negombo. To  find tranquility and lush greenery was no doubt a wonderful surprise.

The warm traditional and meaningful welcome did set the tone for our stay, we knew we were going to be very well taken care of and that... they most certainly did! Much thanks to Mr. Nimanka, Mr. Kalaka and all FO staff.

Rooms: We initially booked the Classic room but upon inspection we realised for a two nights, three day treatment it felt a bit congested-like though clean and beautiful for us hence we opted for the next category - the Queen villa. The villa was quite spacious, immaculate and well structured. The little frontage  with pool beds, coffee table, garden chairs and massage beds in an enclosed space was perfect for our privacy. Amenities - well provided for a 4* hotel. We did meet the HK manager who inquired whether everything was to our liking and satisfaction,  kudos to all HK staff for their service. Rooms, surrounding buildings  and every inch of the property was extremely clean and well maintained.

Food & Restaurant:  Vegan or Vegetarian meals as per doctor's recommendations. My husband and I both had different meal plans. The food was delicious, creative and a work of art on a plate for a fact. They always obliged me with my lime juice made exactly to my liking. Much praise to the Chef ( we spoke in length of nutritional facts and he gave me fabulous tips in trying out healthy dishes at home - I cannot  recall the name sadly), servers : Ms. Nileesha, Mr. Hashan and Mr. Hishan were wonderfully kind.

It was a pleasure to have met .Mr. Samith, he was very informative and welcoming .

Doctors: Dr.Anuradha & Dr. Harshini were quite thorough with their area of expertise. Gentle and well-mannered doctors, made us feel quite comfortable and explained in length our treatments beforehand. Special note of thanks to Dr. Anuradha for taking the time and trouble to get me a printed copy of hair masks which I received upon checking out - was pleasantly surprised.

Treatments : About two hours and fifteen minutes of different treatments  per day after daily consultations with the doctors. This included full body massages to facials to oil treatments to sauna and much more. TOTALLY WORTH IT!!!! It was Heavenly.  Blessing and merit to both Ms. Romen & Mr. Amila - they were both just brilliant!

My husband attended the Yoga classes in the morning - he said the instructor was fantastic.

I cannot emphasize enough especially to the local traveller : Jetwing pavilions is a hidden gem, a bit too well hidden I must say. You will definitely not be disappointed.

Note to the maagement of Jetwing : your staff in most of your hotels are quite hospitable in keeping with our local heritage but ALL your staff at pavilions are exceptionally kind, well trained and reflects the very best of Sri Lankan hospitality.

Thank you for a wonderful and memorable stay, we will visit you in the near future.
Smith Family.
column13: Do not put off till tomorrow what can be enjoyed today. ( Josh Billings 1818-1885)

column10: Go with an open mind
column12:
What an amazing experience. Long massages (best we have ever had) every day, facials, warm oil treatments, body scrubs, steam guns and so much more. I can't believe how relaxed and flexible we felt at the end.

We had a consultation with a doctor every day and a report at the end. The medicines had a calming effect. We slept like logs. Our food was tailored as per our ayurveda type, which was fascinating. 

The pool was wonderful for lazy lengths. The various classes they ran were fascinating. 

At the end we both purchased medicine to take home with us - they charged us 3 x the amount on the jar/pots so that was disappointing and not a nice surprise. However, back here in England the medicine would still cost more than we were charged but transparency would have been preferable. 

The whole experience has been life changing.

column12:
What an incredible experience we had at Jetwing!  

First, our room was lovely and very clean. The housekeeping staff did a wonderful job at attending to it and ensuring we had what we needed. 

The food - it was the most beautiful and tasteful food I have had in my life!  Truly, the chef should have a website with recipes. Absolutely fantastic!

The waitstaff in the dining room were exceptional. They anticipated everything we may want. We felt so pampered!

The doctors we met with for our wellness retreat were thorough and communicated well. And the therapists who provided the treatments - such professionalism and competency!  Absolute bliss!

The ground were beautiful and be from morning to evening the groundskeepers were attending to keeping it impeccable. 

And those at the reception desk were so extremely responsive and friendly to any need we had. They made us feel so welcome!

It is without reservation ion that I give a 5 star recommendation to Jetwing. If I could give 10, I would!
column13: An incredible experience because of the incredible people at Jetwing
